content: 1 The words of Jeremiah son of Hilkiah, one of the priests at Anathoth in the territory of Benjamin.
content_old: 1 The words of Jeremiah son of Hilkiah, one of the priests at Anathoth in the territory of Benjamin.

content: 2 The word of the LORD came to him in the days of King Josiah son of Amon of Judah, in the thirteenth year of his reign,
content_old: 2 The word of the LORD came to him in the days of King Josiah son of Amon of Judah, in the thirteenth year of his reign,

content: 3 and throughout the days of King Jehoiakim son of Josiah of Judah, and until the end of the eleventh year of King Zedekiah son of Josiah of Judah, when Jerusalem went into exile in the fifth month.
content_old: 3 and throughout the days of King Jehoiakim son of Josiah of Judah, and until the end of the eleventh year of King Zedekiah son of Josiah of Judah, when Jerusalem went into exile in the fifth month.

content: 4 The word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 4 The word of the LORD came to me:

content: 5 Before I created you in the womb, I selected you; Before you were born, I consecrated you; I appointed you a prophet concerning the nations.
content_old: 5 Before I created you in the womb, I selected you; Before you were born, I consecrated you; I appointed you a prophet concerning the nations.

content: 6 I replied: Ah, Lord GOD! I don’t know how to speak, For I am still a boy.
content_old: 6 I replied: Ah, Lord GOD! I don’t know how to speak, For I am still a boy.

content: 7 And the LORD said to me: Do not say, “I am still a boy,” But go wherever I send you And speak whatever I command you.
content_old: 7 And the LORD said to me: Do not say, “I am still a boy,” But go wherever I send you And speak whatever I command you.

content: 8 Have no fear of them, For I am with you to deliver you —declares the LORD.
content_old: 8 Have no fear of them, For I am with you to deliver you —declares the LORD.

content: 9 The LORD put out His hand and touched my mouth, and the LORD said to me: Herewith I put My words into your mouth.
content_old: 9 The LORD put out His hand and touched my mouth, and the LORD said to me: Herewith I put My words into your mouth.

content: 10 See, I appoint you this day Over nations and kingdoms: To uproot and to pull down, To destroy and to overthrow, To build and to plant.
content_old: 10 See, I appoint you this day Over nations and kingdoms: To uproot and to pull down, To destroy and to overthrow, To build and to plant.

content: 11 The word of the LORD came to me: What do you see, Jeremiah? I replied: I see a branch of an almond tree.
content_old: 11 The word of the LORD came to me: What do you see, Jeremiah? I replied: I see a branch of an almond tree.

content: 12 The LORD said to me: You have seen right, For I am watchful to bring My word to pass.
content_old: 12 The LORD said to me: You have seen right, For I am watchful to bring My word to pass.

content: 13 And the word of the LORD came to me a second time: What do you see? I replied: I see a steaming pot, Tipped away from the north.
content_old: 13 And the word of the LORD came to me a second time: What do you see? I replied: I see a steaming pot, Tipped away from the north.

content: 14 And the LORD said to me: From the north shall disaster break loose Upon all the inhabitants of the land!
content_old: 14 And the LORD said to me: From the north shall disaster break loose Upon all the inhabitants of the land!

content: 15 For I am summoning all the peoples of the kingdoms of the north —declares the LORD. They shall come, and shall each set up a throne Before the gates of Jerusalem, Against its walls roundabout, And against all the towns of Judah.
content_old: 15 For I am summoning all the peoples of the kingdoms of the north —declares the LORD. They shall come, and shall each set up a throne Before the gates of Jerusalem, Against its walls roundabout, And against all the towns of Judah.

content: 16 And I will argue My case against them For all their wickedness: They have forsaken Me And sacrificed to other gods And worshiped the works of their hands.
content_old: 16 And I will argue My case against them For all their wickedness: They have forsaken Me And sacrificed to other gods And worshiped the works of their hands.

content: 17 So you, gird up your loins, Arise and speak to them All that I command you. Do not break down before them, Lest I break you before them.
content_old: 17 So you, gird up your loins, Arise and speak to them All that I command you. Do not break down before them, Lest I break you before them.

content: 18 I make you this day A fortified city, And an iron pillar, And bronze walls Against the whole land— Against Judah’s kings and officers, And against its priests and citizens.
content_old: 18 I make you this day A fortified city, And an iron pillar, And bronze walls Against the whole land— Against Judah’s kings and officers, And against its priests and citizens.

content: 1 The word of the LORD came to me, saying,
content_old: 1 The word of the LORD came to me, saying,

content: 2 Go proclaim to Jerusalem: Thus said the LORD: I accounted to your favor The devotion of your youth, Your love as a bride— How you followed Me in the wilderness, In a land not sown.
content_old: 2 Go proclaim to Jerusalem: Thus said the LORD: I accounted to your favor The devotion of your youth, Your love as a bride— How you followed Me in the wilderness, In a land not sown.

content: 3 Israel was holy to the LORD, The first fruits of His harvest. All who ate of it were held guilty; Disaster befell them —declares the LORD.
content_old: 3 Israel was holy to the LORD, The first fruits of His harvest. All who ate of it were held guilty; Disaster befell them —declares the LORD.

content: 4 Hear the word of the LORD, O House of Jacob, Every clan of the House of Israel!
content_old: 4 Hear the word of the LORD, O House of Jacob, Every clan of the House of Israel!

content: 5 Thus said the LORD: What wrong did your fathers find in Me That they abandoned Me And went after delusion and were deluded?
content_old: 5 Thus said the LORD: What wrong did your fathers find in Me That they abandoned Me And went after delusion and were deluded?

content: 6 They never asked themselves, “Where is the LORD, Who brought us up from the land of Egypt, Who led us through the wilderness, A land of deserts and pits, A land of drought and darkness, A land no man had traversed, Where no human being had dwelt?”
content_old: 6 They never asked themselves, “Where is the LORD, Who brought us up from the land of Egypt, Who led us through the wilderness, A land of deserts and pits, A land of drought and darkness, A land no man had traversed, Where no human being had dwelt?”

content: 7 I brought you to this country of farm land To enjoy its fruit and its bounty; But you came and defiled My land, You made My possession abhorrent.
content_old: 7 I brought you to this country of farm land To enjoy its fruit and its bounty; But you came and defiled My land, You made My possession abhorrent.

content: 8 The priests never asked themselves, “Where is the LORD?” The guardians of the Teaching ignored Me; The rulers rebelled against Me, And the prophets prophesied by Baal And followed what can do no good.
content_old: 8 The priests never asked themselves, “Where is the LORD?” The guardians of the Teaching ignored Me; The rulers rebelled against Me, And the prophets prophesied by Baal And followed what can do no good.

content: 9 Oh, I will go on accusing you —declares the LORD— And I will accuse your children’s children!
content_old: 9 Oh, I will go on accusing you —declares the LORD— And I will accuse your children’s children!

content: 10 Just cross over to the isles of the Kittim and look, Send to Kedar and observe carefully; See if aught like this has ever happened:
content_old: 10 Just cross over to the isles of the Kittim and look, Send to Kedar and observe carefully; See if aught like this has ever happened:

content: 11 Has any nation changed its gods Even though they are no-gods? But My people has exchanged its glory For what can do no good.
content_old: 11 Has any nation changed its gods Even though they are no-gods? But My people has exchanged its glory For what can do no good.

content: 12 Be appalled, O heavens, at this; Be horrified, utterly dazed! —says the LORD.
content_old: 12 Be appalled, O heavens, at this; Be horrified, utterly dazed! —says the LORD.

content: 13 For My people have done a twofold wrong: They have forsaken Me, the Fount of living waters, And hewed them out cisterns, broken cisterns, Which cannot even hold water.
content_old: 13 For My people have done a twofold wrong: They have forsaken Me, the Fount of living waters, And hewed them out cisterns, broken cisterns, Which cannot even hold water.

content: 14 Is Israel a bondman? Is he a home-born slave? Then why is he given over to plunder?
content_old: 14 Is Israel a bondman? Is he a home-born slave? Then why is he given over to plunder?

content: 15 Lions have roared over him, Have raised their cries. They have made his land a waste, His cities desolate, without inhabitants.
content_old: 15 Lions have roared over him, Have raised their cries. They have made his land a waste, His cities desolate, without inhabitants.

content: 16 Those, too, in Noph and Tahpanhes Will lay bare your head.
content_old: 16 Those, too, in Noph and Tahpanhes Will lay bare your head.

content: 17 See, that is the price you have paid For forsaking the LORD your God While He led you in the way.
content_old: 17 See, that is the price you have paid For forsaking the LORD your God While He led you in the way.

content: 18 What, then, is the good of your going to Egypt To drink the waters of the Nile? And what is the good of your going to Assyria To drink the waters of the Euphrates?
content_old: 18 What, then, is the good of your going to Egypt To drink the waters of the Nile? And what is the good of your going to Assyria To drink the waters of the Euphrates?

content: 19 Let your misfortune reprove you, Let your afflictions rebuke you; Mark well how bad and bitter it is That you forsake the LORD your God, That awe for Me is not in you —declares the Lord GOD of Hosts.
content_old: 19 Let your misfortune reprove you, Let your afflictions rebuke you; Mark well how bad and bitter it is That you forsake the LORD your God, That awe for Me is not in you —declares the Lord GOD of Hosts.

content: 20 For long ago you broke your yoke, Tore off your yoke-bands, And said, “I will not work!” On every high hill and under every verdant tree, You recline as a whore.
content_old: 20 For long ago you broke your yoke, Tore off your yoke-bands, And said, “I will not work!” On every high hill and under every verdant tree, You recline as a whore.

content: 21 I planted you with noble vines, All with choicest seed; Alas, I find you changed Into a base, an alien vine!
content_old: 21 I planted you with noble vines, All with choicest seed; Alas, I find you changed Into a base, an alien vine!

content: 22 Though you wash with natron And use much lye, Your guilt is ingrained before Me —declares the Lord GOD.
content_old: 22 Though you wash with natron And use much lye, Your guilt is ingrained before Me —declares the Lord GOD.

content: 23 How can you say, “I am not defiled, I have not gone after the Baalim”? Look at your deeds in the Valley, Consider what you have done! Like a lustful she-camel, Restlessly running about,
content_old: 23 How can you say, “I am not defiled, I have not gone after the Baalim”? Look at your deeds in the Valley, Consider what you have done! Like a lustful she-camel, Restlessly running about,

content: 24 Or like a wild ass used to the desert, Snuffing the wind in her eagerness, Whose passion none can restrain, None that seek her need grow weary— In her season, they’ll find her!
content_old: 24 Or like a wild ass used to the desert, Snuffing the wind in her eagerness, Whose passion none can restrain, None that seek her need grow weary— In her season, they’ll find her!

content: 25 Save your foot from going bare, And your throat from thirst. But you say, “It is no use. No, I love the strangers, And after them I must go.”
content_old: 25 Save your foot from going bare, And your throat from thirst. But you say, “It is no use. No, I love the strangers, And after them I must go.”

content: 26 Like a thief chagrined when he is caught, So is the House of Israel chagrined— They, their kings, their officers, And their priests and prophets.
content_old: 26 Like a thief chagrined when he is caught, So is the House of Israel chagrined— They, their kings, their officers, And their priests and prophets.

content: 27 They said to wood, “You are my father,” To stone, “You gave birth to me,” While to Me they turned their backs And not their faces. But in their hour of calamity they cry, “Arise and save us!”
content_old: 27 They said to wood, “You are my father,” To stone, “You gave birth to me,” While to Me they turned their backs And not their faces. But in their hour of calamity they cry, “Arise and save us!”

content: 28 And where are those gods You made for yourself? Let them arise and save you, if they can, In your hour of calamity. For your gods have become, O Judah, As many as your towns!
content_old: 28 And where are those gods You made for yourself? Let them arise and save you, if they can, In your hour of calamity. For your gods have become, O Judah, As many as your towns!

content: 29 Why do you call Me to account? You have all rebelled against Me —declares the LORD.
content_old: 29 Why do you call Me to account? You have all rebelled against Me —declares the LORD.

content: 30 To no purpose did I smite your children; They would not accept correction. Your sword has devoured your prophets Like a ravening lion.
content_old: 30 To no purpose did I smite your children; They would not accept correction. Your sword has devoured your prophets Like a ravening lion.

content: 31 O generation, behold the word of the LORD! Have I been like a desert to Israel, Or like a land of deep gloom? Then why do My people say, “We have broken loose, We will not come to You any more?”
content_old: 31 O generation, behold the word of the LORD! Have I been like a desert to Israel, Or like a land of deep gloom? Then why do My people say, “We have broken loose, We will not come to You any more?”

content: 32 Can a maiden forget her jewels, A bride her adornments? Yet My people have forgotten Me— Days without number.
content_old: 32 Can a maiden forget her jewels, A bride her adornments? Yet My people have forgotten Me— Days without number.

content: 33 How skillfully you plan your way To seek out love! Why, you have even taught The worst of women your ways.
content_old: 33 How skillfully you plan your way To seek out love! Why, you have even taught The worst of women your ways.

content: 34 Moreover, on your garments is found The lifeblood of the innocent poor— You did not catch them breaking in. Yet, despite all these things,
content_old: 34 Moreover, on your garments is found The lifeblood of the innocent poor— You did not catch them breaking in. Yet, despite all these things,

content: 35 You say, “I have been acquitted; Surely, His anger has turned away from me.” Lo, I will bring you to judgment For saying, “I have not sinned.”
content_old: 35 You say, “I have been acquitted; Surely, His anger has turned away from me.” Lo, I will bring you to judgment For saying, “I have not sinned.”

content: 36 How you cheapen yourself, By changing your course! You shall be put to shame through Egypt, Just as you were put to shame through Assyria.
content_old: 36 How you cheapen yourself, By changing your course! You shall be put to shame through Egypt, Just as you were put to shame through Assyria.

content: 1  as follows: If a man divorces his wife, and she leaves him and marries another man, can he ever go back to her? Would not such a land be defiled? Now you have whored with many lovers: can you return to Me?—says the LORD.
content_old: 1  as follows: If a man divorces his wife, and she leaves him and marries another man, can he ever go back to her? Would not such a land be defiled? Now you have whored with many lovers: can you return to Me?—says the LORD.

content: 2 Look up to the bare heights, and see: Where have they not lain with you? You waited for them on the roadside Like a bandit in the wilderness. And you defiled the land With your whoring and your debauchery.
content_old: 2 Look up to the bare heights, and see: Where have they not lain with you? You waited for them on the roadside Like a bandit in the wilderness. And you defiled the land With your whoring and your debauchery.

content: 3 And when showers were withheld And the late rains did not come, You had the brazenness of a street woman, You refused to be ashamed.
content_old: 3 And when showers were withheld And the late rains did not come, You had the brazenness of a street woman, You refused to be ashamed.

content: 4 Just now you called to Me, “Father! You are the Companion of my youth.
content_old: 4 Just now you called to Me, “Father! You are the Companion of my youth.

content: 5 Does one hate for all time? Does one rage forever?” That is how you spoke; You did wrong, and had your way.
content_old: 5 Does one hate for all time? Does one rage forever?” That is how you spoke; You did wrong, and had your way.

content: 6 The LORD said to me in the days of King Josiah: Have you seen what Rebel Israel did, going to every high mountain and under every leafy tree, and whoring there?
content_old: 6 The LORD said to me in the days of King Josiah: Have you seen what Rebel Israel did, going to every high mountain and under every leafy tree, and whoring there?

content: 7 I thought: After she has done all these things, she will come back to Me. But she did not come back; and her sister, Faithless Judah, saw it.
content_old: 7 I thought: After she has done all these things, she will come back to Me. But she did not come back; and her sister, Faithless Judah, saw it.

content: 8 I noted: Because Rebel Israel had committed adultery, I cast her off and handed her a bill of divorce; yet her sister, Faithless Judah, was not afraid—she too went and whored.
content_old: 8 I noted: Because Rebel Israel had committed adultery, I cast her off and handed her a bill of divorce; yet her sister, Faithless Judah, was not afraid—she too went and whored.

content: 9 Indeed, the land was defiled by her casual immorality, as she committed adultery with stone and with wood.
content_old: 9 Indeed, the land was defiled by her casual immorality, as she committed adultery with stone and with wood.

content: 10 And after all that, her sister, Faithless Judah, did not return to Me wholeheartedly, but insincerely—declares the LORD.
content_old: 10 And after all that, her sister, Faithless Judah, did not return to Me wholeheartedly, but insincerely—declares the LORD.

content: 11 And the LORD said to me: Rebel Israel has shown herself more in the right than Faithless Judah.
content_old: 11 And the LORD said to me: Rebel Israel has shown herself more in the right than Faithless Judah.

content: 12 Go, make this proclamation toward the north, and say: Turn back, O Rebel Israel—declares the LORD. I will not look on you in anger, for I am compassionate—declares the LORD; I do not bear a grudge for all time.
content_old: 12 Go, make this proclamation toward the north, and say: Turn back, O Rebel Israel—declares the LORD. I will not look on you in anger, for I am compassionate—declares the LORD; I do not bear a grudge for all time.

content: 13 Only recognize your sin; for you have transgressed against the LORD your God, and scattered your favors among strangers under every leafy tree, and you have not heeded Me—declares the LORD.
content_old: 13 Only recognize your sin; for you have transgressed against the LORD your God, and scattered your favors among strangers under every leafy tree, and you have not heeded Me—declares the LORD.

content: 14 Turn back, rebellious children—declares the LORD. Since I have espoused you, I will take you, one from a town and two from a clan, and bring you to Zion.
content_old: 14 Turn back, rebellious children—declares the LORD. Since I have espoused you, I will take you, one from a town and two from a clan, and bring you to Zion.

content: 15 And I will give you shepherds after My own heart, who will pasture you with knowledge and skill.
content_old: 15 And I will give you shepherds after My own heart, who will pasture you with knowledge and skill.

content: 16 And when you increase and are fertile in the land, in those days—declares the LORD—men shall no longer speak of the Ark of the Covenant of the LORD, nor shall it come to mind. They shall not mention it, or miss it, or make another.
content_old: 16 And when you increase and are fertile in the land, in those days—declares the LORD—men shall no longer speak of the Ark of the Covenant of the LORD, nor shall it come to mind. They shall not mention it, or miss it, or make another.

content: 17 At that time, they shall call Jerusalem “Throne of the LORD,” and all nations shall assemble there, in the name of the LORD, at Jerusalem. They shall no longer follow the willfulness of their evil hearts.
content_old: 17 At that time, they shall call Jerusalem “Throne of the LORD,” and all nations shall assemble there, in the name of the LORD, at Jerusalem. They shall no longer follow the willfulness of their evil hearts.

content: 18 In those days, the House of Judah shall go with the House of Israel; they shall come together from the land of the north to the land I gave your fathers as a possession.
content_old: 18 In those days, the House of Judah shall go with the House of Israel; they shall come together from the land of the north to the land I gave your fathers as a possession.

content: 19 I had resolved to adopt you as My child, and I gave you a desirable land—the fairest heritage of all the nations; and I thought you would surely call Me “Father,” and never cease to be loyal to Me.
content_old: 19 I had resolved to adopt you as My child, and I gave you a desirable land—the fairest heritage of all the nations; and I thought you would surely call Me “Father,” and never cease to be loyal to Me.

content: 20 Instead, you have broken faith with Me, as a woman breaks faith with a paramour, O House of Israel—declares the LORD.
content_old: 20 Instead, you have broken faith with Me, as a woman breaks faith with a paramour, O House of Israel—declares the LORD.

content: 21 Hark! On the bare heights is heard The suppliant weeping of the people of Israel, For they have gone a crooked way, Ignoring the LORD their God.
content_old: 21 Hark! On the bare heights is heard The suppliant weeping of the people of Israel, For they have gone a crooked way, Ignoring the LORD their God.

content: 22 Turn back, O rebellious children, I will heal your afflictions! “Here we are, we come to You, For You, O LORD, are our God!
content_old: 22 Turn back, O rebellious children, I will heal your afflictions! “Here we are, we come to You, For You, O LORD, are our God!

content: 23 Surely, futility comes from the hills, Confusion from the mountains. Only through the LORD our God Is there deliverance for Israel.
content_old: 23 Surely, futility comes from the hills, Confusion from the mountains. Only through the LORD our God Is there deliverance for Israel.

content: 24 But the Shameful Thing has consumed The possessions of our fathers ever since our youth— Their flocks and herds, Their sons and daughters.
content_old: 24 But the Shameful Thing has consumed The possessions of our fathers ever since our youth— Their flocks and herds, Their sons and daughters.

content: 1 If you return, O Israel —declares the LORD— If you return to Me, If you remove your abominations from My presence And do not waver,
content_old: 1 If you return, O Israel —declares the LORD— If you return to Me, If you remove your abominations from My presence And do not waver,

content: 2 And swear, “As the LORD lives,” In sincerity, justice, and righteousness— Nations shall bless themselves by you And praise themselves by you.
content_old: 2 And swear, “As the LORD lives,” In sincerity, justice, and righteousness— Nations shall bless themselves by you And praise themselves by you.

content: 3 For thus said the LORD to the men of Judah and to Jerusalem: Break up the untilled ground, And do not sow among thorns.
content_old: 3 For thus said the LORD to the men of Judah and to Jerusalem: Break up the untilled ground, And do not sow among thorns.

content: 4 Open your hearts to the LORD, Remove the thickening about your hearts— O men of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem— Lest My wrath break forth like fire, And burn, with none to quench it, Because of your wicked acts.
content_old: 4 Open your hearts to the LORD, Remove the thickening about your hearts— O men of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem— Lest My wrath break forth like fire, And burn, with none to quench it, Because of your wicked acts.

content: 5 Proclaim in Judah, Announce in Jerusalem, And say: “Blow the horn in the land!” Shout aloud and say: “Assemble, and let us go Into the fortified cities!”
content_old: 5 Proclaim in Judah, Announce in Jerusalem, And say: “Blow the horn in the land!” Shout aloud and say: “Assemble, and let us go Into the fortified cities!”

content: 6 Set up a signpost: To Zion. Take refuge, do not delay! For I bring evil from the north, And great disaster.
content_old: 6 Set up a signpost: To Zion. Take refuge, do not delay! For I bring evil from the north, And great disaster.

content: 7 The lion has come up from his thicket: The destroyer of nations has set out, Has departed from his place, To make your land a desolation; Your cities shall be ruined, Without inhabitants.
content_old: 7 The lion has come up from his thicket: The destroyer of nations has set out, Has departed from his place, To make your land a desolation; Your cities shall be ruined, Without inhabitants.

content: 8 For this, put on sackcloth, Mourn and wail; For the blazing anger of the LORD Has not turned away from us.
content_old: 8 For this, put on sackcloth, Mourn and wail; For the blazing anger of the LORD Has not turned away from us.

content: 9 And in that day —declares the LORD— The mind of the king And the mind of the nobles shall fail, The priests shall be appalled, And the prophets shall stand aghast.
content_old: 9 And in that day —declares the LORD— The mind of the king And the mind of the nobles shall fail, The priests shall be appalled, And the prophets shall stand aghast.

content: 10 And I said: Ah, Lord GOD! Surely You have deceived this people and Jerusalem, saying: It shall be well with you— Yet the sword threatens the very life!
content_old: 10 And I said: Ah, Lord GOD! Surely You have deceived this people and Jerusalem, saying: It shall be well with you— Yet the sword threatens the very life!

content: 11 At that time, it shall be said concerning this people and Jerusalem: The conduct of My poor people is like searing wind From the bare heights of the desert— It will not serve to winnow or to fan.
content_old: 11 At that time, it shall be said concerning this people and Jerusalem: The conduct of My poor people is like searing wind From the bare heights of the desert— It will not serve to winnow or to fan.

content: 12 A full blast from them comes against Me: Now I in turn will bring charges against them.
content_old: 12 A full blast from them comes against Me: Now I in turn will bring charges against them.

content: 13 Lo, he ascends like clouds, His chariots are like a whirlwind, His horses are swifter than eagles. Woe to us, we are ruined!
content_old: 13 Lo, he ascends like clouds, His chariots are like a whirlwind, His horses are swifter than eagles. Woe to us, we are ruined!

content: 14 Wash your heart clean of wickedness, O Jerusalem, that you may be rescued. How long will you harbor within you Your evil designs?
content_old: 14 Wash your heart clean of wickedness, O Jerusalem, that you may be rescued. How long will you harbor within you Your evil designs?

content: 15 Hark, one proclaims from Dan And announces calamity from Mount Ephraim!
content_old: 15 Hark, one proclaims from Dan And announces calamity from Mount Ephraim!

content: 16 Tell the nations: Here they are! Announce concerning Jerusalem: Watchers are coming from a distant land, They raise their voices against the towns of Judah.
content_old: 16 Tell the nations: Here they are! Announce concerning Jerusalem: Watchers are coming from a distant land, They raise their voices against the towns of Judah.

content: 17 Like guards of fields, they surround her on every side. For she has rebelled against Me —declares the LORD.
content_old: 17 Like guards of fields, they surround her on every side. For she has rebelled against Me —declares the LORD.

content: 18 Your conduct and your acts Have brought this upon you; This is your bitter punishment; It pierces your very heart.
content_old: 18 Your conduct and your acts Have brought this upon you; This is your bitter punishment; It pierces your very heart.

content: 19 Oh, my suffering, my suffering! How I writhe! Oh, the walls of my heart! My heart moans within me, I cannot be silent; For I hear the blare of horns, Alarms of war.
content_old: 19 Oh, my suffering, my suffering! How I writhe! Oh, the walls of my heart! My heart moans within me, I cannot be silent; For I hear the blare of horns, Alarms of war.

content: 20 Disaster overtakes disaster, For all the land has been ravaged. Suddenly my tents have been ravaged, In a moment, my tent cloths.
content_old: 20 Disaster overtakes disaster, For all the land has been ravaged. Suddenly my tents have been ravaged, In a moment, my tent cloths.

content: 21 How long must I see standards And hear the blare of horns?
content_old: 21 How long must I see standards And hear the blare of horns?

content: 22 For My people are stupid, They give Me no heed; They are foolish children, They are not intelligent. They are clever at doing wrong, But unable to do right.
content_old: 22 For My people are stupid, They give Me no heed; They are foolish children, They are not intelligent. They are clever at doing wrong, But unable to do right.

content: 23 I look at the earth, It is unformed and void; At the skies, And their light is gone.
content_old: 23 I look at the earth, It is unformed and void; At the skies, And their light is gone.

content: 24 I look at the mountains, They are quaking; And all the hills are rocking.
content_old: 24 I look at the mountains, They are quaking; And all the hills are rocking.

content: 25 I look: no man is left, And all the birds of the sky have fled.
content_old: 25 I look: no man is left, And all the birds of the sky have fled.

content: 26 I look: the farm land is desert, And all its towns are in ruin— Because of the LORD, Because of His blazing anger.
content_old: 26 I look: the farm land is desert, And all its towns are in ruin— Because of the LORD, Because of His blazing anger.

content: 27 For thus said the LORD: The whole land shall be desolate, But I will not make an end of it.
content_old: 27 For thus said the LORD: The whole land shall be desolate, But I will not make an end of it.

content: 28 For this the earth mourns, And skies are dark above— Because I have spoken, I have planned, And I will not relent or turn back from it.
content_old: 28 For this the earth mourns, And skies are dark above— Because I have spoken, I have planned, And I will not relent or turn back from it.

content: 29 At the shout of horseman and bowman The whole city flees. They enter the thickets, They clamber up the rocks. The whole city is deserted, Not a man remains there.
content_old: 29 At the shout of horseman and bowman The whole city flees. They enter the thickets, They clamber up the rocks. The whole city is deserted, Not a man remains there.

content: 30 And you, who are doomed to ruin, What do you accomplish by wearing crimson, By decking yourself in jewels of gold, By enlarging your eyes with kohl? You beautify yourself in vain: Lovers despise you, They seek your life!
content_old: 30 And you, who are doomed to ruin, What do you accomplish by wearing crimson, By decking yourself in jewels of gold, By enlarging your eyes with kohl? You beautify yourself in vain: Lovers despise you, They seek your life!

content: 1 Roam the streets of Jerusalem, Search its squares, Look about and take note: You will not find a man, There is none who acts justly, Who seeks integrity— That I should pardon her.
content_old: 1 Roam the streets of Jerusalem, Search its squares, Look about and take note: You will not find a man, There is none who acts justly, Who seeks integrity— That I should pardon her.

content: 2 Even when they say, “As the LORD lives,” They are sure to be swearing falsely.
content_old: 2 Even when they say, “As the LORD lives,” They are sure to be swearing falsely.

content: 3 O LORD, Your eyes look for integrity. You have struck them, but they sensed no pain; You have consumed them, but they would accept no discipline. They made their faces harder than rock, They refused to turn back.
content_old: 3 O LORD, Your eyes look for integrity. You have struck them, but they sensed no pain; You have consumed them, but they would accept no discipline. They made their faces harder than rock, They refused to turn back.

content: 4 Then I thought: These are just poor folk; They act foolishly; For they do not know the way of the LORD, The rules of their God.
content_old: 4 Then I thought: These are just poor folk; They act foolishly; For they do not know the way of the LORD, The rules of their God.

content: 5 So I will go to the wealthy And speak with them: Surely they know the way of the LORD, The rules of their God. But they as well had broken the yoke, Had snapped the bonds.
content_old: 5 So I will go to the wealthy And speak with them: Surely they know the way of the LORD, The rules of their God. But they as well had broken the yoke, Had snapped the bonds.

content: 6 Therefore, The lion of the forest strikes them down, The wolf of the desert ravages them. A leopard lies in wait by their towns; Whoever leaves them will be torn in pieces. For their transgressions are many, Their rebellious acts unnumbered.
content_old: 6 Therefore, The lion of the forest strikes them down, The wolf of the desert ravages them. A leopard lies in wait by their towns; Whoever leaves them will be torn in pieces. For their transgressions are many, Their rebellious acts unnumbered.

content: 7 Why should I forgive you? Your children have forsaken Me And sworn by no-gods. When I fed them their fill, They committed adultery And went trooping to the harlot’s house.
content_old: 7 Why should I forgive you? Your children have forsaken Me And sworn by no-gods. When I fed them their fill, They committed adultery And went trooping to the harlot’s house.

content: 8 They were well-fed, lusty stallions, Each neighing at another’s wife.
content_old: 8 They were well-fed, lusty stallions, Each neighing at another’s wife.

content: 9 Shall I not punish such deeds? —says the LORD— Shall I not bring retribution On a nation such as this?
content_old: 9 Shall I not punish such deeds? —says the LORD— Shall I not bring retribution On a nation such as this?

content: 10 Go up among her vines and destroy; Lop off her trailing branches, For they are not of the LORD. But do not make an end.
content_old: 10 Go up among her vines and destroy; Lop off her trailing branches, For they are not of the LORD. But do not make an end.

content: 11 For the House of Israel and the House of Judah Have betrayed Me —declares the LORD.
content_old: 11 For the House of Israel and the House of Judah Have betrayed Me —declares the LORD.

content: 12 They have been false to the LORD And said: “It is not so! No trouble shall come upon us, We shall not see sword or famine.
content_old: 12 They have been false to the LORD And said: “It is not so! No trouble shall come upon us, We shall not see sword or famine.

content: 13 The prophets shall prove mere wind For the Word is not in them; Thus-and-thus shall be done to them!”
content_old: 13 The prophets shall prove mere wind For the Word is not in them; Thus-and-thus shall be done to them!”

content: 14 Assuredly, thus said the LORD, The God of Hosts: Because they said that, I am putting My words into your mouth as fire, And this people shall be firewood, Which it will consume.
content_old: 14 Assuredly, thus said the LORD, The God of Hosts: Because they said that, I am putting My words into your mouth as fire, And this people shall be firewood, Which it will consume.

content: 15 Lo, I am bringing against you, O House of Israel, A nation from afar —declares the LORD; It is an enduring nation, It is an ancient nation; A nation whose language you do not know— You will not understand what they say.
content_old: 15 Lo, I am bringing against you, O House of Israel, A nation from afar —declares the LORD; It is an enduring nation, It is an ancient nation; A nation whose language you do not know— You will not understand what they say.

content: 16 Their quivers are like a yawning grave— They are all mighty men.
content_old: 16 Their quivers are like a yawning grave— They are all mighty men.

content: 17 They will devour your harvest and food, They will devour your sons and daughters, They will devour your flocks and herds, They will devour your vines and fig trees. They will batter down with the sword The fortified towns on which you rely.
content_old: 17 They will devour your harvest and food, They will devour your sons and daughters, They will devour your flocks and herds, They will devour your vines and fig trees. They will batter down with the sword The fortified towns on which you rely.

content: 18 But even in those days—declares the LORD—I will not make an end of you.
content_old: 18 But even in those days—declares the LORD—I will not make an end of you.

content: 19 And when they ask, “Because of what did the LORD our God do all these things?” you shall answer them, “Because you forsook Me and served alien gods on your own land, you will have to serve foreigners in a land not your own.”
content_old: 19 And when they ask, “Because of what did the LORD our God do all these things?” you shall answer them, “Because you forsook Me and served alien gods on your own land, you will have to serve foreigners in a land not your own.”

content: 20 Proclaim this to the House of Jacob And announce it in Judah:
content_old: 20 Proclaim this to the House of Jacob And announce it in Judah:

content: 21 Hear this, O foolish people, Devoid of intelligence, That have eyes but can’t see, That have ears but can’t hear!
content_old: 21 Hear this, O foolish people, Devoid of intelligence, That have eyes but can’t see, That have ears but can’t hear!

content: 22 Should you not revere Me —says the LORD— Should you not tremble before Me, Who set the sand as a boundary to the sea, As a limit for all time, not to be transgressed? Though its waves toss, they cannot prevail; Though they roar, they cannot pass it.
content_old: 22 Should you not revere Me —says the LORD— Should you not tremble before Me, Who set the sand as a boundary to the sea, As a limit for all time, not to be transgressed? Though its waves toss, they cannot prevail; Though they roar, they cannot pass it.

content: 23 Yet this people has a wayward and defiant heart; They have turned aside and gone their way.
content_old: 23 Yet this people has a wayward and defiant heart; They have turned aside and gone their way.

content: 24 They have not said to themselves, “Let us revere the LORD our God, Who gives the rain, The early and late rain in season, Who keeps for our benefit The weeks appointed for harvest.”
content_old: 24 They have not said to themselves, “Let us revere the LORD our God, Who gives the rain, The early and late rain in season, Who keeps for our benefit The weeks appointed for harvest.”

content: 25 It is your iniquities that have diverted these things, Your sins that have withheld the bounty from you.
content_old: 25 It is your iniquities that have diverted these things, Your sins that have withheld the bounty from you.

content: 26 For among My people are found wicked men, Who lurk, like fowlers lying in wait; They set up a trap to catch men.
content_old: 26 For among My people are found wicked men, Who lurk, like fowlers lying in wait; They set up a trap to catch men.

content: 27 As a cage is full of birds, So their houses are full of guile; That is why they have grown so wealthy.
content_old: 27 As a cage is full of birds, So their houses are full of guile; That is why they have grown so wealthy.

content: 28 They have become fat and sleek; They pass beyond the bounds of wickedness, And they prosper. They will not judge the case of the orphan, Nor give a hearing to the plea of the needy.
content_old: 28 They have become fat and sleek; They pass beyond the bounds of wickedness, And they prosper. They will not judge the case of the orphan, Nor give a hearing to the plea of the needy.

content: 29 Shall I not punish such deeds —says the LORD— Shall I not bring retribution On a nation such as this?
content_old: 29 Shall I not punish such deeds —says the LORD— Shall I not bring retribution On a nation such as this?

content: 30 An appalling, horrible thing Has happened in the land:
content_old: 30 An appalling, horrible thing Has happened in the land:

content: 1 Flee for refuge, O people of Benjamin, Out of the midst of Jerusalem! Blow the horn in Tekoa, Set up a signal at Beth-haccherem! For evil is appearing from the north, And great disaster.
content_old: 1 Flee for refuge, O people of Benjamin, Out of the midst of Jerusalem! Blow the horn in Tekoa, Set up a signal at Beth-haccherem! For evil is appearing from the north, And great disaster.

content: 2 Fair Zion, the lovely and delicate, I will destroy.
content_old: 2 Fair Zion, the lovely and delicate, I will destroy.

content: 3 Against her come shepherds with their flocks, They pitch tents all around her; Each grazes the sheep under his care.
content_old: 3 Against her come shepherds with their flocks, They pitch tents all around her; Each grazes the sheep under his care.

content: 4 Prepare for battle against her: “Up! we will attack at noon.” “Alas for us! for day is declining, The shadows of evening grow long.”
content_old: 4 Prepare for battle against her: “Up! we will attack at noon.” “Alas for us! for day is declining, The shadows of evening grow long.”

content: 5 “Up! let us attack by night, And wreck her fortresses.”
content_old: 5 “Up! let us attack by night, And wreck her fortresses.”

content: 6 For thus said the LORD of Hosts: Hew down her trees, And raise a siegemound against Jerusalem. She is the city destined for punishment; Only fraud is found in her midst.
content_old: 6 For thus said the LORD of Hosts: Hew down her trees, And raise a siegemound against Jerusalem. She is the city destined for punishment; Only fraud is found in her midst.

content: 7 As a well flows with water, So she flows with wickedness. Lawlessness and rapine are heard in her; Before Me constantly are sickness and wounds.
content_old: 7 As a well flows with water, So she flows with wickedness. Lawlessness and rapine are heard in her; Before Me constantly are sickness and wounds.

content: 8 Accept rebuke, O Jerusalem, Lest I come to loathe you, Lest I make you a desolation, An uninhabited land.
content_old: 8 Accept rebuke, O Jerusalem, Lest I come to loathe you, Lest I make you a desolation, An uninhabited land.

content: 9 Thus said the LORD of Hosts: Let them glean over and over, as a vine, The remnant of Israel. Pass your hand again, Like a vintager, Over its branches.
content_old: 9 Thus said the LORD of Hosts: Let them glean over and over, as a vine, The remnant of Israel. Pass your hand again, Like a vintager, Over its branches.

content: 10 To whom shall I speak, Give warning that they may hear? Their ears are blocked And they cannot listen. See, the word of the LORD has become for them An object of scorn; they will have none of it.
content_old: 10 To whom shall I speak, Give warning that they may hear? Their ears are blocked And they cannot listen. See, the word of the LORD has become for them An object of scorn; they will have none of it.

content: 11 But I am filled with the wrath of the LORD, I cannot hold it in. Pour it on the infant in the street, And on the company of youths gathered together! Yes, men and women alike shall be captured, Elders and those of advanced years.
content_old: 11 But I am filled with the wrath of the LORD, I cannot hold it in. Pour it on the infant in the street, And on the company of youths gathered together! Yes, men and women alike shall be captured, Elders and those of advanced years.

content: 12 Their houses shall pass to others, Fields and wives as well, For I will stretch out My arm Against the inhabitants of the country —declares the LORD.
content_old: 12 Their houses shall pass to others, Fields and wives as well, For I will stretch out My arm Against the inhabitants of the country —declares the LORD.

content: 13 For from the smallest to the greatest, They are all greedy for gain; Priest and prophet alike, They all act falsely.
content_old: 13 For from the smallest to the greatest, They are all greedy for gain; Priest and prophet alike, They all act falsely.

content: 14 They offer healing offhand For the wounds of My people, Saying, “All is well, all is well,” When nothing is well.
content_old: 14 They offer healing offhand For the wounds of My people, Saying, “All is well, all is well,” When nothing is well.

content: 15 They have acted shamefully; They have done abhorrent things— Yet they do not feel shame, And they cannot be made to blush. Assuredly, they shall fall among the falling, They shall stumble at the time when I punish them —said the LORD.
content_old: 15 They have acted shamefully; They have done abhorrent things— Yet they do not feel shame, And they cannot be made to blush. Assuredly, they shall fall among the falling, They shall stumble at the time when I punish them —said the LORD.

content: 16 Thus said the LORD: Stand by the roads and consider, Inquire about ancient paths: Which is the road to happiness? Travel it, and find tranquillity for yourselves. But they said, “We will not.”
content_old: 16 Thus said the LORD: Stand by the roads and consider, Inquire about ancient paths: Which is the road to happiness? Travel it, and find tranquillity for yourselves. But they said, “We will not.”

content: 17 And I raised up watchmen for you: “Hearken to the sound of the horn!” But they said, “We will not.”
content_old: 17 And I raised up watchmen for you: “Hearken to the sound of the horn!” But they said, “We will not.”

content: 18 Hear well, O nations, And know, O community, what is in store for them.
content_old: 18 Hear well, O nations, And know, O community, what is in store for them.

content: 19 Hear, O earth! I am going to bring disaster upon this people, The outcome of their own schemes; For they would not hearken to My words, And they rejected My Instruction.
content_old: 19 Hear, O earth! I am going to bring disaster upon this people, The outcome of their own schemes; For they would not hearken to My words, And they rejected My Instruction.

content: 20 What need have I of frankincense That comes from Sheba, Or fragrant cane from a distant land? Your burnt offerings are not acceptable And your sacrifices are not pleasing to Me.
content_old: 20 What need have I of frankincense That comes from Sheba, Or fragrant cane from a distant land? Your burnt offerings are not acceptable And your sacrifices are not pleasing to Me.

content: 21 Assuredly, thus said the LORD: I shall put before this people stumbling blocks Over which they shall stumble— Fathers and children alike, Neighbor and friend shall perish.
content_old: 21 Assuredly, thus said the LORD: I shall put before this people stumbling blocks Over which they shall stumble— Fathers and children alike, Neighbor and friend shall perish.

content: 22 Thus said the LORD: See, a people comes from the northland, A great nation is roused From the remotest parts of the earth.
content_old: 22 Thus said the LORD: See, a people comes from the northland, A great nation is roused From the remotest parts of the earth.

content: 23 They grasp the bow and javelin; They are cruel, they show no mercy; The sound of them is like the roaring sea. They ride upon horses, Accoutered like a man for battle, Against you, O Fair Zion!
content_old: 23 They grasp the bow and javelin; They are cruel, they show no mercy; The sound of them is like the roaring sea. They ride upon horses, Accoutered like a man for battle, Against you, O Fair Zion!

content: 24 “We have heard the report of them, Our hands fail; Pain seizes us, Agony like a woman in childbirth.
content_old: 24 “We have heard the report of them, Our hands fail; Pain seizes us, Agony like a woman in childbirth.

content: 25 Do not go out into the country, Do not walk the roads! For the sword of the enemy is there, Terror on every side.”
content_old: 25 Do not go out into the country, Do not walk the roads! For the sword of the enemy is there, Terror on every side.”

content: 26 My poor people, Put on sackcloth And strew dust on yourselves! Mourn, as for an only child; Wail bitterly, For suddenly the destroyer Is coming upon us.
content_old: 26 My poor people, Put on sackcloth And strew dust on yourselves! Mourn, as for an only child; Wail bitterly, For suddenly the destroyer Is coming upon us.

content: 27 I have made you an assayer of My people —A refiner— You are to note and assay their ways.
content_old: 27 I have made you an assayer of My people —A refiner— You are to note and assay their ways.

content: 28 They are copper and iron: They are all stubbornly defiant; They deal basely All of them act corruptly.
content_old: 28 They are copper and iron: They are all stubbornly defiant; They deal basely All of them act corruptly.

content: 29 The bellows puff; The lead is consumed by fire. Yet the smelter smelts to no purpose— The dross is not separated out.
content_old: 29 The bellows puff; The lead is consumed by fire. Yet the smelter smelts to no purpose— The dross is not separated out.

content: 1 The word which came to Jeremiah from the LORD:
content_old: 1 The word which came to Jeremiah from the LORD:

content: 2 Stand at the gate of the House of the LORD, and there proclaim this word: Hear the word of the LORD, all you of Judah who enter these gates to worship the LORD!
content_old: 2 Stand at the gate of the House of the LORD, and there proclaim this word: Hear the word of the LORD, all you of Judah who enter these gates to worship the LORD!

content: 3 Thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: Mend your ways and your actions, and I will let you dwell in this place.
content_old: 3 Thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: Mend your ways and your actions, and I will let you dwell in this place.

content: 4 Don’t put your trust in illusions and say, “The Temple of the LORD, the Temple of the LORD, the Temple of the LORD are these.”
content_old: 4 Don’t put your trust in illusions and say, “The Temple of the LORD, the Temple of the LORD, the Temple of the LORD are these.”

content: 5 No, if you really mend your ways and your actions; if you execute justice between one man and another;
content_old: 5 No, if you really mend your ways and your actions; if you execute justice between one man and another;

content: 6 if you do not oppress the stranger, the orphan, and the widow; if you do not shed the blood of the innocent in this place; if you do not follow other gods, to your own hurt—
content_old: 6 if you do not oppress the stranger, the orphan, and the widow; if you do not shed the blood of the innocent in this place; if you do not follow other gods, to your own hurt—

content: 7 then only will I let you dwell in this place, in the land that I gave to your fathers for all time.
content_old: 7 then only will I let you dwell in this place, in the land that I gave to your fathers for all time.

content: 8 See, you are relying on illusions that are of no avail.
content_old: 8 See, you are relying on illusions that are of no avail.

content: 9 Will you steal and murder and commit adultery and swear falsely, and sacrifice to Baal, and follow other gods whom you have not experienced,
content_old: 9 Will you steal and murder and commit adultery and swear falsely, and sacrifice to Baal, and follow other gods whom you have not experienced,

content: 10 and then come and stand before Me in this House which bears My name and say, “We are safe”?—to do all these abhorrent things!
content_old: 10 and then come and stand before Me in this House which bears My name and say, “We are safe”?—to do all these abhorrent things!

content: 11 Do you consider this House, which bears My name, to be a den of thieves? As for Me, I have been watching—declares the LORD.
content_old: 11 Do you consider this House, which bears My name, to be a den of thieves? As for Me, I have been watching—declares the LORD.

content: 12 Just go to My place at Shiloh, where I had established My name formerly, and see what I did to it because of the wickedness of My people Israel.
content_old: 12 Just go to My place at Shiloh, where I had established My name formerly, and see what I did to it because of the wickedness of My people Israel.

content: 13 And now, because you do all these things—declares the LORD—and though I spoke to you persistently, you would not listen; and though I called to you, you would not respond—
content_old: 13 And now, because you do all these things—declares the LORD—and though I spoke to you persistently, you would not listen; and though I called to you, you would not respond—

content: 14 therefore I will do to the House which bears My name, on which you rely, and to the place which I gave you and your fathers, just what I did to Shiloh.
content_old: 14 therefore I will do to the House which bears My name, on which you rely, and to the place which I gave you and your fathers, just what I did to Shiloh.

content: 15 And I will cast you out of My presence as I cast out your brothers, the whole brood of Ephraim.
content_old: 15 And I will cast you out of My presence as I cast out your brothers, the whole brood of Ephraim.

content: 16 As for you, do not pray for this people, do not raise a cry of prayer on their behalf, do not plead with Me; for I will not listen to you.
content_old: 16 As for you, do not pray for this people, do not raise a cry of prayer on their behalf, do not plead with Me; for I will not listen to you.

content: 17 Don’t you see what they are doing in the towns of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?
content_old: 17 Don’t you see what they are doing in the towns of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?

content: 18 The children gather sticks, the fathers build the fire, and the mothers knead dough, to make cakes for the Queen of Heaven, and they pour libations to other gods, to vex Me.
content_old: 18 The children gather sticks, the fathers build the fire, and the mothers knead dough, to make cakes for the Queen of Heaven, and they pour libations to other gods, to vex Me.

content: 19 Is it Me they are vexing?—says the LORD. It is rather themselves, to their own disgrace.
content_old: 19 Is it Me they are vexing?—says the LORD. It is rather themselves, to their own disgrace.

content: 20 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: My wrath and My fury will be poured out upon this place, on man and on beast, on the trees of the field and the fruit of the soil. It shall burn, with none to quench it.
content_old: 20 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: My wrath and My fury will be poured out upon this place, on man and on beast, on the trees of the field and the fruit of the soil. It shall burn, with none to quench it.

content: 21 Thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: Add your burnt offerings to your other sacrifices and eat the meat!
content_old: 21 Thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: Add your burnt offerings to your other sacrifices and eat the meat!

content: 22 For when I freed your fathers from the land of Egypt, I did not speak with them or command them concerning burnt offerings or sacrifice.
content_old: 22 For when I freed your fathers from the land of Egypt, I did not speak with them or command them concerning burnt offerings or sacrifice.

content: 23 But this is what I commanded them: Do My bidding, that I may be your God and you may be My people; walk only in the way that I enjoin upon you, that it may go well with you.
content_old: 23 But this is what I commanded them: Do My bidding, that I may be your God and you may be My people; walk only in the way that I enjoin upon you, that it may go well with you.

content: 24 Yet they did not listen or give ear; they followed their own counsels, the willfulness of their evil hearts. They have gone backward, not forward,
content_old: 24 Yet they did not listen or give ear; they followed their own counsels, the willfulness of their evil hearts. They have gone backward, not forward,

content: 25 from the day your fathers left the land of Egypt until today. And though I kept sending all My servants, the prophets, to them daily and persistently,
content_old: 25 from the day your fathers left the land of Egypt until today. And though I kept sending all My servants, the prophets, to them daily and persistently,

content: 26 they would not listen to Me or give ear. They stiffened their necks, they acted worse than their fathers.
content_old: 26 they would not listen to Me or give ear. They stiffened their necks, they acted worse than their fathers.

content: 27 You shall say all these things to them, but they will not listen to you; you shall call to them, but they will not respond to you.
content_old: 27 You shall say all these things to them, but they will not listen to you; you shall call to them, but they will not respond to you.

content: 28 Then say to them: This is the nation that would not obey the LORD their God, that would not accept rebuke. Faithfulness has perished, vanished from their mouths.
content_old: 28 Then say to them: This is the nation that would not obey the LORD their God, that would not accept rebuke. Faithfulness has perished, vanished from their mouths.

content: 29 Shear your locks and cast them away, Take up a lament on the heights, For the LORD has spurned and cast off The brood that provoked His wrath.
content_old: 29 Shear your locks and cast them away, Take up a lament on the heights, For the LORD has spurned and cast off The brood that provoked His wrath.

content: 30 For the people of Judah have done what displeases Me—declares the LORD. They have set up their abominations in the House which is called by My name, and they have defiled it.
content_old: 30 For the people of Judah have done what displeases Me—declares the LORD. They have set up their abominations in the House which is called by My name, and they have defiled it.

content: 31 And they have built the shrines of Topheth in the Valley of Ben-hinnom to burn their sons and daughters in fire—which I never commanded, which never came to My mind.
content_old: 31 And they have built the shrines of Topheth in the Valley of Ben-hinnom to burn their sons and daughters in fire—which I never commanded, which never came to My mind.

content: 32 Assuredly, a time is coming—declares the LORD—when men shall no longer speak of Topheth or the Valley of Ben-hinnom, but of the Valley of Slaughter; and they shall bury in Topheth until no room is left.
content_old: 32 Assuredly, a time is coming—declares the LORD—when men shall no longer speak of Topheth or the Valley of Ben-hinnom, but of the Valley of Slaughter; and they shall bury in Topheth until no room is left.

content: 33 The carcasses of this people shall be food for the birds of the sky and the beasts of the earth, with none to frighten them off.
content_old: 33 The carcasses of this people shall be food for the birds of the sky and the beasts of the earth, with none to frighten them off.

content: 1 At that time—declares the LORD—the bones of the kings of Judah, of its officers, of the priests, of the prophets, and of the inhabitants of Jerusalem shall be taken out of their graves
content_old: 1 At that time—declares the LORD—the bones of the kings of Judah, of its officers, of the priests, of the prophets, and of the inhabitants of Jerusalem shall be taken out of their graves

content: 2 and exposed to the sun, the moon, and all the host of heaven which they loved and served and followed, to which they turned and bowed down. They shall not be gathered for reburial; they shall become dung upon the face of the earth.
content_old: 2 and exposed to the sun, the moon, and all the host of heaven which they loved and served and followed, to which they turned and bowed down. They shall not be gathered for reburial; they shall become dung upon the face of the earth.

content: 3 And death shall be preferable to life for all that are left of this wicked folk, in all the other places to which I shall banish them—declares the LORD of Hosts.
content_old: 3 And death shall be preferable to life for all that are left of this wicked folk, in all the other places to which I shall banish them—declares the LORD of Hosts.

content: 4 Say to them: Thus said the LORD: When men fall, do they not get up again? If they turn aside, do they not turn back?
content_old: 4 Say to them: Thus said the LORD: When men fall, do they not get up again? If they turn aside, do they not turn back?

content: 5 Why is this people—Jerusalem—rebellious With a persistent rebellion? They cling to deceit, They refuse to return.
content_old: 5 Why is this people—Jerusalem—rebellious With a persistent rebellion? They cling to deceit, They refuse to return.

content: 6 I have listened and heard: They do not speak honestly. No one regrets his wickedness And says, “What have I done!” They all persist in their wayward course Like a steed dashing forward in the fray.
content_old: 6 I have listened and heard: They do not speak honestly. No one regrets his wickedness And says, “What have I done!” They all persist in their wayward course Like a steed dashing forward in the fray.

content: 7 Even the stork in the sky knows her seasons, And the turtledove, swift, and crane Keep the time of their coming; But My people pay no heed To the law of the LORD.
content_old: 7 Even the stork in the sky knows her seasons, And the turtledove, swift, and crane Keep the time of their coming; But My people pay no heed To the law of the LORD.

content: 8 How can you say, “We are wise, And we possess the Instruction of the LORD”? Assuredly, for naught has the pen labored, For naught the scribes!
content_old: 8 How can you say, “We are wise, And we possess the Instruction of the LORD”? Assuredly, for naught has the pen labored, For naught the scribes!

content: 9 The wise shall be put to shame, Shall be dismayed and caught; See, they reject the word of the LORD, So their wisdom amounts to nothing.
content_old: 9 The wise shall be put to shame, Shall be dismayed and caught; See, they reject the word of the LORD, So their wisdom amounts to nothing.

content: 10 Assuredly, I will give their wives to others, And their fields to dispossessors; For from the smallest to the greatest, They are all greedy for gain; Priest and prophet alike, They all act falsely.
content_old: 10 Assuredly, I will give their wives to others, And their fields to dispossessors; For from the smallest to the greatest, They are all greedy for gain; Priest and prophet alike, They all act falsely.

content: 11 They offer healing offhand For the wounds of My poor people, Saying, “All is well, all is well,” When nothing is well.
content_old: 11 They offer healing offhand For the wounds of My poor people, Saying, “All is well, all is well,” When nothing is well.

content: 12 They have acted shamefully; They have done abhorrent things— Yet they do not feel shame, They cannot be made to blush. Assuredly, they shall fall among the falling, They shall stumble at the time of their doom —said the LORD.
content_old: 12 They have acted shamefully; They have done abhorrent things— Yet they do not feel shame, They cannot be made to blush. Assuredly, they shall fall among the falling, They shall stumble at the time of their doom —said the LORD.

content: 13 I will make an end of them —declares the LORD: No grapes left on the vine, No figs on the fig tree, The leaves all withered; Whatever I have given them is gone.
content_old: 13 I will make an end of them —declares the LORD: No grapes left on the vine, No figs on the fig tree, The leaves all withered; Whatever I have given them is gone.

content: 14 Why are we sitting by? Let us gather into the fortified cities And meet our doom there. For the LORD our God has doomed us, He has made us drink a bitter draft, Because we sinned against the LORD.
content_old: 14 Why are we sitting by? Let us gather into the fortified cities And meet our doom there. For the LORD our God has doomed us, He has made us drink a bitter draft, Because we sinned against the LORD.

content: 15 We hoped for good fortune, but no happiness came; For a time of relief—instead there is terror!
content_old: 15 We hoped for good fortune, but no happiness came; For a time of relief—instead there is terror!

content: 16 The snorting of their horses was heard from Dan; At the loud neighing of their steeds The whole land quaked. They came and devoured the land and what was in it, The towns and those who dwelt in them.
content_old: 16 The snorting of their horses was heard from Dan; At the loud neighing of their steeds The whole land quaked. They came and devoured the land and what was in it, The towns and those who dwelt in them.

content: 17 Lo, I will send serpents against you, Adders that cannot be charmed, And they shall bite you —declares the LORD.
content_old: 17 Lo, I will send serpents against you, Adders that cannot be charmed, And they shall bite you —declares the LORD.

content: 18 When in grief I would seek comfort, My heart is sick within me.
content_old: 18 When in grief I would seek comfort, My heart is sick within me.

content: 19 “Is not the LORD in Zion? Is not her King within her? Why then did they anger Me with their images, With alien futilities?” Hark! The outcry of my poor people From the land far and wide:
content_old: 19 “Is not the LORD in Zion? Is not her King within her? Why then did they anger Me with their images, With alien futilities?” Hark! The outcry of my poor people From the land far and wide:

content: 20 “Harvest is past, Summer is gone, But we have not been saved.”
content_old: 20 “Harvest is past, Summer is gone, But we have not been saved.”

content: 21 Because my people is shattered I am shattered; I am dejected, seized by desolation.
content_old: 21 Because my people is shattered I am shattered; I am dejected, seized by desolation.

content: 22 Is there no balm in Gilead? Can no physician be found? Why has healing not yet Come to my poor people?
content_old: 22 Is there no balm in Gilead? Can no physician be found? Why has healing not yet Come to my poor people?

content: 1 Oh, to be in the desert, At an encampment for wayfarers! Oh, to leave my people, To go away from them— For they are all adulterers, A band of rogues.
content_old: 1 Oh, to be in the desert, At an encampment for wayfarers! Oh, to leave my people, To go away from them— For they are all adulterers, A band of rogues.

content: 2 They bend their tongues like bows; They are valorous in the land For treachery, not for honesty; They advance from evil to evil. And they do not heed Me —declares the LORD.
content_old: 2 They bend their tongues like bows; They are valorous in the land For treachery, not for honesty; They advance from evil to evil. And they do not heed Me —declares the LORD.

content: 3 Beware, every man of his friend! Trust not even a brother! For every brother takes advantage, Every friend is base in his dealings.
content_old: 3 Beware, every man of his friend! Trust not even a brother! For every brother takes advantage, Every friend is base in his dealings.

content: 4 One man cheats the other, They will not speak truth; They have trained their tongues to speak falsely; They wear themselves out working iniquity.
content_old: 4 One man cheats the other, They will not speak truth; They have trained their tongues to speak falsely; They wear themselves out working iniquity.

content: 5 You dwell in the midst of deceit. In their deceit, they refuse to heed Me —declares the LORD.
content_old: 5 You dwell in the midst of deceit. In their deceit, they refuse to heed Me —declares the LORD.

content: 6 Assuredly, thus said the LORD of Hosts: Lo, I shall smelt and assay them— For what else can I do because of My poor people?
content_old: 6 Assuredly, thus said the LORD of Hosts: Lo, I shall smelt and assay them— For what else can I do because of My poor people?

content: 7 Their tongue is a sharpened arrow, They use their mouths to deceive. One speaks to his fellow in friendship, But lays an ambush for him in his heart.
content_old: 7 Their tongue is a sharpened arrow, They use their mouths to deceive. One speaks to his fellow in friendship, But lays an ambush for him in his heart.

content: 8 Shall I not punish them for such deeds? —says the LORD— Shall I not bring retribution On such a nation as this?
content_old: 8 Shall I not punish them for such deeds? —says the LORD— Shall I not bring retribution On such a nation as this?

content: 9 For the mountains I take up weeping and wailing, For the pastures in the wilderness, a dirge. They are laid waste; no man passes through, And no sound of cattle is heard. Birds of the sky and beasts as well Have fled and are gone.
content_old: 9 For the mountains I take up weeping and wailing, For the pastures in the wilderness, a dirge. They are laid waste; no man passes through, And no sound of cattle is heard. Birds of the sky and beasts as well Have fled and are gone.

content: 10 I will turn Jerusalem into rubble, Into dens for jackals; And I will make the towns of Judah A desolation without inhabitants.
content_old: 10 I will turn Jerusalem into rubble, Into dens for jackals; And I will make the towns of Judah A desolation without inhabitants.

content: 11 What man is so wise That he understands this? To whom has the LORD’s mouth spoken, So that he can explain it: Why is the land in ruins, Laid waste like a wilderness, With none passing through?
content_old: 11 What man is so wise That he understands this? To whom has the LORD’s mouth spoken, So that he can explain it: Why is the land in ruins, Laid waste like a wilderness, With none passing through?

content: 12 The LORD replied: Because they forsook the Teaching I had set before them. They did not obey Me and they did not follow it,
content_old: 12 The LORD replied: Because they forsook the Teaching I had set before them. They did not obey Me and they did not follow it,

content: 13 but followed their own willful heart and followed the Baalim, as their fathers had taught them.
content_old: 13 but followed their own willful heart and followed the Baalim, as their fathers had taught them.

content: 14 Assuredly, thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: I am going to feed that people wormwood and make them drink a bitter draft.
content_old: 14 Assuredly, thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: I am going to feed that people wormwood and make them drink a bitter draft.

content: 15 I will scatter them among nations which they and their fathers never knew; and I will dispatch the sword after them until I have consumed them.
content_old: 15 I will scatter them among nations which they and their fathers never knew; and I will dispatch the sword after them until I have consumed them.

content: 16 Thus said the LORD of Hosts: Listen! Summon the dirge-singers, let them come;
content_old: 16 Thus said the LORD of Hosts: Listen! Summon the dirge-singers, let them come;

content: 17 Send for the skilled women, let them come. Let them quickly start a wailing for us, That our eyes may run with tears, Our pupils flow with water.
content_old: 17 Send for the skilled women, let them come. Let them quickly start a wailing for us, That our eyes may run with tears, Our pupils flow with water.

content: 18 For the sound of wailing Is heard from Zion: How we are despoiled! How greatly we are shamed! Ah, we must leave our land, Abandon our dwellings!
content_old: 18 For the sound of wailing Is heard from Zion: How we are despoiled! How greatly we are shamed! Ah, we must leave our land, Abandon our dwellings!

content: 19 Hear, O women, the word of the LORD, Let your ears receive the word of His mouth, And teach your daughters wailing, And one another lamentation.
content_old: 19 Hear, O women, the word of the LORD, Let your ears receive the word of His mouth, And teach your daughters wailing, And one another lamentation.

content: 20 For death has climbed through our windows, Has entered our fortresses, To cut off babes from the streets, Young men from the squares.
content_old: 20 For death has climbed through our windows, Has entered our fortresses, To cut off babes from the streets, Young men from the squares.

content: 21 Speak thus—says the LORD: The carcasses of men shall lie Like dung upon the fields, Like sheaves behind the reaper, With none to pick them up.
content_old: 21 Speak thus—says the LORD: The carcasses of men shall lie Like dung upon the fields, Like sheaves behind the reaper, With none to pick them up.

content: 22 Thus said the LORD: Let not the wise man glory in his wisdom; Let not the strong man glory in his strength; Let not the rich man glory in his riches.
content_old: 22 Thus said the LORD: Let not the wise man glory in his wisdom; Let not the strong man glory in his strength; Let not the rich man glory in his riches.

content: 23 But only in this should one glory: In his earnest devotion to Me. For I the LORD act with kindness, Justice, and equity in the world; For in these I delight —declares the LORD.
content_old: 23 But only in this should one glory: In his earnest devotion to Me. For I the LORD act with kindness, Justice, and equity in the world; For in these I delight —declares the LORD.

content: 24 Lo, days are coming—declares the LORD—when I will take note of everyone circumcised in the foreskin:
content_old: 24 Lo, days are coming—declares the LORD—when I will take note of everyone circumcised in the foreskin:

content: 1 Hear the word which the LORD has spoken to you, O House of Israel!
content_old: 1 Hear the word which the LORD has spoken to you, O House of Israel!

content: 2 Thus said the LORD: Do not learn to go the way of the nations, And do not be dismayed by portents in the sky; Let the nations be dismayed by them!
content_old: 2 Thus said the LORD: Do not learn to go the way of the nations, And do not be dismayed by portents in the sky; Let the nations be dismayed by them!

content: 3 For the laws of the nations are delusions: For it is the work of a craftsman’s hands. He cuts down a tree in the forest with an ax,
content_old: 3 For the laws of the nations are delusions: For it is the work of a craftsman’s hands. He cuts down a tree in the forest with an ax,

content: 4 He adorns it with silver and gold, He fastens it with nails and hammer, So that it does not totter.
content_old: 4 He adorns it with silver and gold, He fastens it with nails and hammer, So that it does not totter.

content: 5 They are like a scarecrow in a cucumber patch, They cannot speak. They have to be carried, For they cannot walk. Be not afraid of them, for they can do no harm; Nor is it in them to do any good.
content_old: 5 They are like a scarecrow in a cucumber patch, They cannot speak. They have to be carried, For they cannot walk. Be not afraid of them, for they can do no harm; Nor is it in them to do any good.

content: 6 O LORD, there is none like You! You are great and Your name is great in power.
content_old: 6 O LORD, there is none like You! You are great and Your name is great in power.

content: 7 Who would not revere You, O King of the nations? For that is Your due, Since among all the wise of the nations And among all their royalty There is none like You.
content_old: 7 Who would not revere You, O King of the nations? For that is Your due, Since among all the wise of the nations And among all their royalty There is none like You.

content: 8 But they are both dull and foolish; doctrine is but delusion; It is a piece of wood,
content_old: 8 But they are both dull and foolish; doctrine is but delusion; It is a piece of wood,

content: 9 Silver beaten flat, that is brought from Tarshish, And gold from Uphaz, The work of a craftsman and the goldsmith’s hands; Their clothing is blue and purple, All of them are the work of skilled men.
content_old: 9 Silver beaten flat, that is brought from Tarshish, And gold from Uphaz, The work of a craftsman and the goldsmith’s hands; Their clothing is blue and purple, All of them are the work of skilled men.

content: 10 But the LORD is truly God: He is a living God, The everlasting King. At His wrath, the earth quakes, And nations cannot endure His rage.
content_old: 10 But the LORD is truly God: He is a living God, The everlasting King. At His wrath, the earth quakes, And nations cannot endure His rage.

content: 11 Thus shall you say to them: Let the gods, who did not make heaven and earth, perish from the earth and from under these heavens.
content_old: 11 Thus shall you say to them: Let the gods, who did not make heaven and earth, perish from the earth and from under these heavens.

content: 12 He made the earth by His might, Established the world by His wisdom, And by His understanding stretched out the skies.
content_old: 12 He made the earth by His might, Established the world by His wisdom, And by His understanding stretched out the skies.

content: 13 When He makes His voice heard, There is a rumbling of water in the skies; He makes vapors rise from the end of the earth, He makes lightning for the rain, And brings forth wind from His treasuries.
content_old: 13 When He makes His voice heard, There is a rumbling of water in the skies; He makes vapors rise from the end of the earth, He makes lightning for the rain, And brings forth wind from His treasuries.

content: 14 Every man is proved dull, without knowledge; Every goldsmith is put to shame because of the idol, For his molten image is a deceit— There is no breath in them.
content_old: 14 Every man is proved dull, without knowledge; Every goldsmith is put to shame because of the idol, For his molten image is a deceit— There is no breath in them.

content: 15 They are delusion, a work of mockery; In their hour of doom, they shall perish.
content_old: 15 They are delusion, a work of mockery; In their hour of doom, they shall perish.

content: 16 Not like these is the Portion of Jacob; For it is He who formed all things, And Israel is His very own tribe: LORD of Hosts is His name.
content_old: 16 Not like these is the Portion of Jacob; For it is He who formed all things, And Israel is His very own tribe: LORD of Hosts is His name.

content: 17 Gather up your bundle from the ground, You who dwell under siege!
content_old: 17 Gather up your bundle from the ground, You who dwell under siege!
