content: 18 For thus said the LORD: I will fling away the inhabitants of the land this time: I will harass them so that they shall feel it.
content_old: 18 For thus said the LORD: I will fling away the inhabitants of the land this time: I will harass them so that they shall feel it.

content: 19 Woe unto me for my hurt, My wound is severe! I thought, “This is but a sickness And I must bear it.”
content_old: 19 Woe unto me for my hurt, My wound is severe! I thought, “This is but a sickness And I must bear it.”

content: 20 My tents are ravaged, All my tent cords are broken. My children have gone forth from me And are no more; No one is left to stretch out my tents And hang my tent cloths.
content_old: 20 My tents are ravaged, All my tent cords are broken. My children have gone forth from me And are no more; No one is left to stretch out my tents And hang my tent cloths.

content: 21 For the shepherds are dull And did not seek the LORD; Therefore they have not prospered And all their flock is scattered.
content_old: 21 For the shepherds are dull And did not seek the LORD; Therefore they have not prospered And all their flock is scattered.

content: 22 Hark, a noise! It is coming, A great commotion out of the north, That the towns of Judah may be made a desolation, A haunt of jackals.
content_old: 22 Hark, a noise! It is coming, A great commotion out of the north, That the towns of Judah may be made a desolation, A haunt of jackals.

content: 23 I know, O LORD, that man’s road is not his, That man, as he walks, cannot direct his own steps.
content_old: 23 I know, O LORD, that man’s road is not his, That man, as he walks, cannot direct his own steps.

content: 24 Chastise me, O LORD, but in measure; Not in Your wrath, lest You reduce me to naught.
content_old: 24 Chastise me, O LORD, but in measure; Not in Your wrath, lest You reduce me to naught.

content: 1 The word which came to Jeremiah from the LORD:
content_old: 1 The word which came to Jeremiah from the LORD:

content: 2 “Hear the terms of this covenant, and recite them to the men of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem!
content_old: 2 “Hear the terms of this covenant, and recite them to the men of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem!

content: 3 And say to them, Thus said the LORD, the God of Israel: Cursed be the man who will not obey the terms of this covenant,
content_old: 3 And say to them, Thus said the LORD, the God of Israel: Cursed be the man who will not obey the terms of this covenant,

content: 4 which I enjoined upon your fathers when I freed them from the land of Egypt, the iron crucible, saying, ‘Obey Me and observe them, just as I command you, that you may be My people and I may be your God’—
content_old: 4 which I enjoined upon your fathers when I freed them from the land of Egypt, the iron crucible, saying, ‘Obey Me and observe them, just as I command you, that you may be My people and I may be your God’—

content: 5 in order to fulfill the oath which I swore to your fathers, to give them a land flowing with milk and honey, as is now the case.” And I responded, “Amen, LORD.”
content_old: 5 in order to fulfill the oath which I swore to your fathers, to give them a land flowing with milk and honey, as is now the case.” And I responded, “Amen, LORD.”

content: 6 And the LORD said to me, “Proclaim all these things through the towns of Judah and the streets of Jerusalem: Hear the terms of this covenant, and perform them.
content_old: 6 And the LORD said to me, “Proclaim all these things through the towns of Judah and the streets of Jerusalem: Hear the terms of this covenant, and perform them.

content: 7 For I have repeatedly and persistently warned your fathers from the time I brought them out of Egypt to this day, saying: Obey My commands.
content_old: 7 For I have repeatedly and persistently warned your fathers from the time I brought them out of Egypt to this day, saying: Obey My commands.

content: 8 But they would not listen or give ear; they all followed the willfulness of their evil hearts. So I have brought upon them all the terms of this covenant, because they did not do what I commanded them to do.”
content_old: 8 But they would not listen or give ear; they all followed the willfulness of their evil hearts. So I have brought upon them all the terms of this covenant, because they did not do what I commanded them to do.”

content: 9 The LORD said to me, “A conspiracy exists among the men of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
content_old: 9 The LORD said to me, “A conspiracy exists among the men of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem.

content: 10 They have returned to the iniquities of their fathers of old, who refused to heed My words. They, too, have followed other gods and served them. The House of Israel and the House of Judah have broken the covenant that I made with their fathers.”
content_old: 10 They have returned to the iniquities of their fathers of old, who refused to heed My words. They, too, have followed other gods and served them. The House of Israel and the House of Judah have broken the covenant that I made with their fathers.”

content: 11 Assuredly, thus said the LORD: I am going to bring upon them disaster from which they will not be able to escape. Then they will cry out to me, but I will not listen to them.
content_old: 11 Assuredly, thus said the LORD: I am going to bring upon them disaster from which they will not be able to escape. Then they will cry out to me, but I will not listen to them.

content: 12 And the townsmen of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem will go and cry out to the gods to which they sacrifice; but they will not be able to rescue them in their time of disaster.
content_old: 12 And the townsmen of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem will go and cry out to the gods to which they sacrifice; but they will not be able to rescue them in their time of disaster.

content: 13 For your gods have become as many as your towns, O Judah, and you have set up as many altars to Shame as there are streets in Jerusalem—altars for sacrifice to Baal.
content_old: 13 For your gods have become as many as your towns, O Judah, and you have set up as many altars to Shame as there are streets in Jerusalem—altars for sacrifice to Baal.

content: 14 As for you, do not pray for this people, do not raise a cry of prayer on their behalf; for I will not listen when they call to Me on account of their disaster.
content_old: 14 As for you, do not pray for this people, do not raise a cry of prayer on their behalf; for I will not listen when they call to Me on account of their disaster.

content: 15 Why should My beloved be in My House, Who executes so many vile designs? The sacral flesh will pass away from you, For you exult while performing your evil deeds.
content_old: 15 Why should My beloved be in My House, Who executes so many vile designs? The sacral flesh will pass away from you, For you exult while performing your evil deeds.

content: 16 The LORD named you “Verdant olive tree, Fair, with choice fruit.” But with a great roaring sound He has set it on fire, And its boughs are broken.
content_old: 16 The LORD named you “Verdant olive tree, Fair, with choice fruit.” But with a great roaring sound He has set it on fire, And its boughs are broken.

content: 17 The LORD of Hosts, who planted you, has decreed disaster for you, because of the evil wrought by the House of Israel and the House of Judah, who angered Me by sacrificing to Baal.
content_old: 17 The LORD of Hosts, who planted you, has decreed disaster for you, because of the evil wrought by the House of Israel and the House of Judah, who angered Me by sacrificing to Baal.

content: 18 The LORD informed me, and I knew— Then You let me see their deeds.
content_old: 18 The LORD informed me, and I knew— Then You let me see their deeds.

content: 19 For I was like a docile lamb Led to the slaughter; I did not realize That it was against me They fashioned their plots: “Let us destroy the tree with its fruit, Let us cut him off from the land of the living. That his name be remembered no more!”
content_old: 19 For I was like a docile lamb Led to the slaughter; I did not realize That it was against me They fashioned their plots: “Let us destroy the tree with its fruit, Let us cut him off from the land of the living. That his name be remembered no more!”

content: 20 O LORD of Hosts, O just Judge, Who test the thoughts and the mind, Let me see Your retribution upon them, For I lay my case before You.
content_old: 20 O LORD of Hosts, O just Judge, Who test the thoughts and the mind, Let me see Your retribution upon them, For I lay my case before You.

content: 21 Assuredly, thus said the LORD of Hosts concerning the men of Anathoth who seek your life and say, “You must not prophesy any more in the name of the LORD, or you will die by our hand”—
content_old: 21 Assuredly, thus said the LORD of Hosts concerning the men of Anathoth who seek your life and say, “You must not prophesy any more in the name of the LORD, or you will die by our hand”—

content: 22 Assuredly, thus said the LORD of Hosts: “I am going to deal with them: the young men shall die by the sword, their boys and girls shall die by famine.
content_old: 22 Assuredly, thus said the LORD of Hosts: “I am going to deal with them: the young men shall die by the sword, their boys and girls shall die by famine.

content: 1 You will win, O LORD, if I make claim against You, Yet I shall present charges against You: Why does the way of the wicked prosper? Why are the workers of treachery at ease?
content_old: 1 You will win, O LORD, if I make claim against You, Yet I shall present charges against You: Why does the way of the wicked prosper? Why are the workers of treachery at ease?

content: 2 You have planted them, and they have taken root, They spread, they even bear fruit. You are present in their mouths, But far from their thoughts.
content_old: 2 You have planted them, and they have taken root, They spread, they even bear fruit. You are present in their mouths, But far from their thoughts.

content: 3 Yet You, LORD, have noted and observed me; You have tested my heart, and found it with You. Drive them out like sheep to the slaughter, Prepare them for the day of slaying!
content_old: 3 Yet You, LORD, have noted and observed me; You have tested my heart, and found it with You. Drive them out like sheep to the slaughter, Prepare them for the day of slaying!

content: 4 How long must the land languish, And the grass of all the countryside dry up? Must beasts and birds perish, Because of the evil of its inhabitants, Who say, “He will not look upon our future”?
content_old: 4 How long must the land languish, And the grass of all the countryside dry up? Must beasts and birds perish, Because of the evil of its inhabitants, Who say, “He will not look upon our future”?

content: 5 If you race with the foot-runners and they exhaust you, How then can you compete with horses? If you are secure only in a tranquil land, How will you fare in the jungle of the Jordan?
content_old: 5 If you race with the foot-runners and they exhaust you, How then can you compete with horses? If you are secure only in a tranquil land, How will you fare in the jungle of the Jordan?

content: 6 For even your kinsmen and your father��s house, Even they are treacherous toward you, They cry after you as a mob. Do not believe them When they speak cordially to you.
content_old: 6 For even your kinsmen and your father��s house, Even they are treacherous toward you, They cry after you as a mob. Do not believe them When they speak cordially to you.

content: 7 I have abandoned My House, I have deserted My possession, I have given over My dearly beloved Into the hands of her enemies.
content_old: 7 I have abandoned My House, I have deserted My possession, I have given over My dearly beloved Into the hands of her enemies.

content: 8 My own people acted toward Me Like a lion in the forest; She raised her voice against Me— Therefore I have rejected her.
content_old: 8 My own people acted toward Me Like a lion in the forest; She raised her voice against Me— Therefore I have rejected her.

content: 9 My own people acts toward Me Like a bird of prey a hyena; Let the birds of prey surround her! Go, gather all the wild beasts, Bring them to devour!
content_old: 9 My own people acts toward Me Like a bird of prey a hyena; Let the birds of prey surround her! Go, gather all the wild beasts, Bring them to devour!

content: 10 Many shepherds have destroyed My vineyard, Have trampled My field, Have made My delightful field A desolate wilderness.
content_old: 10 Many shepherds have destroyed My vineyard, Have trampled My field, Have made My delightful field A desolate wilderness.

content: 11 They have made her a desolation; Desolate, she pours out grief to Me. The whole land is laid desolate, But no man gives it thought.
content_old: 11 They have made her a desolation; Desolate, she pours out grief to Me. The whole land is laid desolate, But no man gives it thought.

content: 12 Spoilers have come Upon all the bare heights of the wilderness. For a sword of the LORD devours From one end of the land to the other; No flesh is safe.
content_old: 12 Spoilers have come Upon all the bare heights of the wilderness. For a sword of the LORD devours From one end of the land to the other; No flesh is safe.

content: 13 They have sown wheat and reaped thorns, They have endured pain to no avail. Be shamed, then, by your harvest— By the blazing wrath of the LORD!
content_old: 13 They have sown wheat and reaped thorns, They have endured pain to no avail. Be shamed, then, by your harvest— By the blazing wrath of the LORD!

content: 14 Thus said the LORD: As for My wicked neighbors who encroach on the heritage that I gave to My people Israel—I am going to uproot them from their soil, and I will uproot the House of Judah out of the midst of them.
content_old: 14 Thus said the LORD: As for My wicked neighbors who encroach on the heritage that I gave to My people Israel—I am going to uproot them from their soil, and I will uproot the House of Judah out of the midst of them.

content: 15 Then, after I have uprooted them, I will take them back into favor, and restore them each to his own inheritance and his own land.
content_old: 15 Then, after I have uprooted them, I will take them back into favor, and restore them each to his own inheritance and his own land.

content: 16 And if they learn the ways of My people, to swear by My name—“As the LORD lives”—just as they once taught My people to swear by Baal, then they shall be built up in the midst of My people.
content_old: 16 And if they learn the ways of My people, to swear by My name—“As the LORD lives”—just as they once taught My people to swear by Baal, then they shall be built up in the midst of My people.

content: 1 Thus the LORD said to me: “Go buy yourself a loincloth of linen, and put it around your loins, but do not dip it into water.”
content_old: 1 Thus the LORD said to me: “Go buy yourself a loincloth of linen, and put it around your loins, but do not dip it into water.”

content: 2 So I bought the loincloth in accordance with the LORD’s command, and put it about my loins.
content_old: 2 So I bought the loincloth in accordance with the LORD’s command, and put it about my loins.

content: 3 And the word of the LORD came to me a second time:
content_old: 3 And the word of the LORD came to me a second time:

content: 4 “Take the loincloth which you bought, which is about your loins, and go at once to Perath and cover it up there in a cleft of the rock.”
content_old: 4 “Take the loincloth which you bought, which is about your loins, and go at once to Perath and cover it up there in a cleft of the rock.”

content: 5 I went and buried it at Perath, as the LORD had commanded me.
content_old: 5 I went and buried it at Perath, as the LORD had commanded me.

content: 6 Then, after a long time, the LORD said to me, “Go at once to Perath and take there the loincloth which I commanded you to bury there.”
content_old: 6 Then, after a long time, the LORD said to me, “Go at once to Perath and take there the loincloth which I commanded you to bury there.”

content: 7 So I went to Perath and dug up the loincloth from the place where I had buried it; and found the loincloth ruined; it was not good for anything.
content_old: 7 So I went to Perath and dug up the loincloth from the place where I had buried it; and found the loincloth ruined; it was not good for anything.

content: 8 The word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 8 The word of the LORD came to me:

content: 9 Thus said the LORD: Even so will I ruin the overweening pride of Judah and Jerusalem.
content_old: 9 Thus said the LORD: Even so will I ruin the overweening pride of Judah and Jerusalem.

content: 10 This wicked people who refuse to heed My bidding, who follow the willfulness of their own hearts, who follow other gods and serve them and worship them, shall become like that loincloth, which is not good for anything.
content_old: 10 This wicked people who refuse to heed My bidding, who follow the willfulness of their own hearts, who follow other gods and serve them and worship them, shall become like that loincloth, which is not good for anything.

content: 11 For as the loincloth clings close to the loins of a man, so I brought close to Me the whole House of Israel and the whole House of Judah—declares the LORD—that they might be My people, for fame, and praise, and splendor. But they would not obey.
content_old: 11 For as the loincloth clings close to the loins of a man, so I brought close to Me the whole House of Israel and the whole House of Judah—declares the LORD—that they might be My people, for fame, and praise, and splendor. But they would not obey.

content: 12 And speak this word to them: Thus said the LORD, the God of Israel: “Every jar should be filled with wine.” And when they say to you, “Don’t we know that every jar should be filled with wine?”
content_old: 12 And speak this word to them: Thus said the LORD, the God of Israel: “Every jar should be filled with wine.” And when they say to you, “Don’t we know that every jar should be filled with wine?”

content: 13 say to them, “Thus said the LORD: I am going to fill with drunkenness all the inhabitants of this land, and the kings who sit on the throne of David, and the priests and the prophets, and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
content_old: 13 say to them, “Thus said the LORD: I am going to fill with drunkenness all the inhabitants of this land, and the kings who sit on the throne of David, and the priests and the prophets, and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem.

content: 14 And I will smash them one against the other, parents and children alike—declares the LORD; no pity, compassion, or mercy will stop Me from destroying them.”
content_old: 14 And I will smash them one against the other, parents and children alike—declares the LORD; no pity, compassion, or mercy will stop Me from destroying them.”

content: 15 Attend and give ear; be not haughty, For the LORD has spoken.
content_old: 15 Attend and give ear; be not haughty, For the LORD has spoken.

content: 16 Give honor to the LORD your God Before He brings darkness, Before your feet stumble On the mountains in shadow— When you hope for light, And it is turned to darkness And becomes deep gloom.
content_old: 16 Give honor to the LORD your God Before He brings darkness, Before your feet stumble On the mountains in shadow— When you hope for light, And it is turned to darkness And becomes deep gloom.

content: 17 For if you will not give heed, My inmost self must weep, Because of your arrogance; My eye must stream and flow With copious tears, Because the flock of the LORD Is taken captive.
content_old: 17 For if you will not give heed, My inmost self must weep, Because of your arrogance; My eye must stream and flow With copious tears, Because the flock of the LORD Is taken captive.

content: 18 Say to the king and the queen mother, “Sit in a lowly spot; For your diadems are abased, Your glorious crowns.”
content_old: 18 Say to the king and the queen mother, “Sit in a lowly spot; For your diadems are abased, Your glorious crowns.”

content: 19 The cities of the Negeb are shut, There is no one to open them; Judah is exiled completely, All of it exiled.
content_old: 19 The cities of the Negeb are shut, There is no one to open them; Judah is exiled completely, All of it exiled.

content: 20 Raise your eyes and behold Those who come from the north: Where are the sheep entrusted to you, The flock you took pride in?
content_old: 20 Raise your eyes and behold Those who come from the north: Where are the sheep entrusted to you, The flock you took pride in?

content: 21 What will you say when they appoint as your heads Those among you whom you trained to be tame? Shall not pangs seize you Like a woman in childbirth?
content_old: 21 What will you say when they appoint as your heads Those among you whom you trained to be tame? Shall not pangs seize you Like a woman in childbirth?

content: 22 And when you ask yourself, “Why have these things befallen me?” It is because of your great iniquity That your skirts are lifted up, Your limbs exposed.
content_old: 22 And when you ask yourself, “Why have these things befallen me?” It is because of your great iniquity That your skirts are lifted up, Your limbs exposed.

content: 23 Can the Ethiopian change his skin, Or the leopard his spots? Just as much can you do good, Who are practiced in doing evil!
content_old: 23 Can the Ethiopian change his skin, Or the leopard his spots? Just as much can you do good, Who are practiced in doing evil!

content: 24 So I will scatter you like straw that flies Before the desert wind.
content_old: 24 So I will scatter you like straw that flies Before the desert wind.

content: 25 This shall be your lot, Your measured portion from Me —declares the LORD. Because you forgot Me And trusted in falsehood,
content_old: 25 This shall be your lot, Your measured portion from Me —declares the LORD. Because you forgot Me And trusted in falsehood,

content: 26 I in turn will lift your skirts over your face And your shame shall be seen.
content_old: 26 I in turn will lift your skirts over your face And your shame shall be seen.

content: 1 The word of the LORD which came to Jeremiah concerning the droughts.
content_old: 1 The word of the LORD which came to Jeremiah concerning the droughts.

content: 2 Judah is in mourning, Her settlements languish. Men are bowed to the ground, And the outcry of Jerusalem rises.
content_old: 2 Judah is in mourning, Her settlements languish. Men are bowed to the ground, And the outcry of Jerusalem rises.

content: 3 Their nobles sent their servants for water; They came to the cisterns, they found no water. They returned, their vessels empty. They are shamed and humiliated, They cover their heads.
content_old: 3 Their nobles sent their servants for water; They came to the cisterns, they found no water. They returned, their vessels empty. They are shamed and humiliated, They cover their heads.

content: 4 Because of the ground there is dismay, For there has been no rain on the earth. The plowmen are shamed, They cover their heads.
content_old: 4 Because of the ground there is dismay, For there has been no rain on the earth. The plowmen are shamed, They cover their heads.

content: 5 Even the hind in the field Forsakes her new-born fawn, Because there is no grass.
content_old: 5 Even the hind in the field Forsakes her new-born fawn, Because there is no grass.

content: 6 And the wild asses stand on the bare heights, Snuffing the air like jackals; Their eyes pine, Because there is no herbage.
content_old: 6 And the wild asses stand on the bare heights, Snuffing the air like jackals; Their eyes pine, Because there is no herbage.

content: 7 Though our iniquities testify against us, Act, O LORD, for the sake of Your name; Though our rebellions are many And we have sinned against You.
content_old: 7 Though our iniquities testify against us, Act, O LORD, for the sake of Your name; Though our rebellions are many And we have sinned against You.

content: 8 O Hope of Israel, Its deliverer in time of trouble, Why are You like a stranger in the land, Like a traveler who stops only for the night?
content_old: 8 O Hope of Israel, Its deliverer in time of trouble, Why are You like a stranger in the land, Like a traveler who stops only for the night?

content: 9 Why are You like a man who is stunned, Like a warrior who cannot give victory? Yet You are in our midst, O LORD, And Your name is attached to us— Do not forsake us!
content_old: 9 Why are You like a man who is stunned, Like a warrior who cannot give victory? Yet You are in our midst, O LORD, And Your name is attached to us— Do not forsake us!

content: 10 Thus said the LORD concerning this people: “Truly, they love to stray, they have not restrained their feet; so the LORD has no pleasure in them. Now He will recall their iniquity and punish their sin.”
content_old: 10 Thus said the LORD concerning this people: “Truly, they love to stray, they have not restrained their feet; so the LORD has no pleasure in them. Now He will recall their iniquity and punish their sin.”

content: 11 And the LORD said to me, “Do not pray for the benefit of this people.
content_old: 11 And the LORD said to me, “Do not pray for the benefit of this people.

content: 12 When they fast, I will not listen to their outcry; and when they present burnt offering and meal offering, I will not accept them. I will exterminate them by war, famine, and disease.”
content_old: 12 When they fast, I will not listen to their outcry; and when they present burnt offering and meal offering, I will not accept them. I will exterminate them by war, famine, and disease.”

content: 13 I said, “Ah, Lord GOD! The prophets are saying to them, ‘You shall not see the sword, famine shall not come upon you, but I will give you unfailing security in this place.’ ”
content_old: 13 I said, “Ah, Lord GOD! The prophets are saying to them, ‘You shall not see the sword, famine shall not come upon you, but I will give you unfailing security in this place.’ ”

content: 14 The LORD replied: It is a lie that the prophets utter in My name. I have not sent them or commanded them. I have not spoken to them. A lying vision, an empty divination, the deceit of their own contriving—that is what they prophesy to you!
content_old: 14 The LORD replied: It is a lie that the prophets utter in My name. I have not sent them or commanded them. I have not spoken to them. A lying vision, an empty divination, the deceit of their own contriving—that is what they prophesy to you!

content: 15 Assuredly, thus said the LORD concerning the prophets who prophesy in My name though I have not sent them, and who say, “Sword and famine shall not befall this land”; those very prophets shall perish by sword and famine.
content_old: 15 Assuredly, thus said the LORD concerning the prophets who prophesy in My name though I have not sent them, and who say, “Sword and famine shall not befall this land”; those very prophets shall perish by sword and famine.

content: 16 And the people to whom they prophesy shall be left lying in the streets of Jerusalem because of the famine and the sword, with none to bury them—they, their wives, their sons, and their daughters. I will pour out upon them their wickedness.
content_old: 16 And the people to whom they prophesy shall be left lying in the streets of Jerusalem because of the famine and the sword, with none to bury them—they, their wives, their sons, and their daughters. I will pour out upon them their wickedness.

content: 17 And do you speak to them thus: Let my eyes run with tears, Day and night let them not cease, For my hapless people has suffered A grievous injury, a very painful wound.
content_old: 17 And do you speak to them thus: Let my eyes run with tears, Day and night let them not cease, For my hapless people has suffered A grievous injury, a very painful wound.

content: 18 If I go out to the country— Lo, the slain of the sword. If I enter the city— Lo, those who are sick with famine. Both priest and prophet roam the land, They know not where.
content_old: 18 If I go out to the country— Lo, the slain of the sword. If I enter the city— Lo, those who are sick with famine. Both priest and prophet roam the land, They know not where.

content: 19 Have You, then, rejected Judah? Have You spurned Zion? Why have You smitten us So that there is no cure? Why do we hope for happiness, But find no good; For a time of healing, And meet terror instead?
content_old: 19 Have You, then, rejected Judah? Have You spurned Zion? Why have You smitten us So that there is no cure? Why do we hope for happiness, But find no good; For a time of healing, And meet terror instead?

content: 20 We acknowledge our wickedness, O LORD— The iniquity of our fathers— For we have sinned against You.
content_old: 20 We acknowledge our wickedness, O LORD— The iniquity of our fathers— For we have sinned against You.

content: 21 For Your name’s sake, do not disown us; Do not dishonor Your glorious throne. Remember, do not annul Your covenant with us.
content_old: 21 For Your name’s sake, do not disown us; Do not dishonor Your glorious throne. Remember, do not annul Your covenant with us.

content: 1 The LORD said to me, “Even if Moses and Samuel were to intercede with Me, I would not be won over to that people. Dismiss them from My presence, and let them go forth!
content_old: 1 The LORD said to me, “Even if Moses and Samuel were to intercede with Me, I would not be won over to that people. Dismiss them from My presence, and let them go forth!

content: 2 And if they ask you, ‘To what shall we go forth?’ answer them, ‘Thus said the LORD: Those destined for the plague, to the plague; Those destined for the sword, to the sword; Those destined for famine, to famine; Those destined for captivity, to captivity.
content_old: 2 And if they ask you, ‘To what shall we go forth?’ answer them, ‘Thus said the LORD: Those destined for the plague, to the plague; Those destined for the sword, to the sword; Those destined for famine, to famine; Those destined for captivity, to captivity.

content: 3 And I will appoint over them four kinds —declares the LORD—the sword to slay, the dogs to drag, the birds of the sky, and the beasts of the earth to devour and destroy.
content_old: 3 And I will appoint over them four kinds —declares the LORD—the sword to slay, the dogs to drag, the birds of the sky, and the beasts of the earth to devour and destroy.

content: 4 I will make them a horror to all the kingdoms of the earth, on account of King Manasseh son of Hezekiah of Judah, and of what he did in Jerusalem.’ ”
content_old: 4 I will make them a horror to all the kingdoms of the earth, on account of King Manasseh son of Hezekiah of Judah, and of what he did in Jerusalem.’ ”

content: 5 But who will pity you, O Jerusalem, Who will console you? Who will turn aside to inquire About your welfare?
content_old: 5 But who will pity you, O Jerusalem, Who will console you? Who will turn aside to inquire About your welfare?

content: 6 You cast Me off —declares the LORD— You go ever backward. So I have stretched out My hand to destroy you; I cannot relent.
content_old: 6 You cast Me off —declares the LORD— You go ever backward. So I have stretched out My hand to destroy you; I cannot relent.

content: 7 I will scatter them as with a winnowing fork Through the settlements of the earth. I will bereave, I will destroy My people, For they would not turn back from their ways.
content_old: 7 I will scatter them as with a winnowing fork Through the settlements of the earth. I will bereave, I will destroy My people, For they would not turn back from their ways.

content: 8 Their widows shall be more numerous Than the sands of the seas. I will bring against them— Young men and mothers together— A destroyer at noonday. I will bring down suddenly upon them Alarm and terror.
content_old: 8 Their widows shall be more numerous Than the sands of the seas. I will bring against them— Young men and mothers together— A destroyer at noonday. I will bring down suddenly upon them Alarm and terror.

content: 9 She who bore seven is forlorn, Utterly disconsolate; Her sun has set while it is still day, She is shamed and humiliated. The remnant of them I will deliver to the sword, To the power of their enemies —declares the LORD.
content_old: 9 She who bore seven is forlorn, Utterly disconsolate; Her sun has set while it is still day, She is shamed and humiliated. The remnant of them I will deliver to the sword, To the power of their enemies —declares the LORD.

content: 10 Woe is me, my mother, that you ever bore me— A man of conflict and strife with all the land! I have not lent, And I have not borrowed; Yet everyone curses me.
content_old: 10 Woe is me, my mother, that you ever bore me— A man of conflict and strife with all the land! I have not lent, And I have not borrowed; Yet everyone curses me.

content: 11 The LORD said: Surely, a mere remnant of you Will I spare for a better fate! By the enemy from the north In a time of distress and a time of disaster, Surely, I will have you struck down!
content_old: 11 The LORD said: Surely, a mere remnant of you Will I spare for a better fate! By the enemy from the north In a time of distress and a time of disaster, Surely, I will have you struck down!

content: 12 Can iron break iron and bronze?
content_old: 12 Can iron break iron and bronze?

content: 13 I will hand over your wealth and your treasures As a spoil, free of charge, Because of all your sins throughout your territory.
content_old: 13 I will hand over your wealth and your treasures As a spoil, free of charge, Because of all your sins throughout your territory.

content: 14 And I will bring your enemies By way of a land you have not known. For a fire has flared in My wrath, It blazes against you.
content_old: 14 And I will bring your enemies By way of a land you have not known. For a fire has flared in My wrath, It blazes against you.

content: 15 O LORD, you know— Remember me and take thought of me, Avenge me on those who persecute me; Do not yield to Your patience, Do not let me perish! Consider how I have borne insult On Your account.
content_old: 15 O LORD, you know— Remember me and take thought of me, Avenge me on those who persecute me; Do not yield to Your patience, Do not let me perish! Consider how I have borne insult On Your account.

content: 16 When Your words were offered, I devoured them; Your word brought me the delight and joy Of knowing that Your name is attached to me, O LORD, God of Hosts.
content_old: 16 When Your words were offered, I devoured them; Your word brought me the delight and joy Of knowing that Your name is attached to me, O LORD, God of Hosts.

content: 17 I have not sat in the company of revelers And made merry! I have sat lonely because of Your hand upon me, For You have filled me with gloom.
content_old: 17 I have not sat in the company of revelers And made merry! I have sat lonely because of Your hand upon me, For You have filled me with gloom.

content: 18 Why must my pain be endless, My wound incurable, Resistant to healing? You have been to me like a spring that fails, Like waters that cannot be relied on.
content_old: 18 Why must my pain be endless, My wound incurable, Resistant to healing? You have been to me like a spring that fails, Like waters that cannot be relied on.

content: 19 Assuredly, thus said the LORD: If you turn back, I shall take you back And you shall stand before Me; If you produce what is noble Out of the worthless, You shall be My spokesman. They shall come back to you, Not you to them.
content_old: 19 Assuredly, thus said the LORD: If you turn back, I shall take you back And you shall stand before Me; If you produce what is noble Out of the worthless, You shall be My spokesman. They shall come back to you, Not you to them.

content: 20 Against this people I will make you As a fortified wall of bronze: They will attack you, But they shall not overcome you, For I am with you to deliver and save you —declares the LORD.
content_old: 20 Against this people I will make you As a fortified wall of bronze: They will attack you, But they shall not overcome you, For I am with you to deliver and save you —declares the LORD.

content: 1 The word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 1 The word of the LORD came to me:

content: 2 You are not to marry and not to have sons and daughters in this place.
content_old: 2 You are not to marry and not to have sons and daughters in this place.

content: 3 For thus said the LORD concerning any sons and daughters that may be born in this place, and concerning the mothers who bear them, and concerning the fathers who beget them in this land:
content_old: 3 For thus said the LORD concerning any sons and daughters that may be born in this place, and concerning the mothers who bear them, and concerning the fathers who beget them in this land:

content: 4 They shall die gruesome deaths. They shall not be lamented or buried; they shall be like dung on the surface of the ground. They shall be consumed by the sword and by famine, and their corpses shall be food for the birds of the sky and the beasts of the earth.
content_old: 4 They shall die gruesome deaths. They shall not be lamented or buried; they shall be like dung on the surface of the ground. They shall be consumed by the sword and by famine, and their corpses shall be food for the birds of the sky and the beasts of the earth.

content: 5 For thus said the LORD: Do not enter a house of mourning, Do not go to lament and to condole with them; For I have withdrawn My favor from that people —declares the LORD— My kindness and compassion.
content_old: 5 For thus said the LORD: Do not enter a house of mourning, Do not go to lament and to condole with them; For I have withdrawn My favor from that people —declares the LORD— My kindness and compassion.

content: 6 Great and small alike shall die in this land, They shall not be buried; men shall not lament them, Nor gash and tonsure themselves for them.
content_old: 6 Great and small alike shall die in this land, They shall not be buried; men shall not lament them, Nor gash and tonsure themselves for them.

content: 7 They shall not break bread for a mourner To comfort him for a bereavement, Nor offer one a cup of consolation For the loss of his father or mother.
content_old: 7 They shall not break bread for a mourner To comfort him for a bereavement, Nor offer one a cup of consolation For the loss of his father or mother.

content: 8 Nor shall you enter a house of feasting, To sit down with them to eat and drink.
content_old: 8 Nor shall you enter a house of feasting, To sit down with them to eat and drink.

content: 9 For thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: I am going to banish from this place, in your days and before your eyes, the sound of mirth and gladness, the voice of bridegroom and bride.
content_old: 9 For thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: I am going to banish from this place, in your days and before your eyes, the sound of mirth and gladness, the voice of bridegroom and bride.

content: 10 And when you announce all these things to that people, and they ask you, “Why has the LORD decreed upon us all this fearful evil? What is the iniquity and what the sin that we have committed against the LORD our God?”
content_old: 10 And when you announce all these things to that people, and they ask you, “Why has the LORD decreed upon us all this fearful evil? What is the iniquity and what the sin that we have committed against the LORD our God?”

content: 11 say to them, “Because your fathers deserted Me—declares the LORD—and followed other gods and served them and worshiped them; they deserted Me and did not keep My Instruction.
content_old: 11 say to them, “Because your fathers deserted Me—declares the LORD—and followed other gods and served them and worshiped them; they deserted Me and did not keep My Instruction.

content: 12 And you have acted worse than your fathers, every one of you following the willfulness of his evil heart and paying no heed to Me.
content_old: 12 And you have acted worse than your fathers, every one of you following the willfulness of his evil heart and paying no heed to Me.

content: 13 Therefore I will hurl you out of this land to a land that neither you nor your fathers have known, and there you will serve other gods, day and night; for I will show you no mercy.”
content_old: 13 Therefore I will hurl you out of this land to a land that neither you nor your fathers have known, and there you will serve other gods, day and night; for I will show you no mercy.”

content: 14 Assuredly, a time is coming—declares the LORD—when it shall no more be said, “As the LORD lives who brought the Israelites out of the land of Egypt,”
content_old: 14 Assuredly, a time is coming—declares the LORD—when it shall no more be said, “As the LORD lives who brought the Israelites out of the land of Egypt,”

content: 15 but rather, “As the LORD lives who brought the Israelites out of the northland, and out of all the lands to which He had banished them.” For I will bring them back to their land, which I gave to their fathers.
content_old: 15 but rather, “As the LORD lives who brought the Israelites out of the northland, and out of all the lands to which He had banished them.” For I will bring them back to their land, which I gave to their fathers.

content: 16 Lo, I am sending for many fishermen —declares the LORD— And they shall haul them out; And after that I will send for many hunters, And they shall hunt them Out of every mountain and out of every hill And out of the clefts of the rocks.
content_old: 16 Lo, I am sending for many fishermen —declares the LORD— And they shall haul them out; And after that I will send for many hunters, And they shall hunt them Out of every mountain and out of every hill And out of the clefts of the rocks.

content: 17 For My eyes are on all their ways, They are not hidden from My presence, Their iniquity is not concealed from My sight.
content_old: 17 For My eyes are on all their ways, They are not hidden from My presence, Their iniquity is not concealed from My sight.

content: 18 I will pay them in full— Nay, doubly for their iniquity and their sins— Because they have defiled My land With the corpses of their abominations, And have filled My own possession With their abhorrent things.
content_old: 18 I will pay them in full— Nay, doubly for their iniquity and their sins— Because they have defiled My land With the corpses of their abominations, And have filled My own possession With their abhorrent things.

content: 19 O LORD, my strength and my stronghold, My refuge in a day of trouble, To You nations shall come From the ends of the earth and say: Our fathers inherited utter delusions, Things that are futile and worthless.
content_old: 19 O LORD, my strength and my stronghold, My refuge in a day of trouble, To You nations shall come From the ends of the earth and say: Our fathers inherited utter delusions, Things that are futile and worthless.

content: 20 Can a man make gods for himself? No-gods are they!
content_old: 20 Can a man make gods for himself? No-gods are they!

content: 1 The guilt of Judah is inscribed With a stylus of iron, Engraved with an adamant point On the tablet of their hearts, And on the horns of their altars,
content_old: 1 The guilt of Judah is inscribed With a stylus of iron, Engraved with an adamant point On the tablet of their hearts, And on the horns of their altars,

content: 2 While their children remember Their altars and sacred posts, By verdant trees, Upon lofty hills.
content_old: 2 While their children remember Their altars and sacred posts, By verdant trees, Upon lofty hills.

content: 3 Because of the sin of your shrines Throughout your borders, I will make your rampart a heap in the field, And all your treasures a spoil.
content_old: 3 Because of the sin of your shrines Throughout your borders, I will make your rampart a heap in the field, And all your treasures a spoil.

content: 4 You will forfeit, by your own act, The inheritance I have given you; I will make you a slave to your enemies In a land you have never known. For you have kindled the flame of My wrath Which shall burn for all time.
content_old: 4 You will forfeit, by your own act, The inheritance I have given you; I will make you a slave to your enemies In a land you have never known. For you have kindled the flame of My wrath Which shall burn for all time.

content: 5 Thus said the LORD: Cursed is he who trusts in man, Who makes mere flesh his strength, And turns his thoughts from the LORD.
content_old: 5 Thus said the LORD: Cursed is he who trusts in man, Who makes mere flesh his strength, And turns his thoughts from the LORD.

content: 6 He shall be like a bush in the desert, Which does not sense the coming of good: It is set in the scorched places of the wilderness, In a barren land without inhabitant.
content_old: 6 He shall be like a bush in the desert, Which does not sense the coming of good: It is set in the scorched places of the wilderness, In a barren land without inhabitant.

content: 7 Blessed is he who trusts in the LORD, Whose trust is the LORD alone.
content_old: 7 Blessed is he who trusts in the LORD, Whose trust is the LORD alone.

content: 8 He shall be like a tree planted by waters, Sending forth its roots by a stream: It does not sense the coming of heat, Its leaves are ever fresh; It has no care in a year of drought, It does not cease to yield fruit.
content_old: 8 He shall be like a tree planted by waters, Sending forth its roots by a stream: It does not sense the coming of heat, Its leaves are ever fresh; It has no care in a year of drought, It does not cease to yield fruit.

content: 9 Most devious is the heart; It is perverse—who can fathom it?
content_old: 9 Most devious is the heart; It is perverse—who can fathom it?

content: 10 I the LORD probe the heart, Search the mind— To repay every man according to his ways, With the proper fruit of his deeds.
content_old: 10 I the LORD probe the heart, Search the mind— To repay every man according to his ways, With the proper fruit of his deeds.

content: 11 Like a partridge hatching what she did not lay, So is one who amasses wealth by unjust means; In the middle of his life it will leave him, And in the end he will be proved a fool.
content_old: 11 Like a partridge hatching what she did not lay, So is one who amasses wealth by unjust means; In the middle of his life it will leave him, And in the end he will be proved a fool.

content: 12 O Throne of Glory exalted from of old, Our Sacred Shrine!
content_old: 12 O Throne of Glory exalted from of old, Our Sacred Shrine!

content: 13 O Hope of Israel! O LORD! All who forsake You shall be put to shame, Those in the land who turn from You Shall be doomed men, For they have forsaken the LORD, The Fount of living waters.
content_old: 13 O Hope of Israel! O LORD! All who forsake You shall be put to shame, Those in the land who turn from You Shall be doomed men, For they have forsaken the LORD, The Fount of living waters.

content: 14 Heal me, O LORD, and let me be healed; Save me, and let me be saved; For You are my glory.
content_old: 14 Heal me, O LORD, and let me be healed; Save me, and let me be saved; For You are my glory.

content: 15 See, they say to me: “Where is the prediction of the LORD? Let it come to pass!”
content_old: 15 See, they say to me: “Where is the prediction of the LORD? Let it come to pass!”

content: 16 But I have not evaded Being a shepherd in your service, Nor have I longed for the fatal day. You know the utterances of my lips, They were ever before You.
content_old: 16 But I have not evaded Being a shepherd in your service, Nor have I longed for the fatal day. You know the utterances of my lips, They were ever before You.

content: 17 Do not be a cause of dismay to me; You are my refuge in a day of calamity.
content_old: 17 Do not be a cause of dismay to me; You are my refuge in a day of calamity.

content: 18 Let my persecutors be shamed, And let not me be shamed; Let them be dismayed, And let not me be dismayed. Bring on them the day of disaster, And shatter them with double destruction.
content_old: 18 Let my persecutors be shamed, And let not me be shamed; Let them be dismayed, And let not me be dismayed. Bring on them the day of disaster, And shatter them with double destruction.

content: 19 Thus said the LORD to me: Go and stand in the People’s Gate, by which the kings of Judah enter and by which they go forth, and in all the gates of Jerusalem,
content_old: 19 Thus said the LORD to me: Go and stand in the People’s Gate, by which the kings of Judah enter and by which they go forth, and in all the gates of Jerusalem,

content: 20 and say to them: Hear the word of the LORD, O kings of Judah, and all Judah, and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem who enter by these gates!
content_old: 20 and say to them: Hear the word of the LORD, O kings of Judah, and all Judah, and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem who enter by these gates!

content: 21 Thus said the LORD: Guard yourselves for your own sake against carrying burdens on the sabbath day, and bringing them through the gates of Jerusalem.
content_old: 21 Thus said the LORD: Guard yourselves for your own sake against carrying burdens on the sabbath day, and bringing them through the gates of Jerusalem.

content: 22 Nor shall you carry out burdens from your houses on the sabbath day, or do any work, but you shall hallow the sabbath day, as I commanded your fathers.
content_old: 22 Nor shall you carry out burdens from your houses on the sabbath day, or do any work, but you shall hallow the sabbath day, as I commanded your fathers.

content: 23 But they would not listen or turn their ear; they stiffened their necks and would not pay heed or accept discipline.
content_old: 23 But they would not listen or turn their ear; they stiffened their necks and would not pay heed or accept discipline.

content: 24 If you obey Me—declares the LORD—and do not bring in burdens through the gates of this city on the sabbath day, but hallow the sabbath day and do no work on it,
content_old: 24 If you obey Me—declares the LORD—and do not bring in burdens through the gates of this city on the sabbath day, but hallow the sabbath day and do no work on it,

content: 25 then through the gates of this city shall enter kings who sit upon the throne of David, with their officers—riding on chariots and horses, they and their officers—and the men of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem. And this city shall be inhabited for all time.
content_old: 25 then through the gates of this city shall enter kings who sit upon the throne of David, with their officers—riding on chariots and horses, they and their officers—and the men of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem. And this city shall be inhabited for all time.

content: 26 And people shall come from the towns of Judah and from the environs of Jerusalem, and from the land of Benjamin, and from the Shephelah, and from the hill country, and from the Negeb, bringing burnt offerings and sacrifices, meal offerings and frankincense, and bringing offerings of thanksgiving to the House of the LORD.
content_old: 26 And people shall come from the towns of Judah and from the environs of Jerusalem, and from the land of Benjamin, and from the Shephelah, and from the hill country, and from the Negeb, bringing burnt offerings and sacrifices, meal offerings and frankincense, and bringing offerings of thanksgiving to the House of the LORD.

content: 1 The word which came to Jeremiah from the LORD:
content_old: 1 The word which came to Jeremiah from the LORD:

content: 2 “Go down to the house of a potter, and there I will impart My words to you.”
content_old: 2 “Go down to the house of a potter, and there I will impart My words to you.”

content: 3 So I went down to the house of a potter, and found him working at the wheel.
content_old: 3 So I went down to the house of a potter, and found him working at the wheel.

content: 4 And if the vessel he was making was spoiled, as happens to clay in the potter’s hands, he would make it into another vessel, such as the potter saw fit to make.
content_old: 4 And if the vessel he was making was spoiled, as happens to clay in the potter’s hands, he would make it into another vessel, such as the potter saw fit to make.

content: 5 Then the word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 5 Then the word of the LORD came to me:

content: 6 O House of Israel, can I not deal with you like this potter?—says the LORD. Just like clay in the hands of the potter, so are you in My hands, O House of Israel!
content_old: 6 O House of Israel, can I not deal with you like this potter?—says the LORD. Just like clay in the hands of the potter, so are you in My hands, O House of Israel!

content: 7 At one moment I may decree that a nation or a kingdom shall be uprooted and pulled down and destroyed;
content_old: 7 At one moment I may decree that a nation or a kingdom shall be uprooted and pulled down and destroyed;

content: 8 but if that nation against which I made the decree turns back from its wickedness, I change My mind concerning the punishment I planned to bring on it.
content_old: 8 but if that nation against which I made the decree turns back from its wickedness, I change My mind concerning the punishment I planned to bring on it.

content: 9 At another moment I may decree that a nation or a kingdom shall be built and planted;
content_old: 9 At another moment I may decree that a nation or a kingdom shall be built and planted;

content: 10 but if it does what is displeasing to Me and does not obey Me, then I change My mind concerning the good I planned to bestow upon it.
content_old: 10 but if it does what is displeasing to Me and does not obey Me, then I change My mind concerning the good I planned to bestow upon it.

content: 11 And now, say to the men of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem: Thus said the LORD: I am devising disaster for you and laying plans against you. Turn back, each of you, from your wicked ways, and mend your ways and your actions!
content_old: 11 And now, say to the men of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem: Thus said the LORD: I am devising disaster for you and laying plans against you. Turn back, each of you, from your wicked ways, and mend your ways and your actions!

content: 12 But they will say, “It is no use. We will keep on following our own plans; each of us will act in the willfulness of his evil heart.”
content_old: 12 But they will say, “It is no use. We will keep on following our own plans; each of us will act in the willfulness of his evil heart.”

content: 13 Assuredly, thus said the LORD: Inquire among the nations: Who has heard anything like this? Maiden Israel has done A most horrible thing.
content_old: 13 Assuredly, thus said the LORD: Inquire among the nations: Who has heard anything like this? Maiden Israel has done A most horrible thing.

content: 14 Does one forsake Lebanon snow From the mountainous rocks? Does one abandon cool water Flowing from afar?
content_old: 14 Does one forsake Lebanon snow From the mountainous rocks? Does one abandon cool water Flowing from afar?

content: 15 Yet My people have forgotten Me: They sacrifice to a delusion: They are made to stumble in their ways— The ancient paths— And to walk instead on byways, On a road not built up.
content_old: 15 Yet My people have forgotten Me: They sacrifice to a delusion: They are made to stumble in their ways— The ancient paths— And to walk instead on byways, On a road not built up.

content: 16 So their land will become a desolation, An object of hissing for all time. Every passerby will be appalled And will shake his head.
content_old: 16 So their land will become a desolation, An object of hissing for all time. Every passerby will be appalled And will shake his head.

content: 17 Like the east wind, I will scatter them Before the enemy. I will look upon their back, not their face, In their day of disaster.
content_old: 17 Like the east wind, I will scatter them Before the enemy. I will look upon their back, not their face, In their day of disaster.

content: 18 They said, “Come let us devise a plot against Jeremiah—for instruction shall not fail from the priest, nor counsel from the wise, nor oracle from the prophet. Come, let us strike him with the tongue, and we shall no longer have to listen to all those words of his.”
content_old: 18 They said, “Come let us devise a plot against Jeremiah—for instruction shall not fail from the priest, nor counsel from the wise, nor oracle from the prophet. Come, let us strike him with the tongue, and we shall no longer have to listen to all those words of his.”

content: 19 Listen to me, O LORD— And take note of what my enemies say!
content_old: 19 Listen to me, O LORD— And take note of what my enemies say!

content: 20 Should good be repaid with evil? Yet they have dug a pit for me. Remember how I stood before You To plead in their behalf, To turn Your anger away from them!
content_old: 20 Should good be repaid with evil? Yet they have dug a pit for me. Remember how I stood before You To plead in their behalf, To turn Your anger away from them!

content: 21 Oh, give their children over to famine, Mow them down by the sword. Let their wives be bereaved Of children and husbands, Let their men be struck down by the plague, And their young men be slain in battle by the sword.
content_old: 21 Oh, give their children over to famine, Mow them down by the sword. Let their wives be bereaved Of children and husbands, Let their men be struck down by the plague, And their young men be slain in battle by the sword.

content: 22 Let an outcry be heard from their houses When You bring sudden marauders against them; For they have dug a pit to trap me, And laid snares for my feet.
content_old: 22 Let an outcry be heard from their houses When You bring sudden marauders against them; For they have dug a pit to trap me, And laid snares for my feet.

content: 1 Thus said the LORD: Go buy a jug of potter’s ware. And take some of the elders of the people and the priests,
content_old: 1 Thus said the LORD: Go buy a jug of potter’s ware. And take some of the elders of the people and the priests,

content: 2 and go out to the Valley of Ben-hinnom—at the entrance of the Harsith Gate—and proclaim there the words which I will speak to you.
content_old: 2 and go out to the Valley of Ben-hinnom—at the entrance of the Harsith Gate—and proclaim there the words which I will speak to you.

content: 3 Say: “Hear the word of the LORD, O kings of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem! Thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: I am going to bring such disaster upon this place that the ears of all who hear about it will tingle.
content_old: 3 Say: “Hear the word of the LORD, O kings of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem! Thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: I am going to bring such disaster upon this place that the ears of all who hear about it will tingle.

content: 4 For they and their fathers and the kings of Judah have forsaken Me, and have made this place alien ; they have sacrificed in it to other gods whom they have not experienced, and they have filled this place with the blood of the innocent.
content_old: 4 For they and their fathers and the kings of Judah have forsaken Me, and have made this place alien ; they have sacrificed in it to other gods whom they have not experienced, and they have filled this place with the blood of the innocent.

content: 5 They have built shrines to Baal, to put their children to the fire as burnt offerings to Baal—which I never commanded, never decreed, and which never came to My mind.
content_old: 5 They have built shrines to Baal, to put their children to the fire as burnt offerings to Baal—which I never commanded, never decreed, and which never came to My mind.

content: 6 Assuredly, a time is coming—declares the LORD—when this place shall no longer be called Topheth or Valley of Ben-hinnom, but Valley of Slaughter.
content_old: 6 Assuredly, a time is coming—declares the LORD—when this place shall no longer be called Topheth or Valley of Ben-hinnom, but Valley of Slaughter.

content: 7 “And I will frustrate the plans of Judah and Jerusalem in this place. I will cause them to fall by the sword before their enemies, by the hand of those who seek their lives; and I will give their carcasses as food to the birds of the sky and the beasts of the earth.
content_old: 7 “And I will frustrate the plans of Judah and Jerusalem in this place. I will cause them to fall by the sword before their enemies, by the hand of those who seek their lives; and I will give their carcasses as food to the birds of the sky and the beasts of the earth.

content: 8 And I will make this city an object of horror and hissing; everyone who passes by it will be appalled and will hiss over all its wounds.
content_old: 8 And I will make this city an object of horror and hissing; everyone who passes by it will be appalled and will hiss over all its wounds.

content: 9 And I will cause them to eat the flesh of their sons and the flesh of their daughters, and they shall devour one another’s flesh—because of the desperate straits to which they will be reduced by their enemies, who seek their life.”
content_old: 9 And I will cause them to eat the flesh of their sons and the flesh of their daughters, and they shall devour one another’s flesh—because of the desperate straits to which they will be reduced by their enemies, who seek their life.”

content: 10 Then you shall smash the jug in the sight of the men who go with you,
content_old: 10 Then you shall smash the jug in the sight of the men who go with you,

content: 11 and say to them: “Thus said the LORD of Hosts: So will I smash this people and this city, as one smashes a potter’s vessel, which can never be mended. And they shall bury in Topheth until no room is left for burying.
content_old: 11 and say to them: “Thus said the LORD of Hosts: So will I smash this people and this city, as one smashes a potter’s vessel, which can never be mended. And they shall bury in Topheth until no room is left for burying.

content: 12 That is what I will do to this place and its inhabitants—declares the LORD. I will make this city like Topheth:
content_old: 12 That is what I will do to this place and its inhabitants—declares the LORD. I will make this city like Topheth:

content: 13 the houses of Jerusalem and the houses of the kings of Judah shall be unclean, like that place Topheth—all the houses on the roofs of which offerings were made to the whole host of heaven and libations were poured out to other gods.”
content_old: 13 the houses of Jerusalem and the houses of the kings of Judah shall be unclean, like that place Topheth—all the houses on the roofs of which offerings were made to the whole host of heaven and libations were poured out to other gods.”

content: 14 When Jeremiah returned from Topheth, where the LORD had sent him to prophesy, he stood in the court of the House of the LORD and said to all the people:
content_old: 14 When Jeremiah returned from Topheth, where the LORD had sent him to prophesy, he stood in the court of the House of the LORD and said to all the people:

content: 1 Pashhur son of Immer, the priest who was chief officer of the House of the LORD, heard Jeremiah prophesy these things.
content_old: 1 Pashhur son of Immer, the priest who was chief officer of the House of the LORD, heard Jeremiah prophesy these things.

content: 2 Pashhur thereupon had Jeremiah flogged and put in the cell at the Upper Benjamin Gate in the House of the LORD.
content_old: 2 Pashhur thereupon had Jeremiah flogged and put in the cell at the Upper Benjamin Gate in the House of the LORD.

content: 3 The next day, Pashhur released Jeremiah from the cell. But Jeremiah said to him, “The LORD has named you not Pashhur, but Magor-missabib.
content_old: 3 The next day, Pashhur released Jeremiah from the cell. But Jeremiah said to him, “The LORD has named you not Pashhur, but Magor-missabib.

content: 4 For thus said the LORD: I am going to deliver you and all your friends over to terror: they will fall by the sword of their enemies while you look on. I will deliver all Judah into the hands of the king of Babylon; he will exile them to Babylon or put them to the sword.
content_old: 4 For thus said the LORD: I am going to deliver you and all your friends over to terror: they will fall by the sword of their enemies while you look on. I will deliver all Judah into the hands of the king of Babylon; he will exile them to Babylon or put them to the sword.

content: 5 And I will deliver all the wealth, all the riches, and all the prized possessions of this city, and I will also deliver all the treasures of the kings of Judah into the hands of their enemies: they shall seize them as plunder and carry them off to Babylon.
content_old: 5 And I will deliver all the wealth, all the riches, and all the prized possessions of this city, and I will also deliver all the treasures of the kings of Judah into the hands of their enemies: they shall seize them as plunder and carry them off to Babylon.

content: 6 As for you, Pashhur, and all who live in your house, you shall go into captivity. You shall come to Babylon; there you shall die and there you shall be buried, and so shall all your friends to whom you prophesied falsely.”
content_old: 6 As for you, Pashhur, and all who live in your house, you shall go into captivity. You shall come to Babylon; there you shall die and there you shall be buried, and so shall all your friends to whom you prophesied falsely.”

content: 7 You enticed me, O LORD, and I was enticed; You overpowered me and You prevailed. I have become a constant laughingstock, Everyone jeers at me.
content_old: 7 You enticed me, O LORD, and I was enticed; You overpowered me and You prevailed. I have become a constant laughingstock, Everyone jeers at me.

content: 8 For every time I speak, I must cry out, Must shout, “Lawlessness and rapine!” For the word of the LORD causes me Constant disgrace and contempt.
content_old: 8 For every time I speak, I must cry out, Must shout, “Lawlessness and rapine!” For the word of the LORD causes me Constant disgrace and contempt.

content: 9 I thought, “I will not mention Him, No more will I speak in His name”— But was like a raging fire in my heart, Shut up in my bones; I could not hold it in, I was helpless.
content_old: 9 I thought, “I will not mention Him, No more will I speak in His name”— But was like a raging fire in my heart, Shut up in my bones; I could not hold it in, I was helpless.

content: 10 I heard the whispers of the crowd— Terror all around: “Inform! Let us inform against him!” All my friends Are waiting for me to stumble: “Perhaps he can be entrapped, And we can prevail against him And take our vengeance on him.”
content_old: 10 I heard the whispers of the crowd— Terror all around: “Inform! Let us inform against him!” All my friends Are waiting for me to stumble: “Perhaps he can be entrapped, And we can prevail against him And take our vengeance on him.”

content: 11 But the LORD is with me like a mighty warrior; Therefore my persecutors shall stumble; They shall not prevail and shall not succeed. They shall be utterly shamed With a humiliation for all time, Which shall not be forgotten.
content_old: 11 But the LORD is with me like a mighty warrior; Therefore my persecutors shall stumble; They shall not prevail and shall not succeed. They shall be utterly shamed With a humiliation for all time, Which shall not be forgotten.

content: 12 O LORD of Hosts, You who test the righteous, Who examine the heart and the mind, Let me see Your retribution upon them, For I lay my case before You.
content_old: 12 O LORD of Hosts, You who test the righteous, Who examine the heart and the mind, Let me see Your retribution upon them, For I lay my case before You.

content: 13 Sing unto the LORD, Praise the LORD, For He has rescued the needy From the hands of evildoers!
content_old: 13 Sing unto the LORD, Praise the LORD, For He has rescued the needy From the hands of evildoers!

content: 14 Accursed be the day That I was born! Let not the day be blessed When my mother bore me!
content_old: 14 Accursed be the day That I was born! Let not the day be blessed When my mother bore me!

content: 15 Accursed be the man Who brought my father the news And said, “A boy Is born to you,” And gave him such joy!
content_old: 15 Accursed be the man Who brought my father the news And said, “A boy Is born to you,” And gave him such joy!

content: 16 Let that man become like the cities Which the LORD overthrew without relenting! Let him hear shrieks in the morning And battle shouts at noontide—
content_old: 16 Let that man become like the cities Which the LORD overthrew without relenting! Let him hear shrieks in the morning And battle shouts at noontide—

content: 17 Because he did not kill me before birth So that my mother might be my grave, And her womb big for all time.
content_old: 17 Because he did not kill me before birth So that my mother might be my grave, And her womb big for all time.

content: 1 The word which came to Jeremiah from the LORD, when King Zedekiah sent to him Pashhur son of Malchiah and the priest Zephaniah, son of Maaseiah, to say,
content_old: 1 The word which came to Jeremiah from the LORD, when King Zedekiah sent to him Pashhur son of Malchiah and the priest Zephaniah, son of Maaseiah, to say,

content: 2 “Please inquire of the LORD on our behalf, for King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon is attacking us. Perhaps the LORD will act for our sake in accordance with all His wonders, so that Nebuchadrezzar will withdraw from us.”
content_old: 2 “Please inquire of the LORD on our behalf, for King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon is attacking us. Perhaps the LORD will act for our sake in accordance with all His wonders, so that Nebuchadrezzar will withdraw from us.”

content: 3 Jeremiah answered them, “Thus shall you say to Zedekiah:
content_old: 3 Jeremiah answered them, “Thus shall you say to Zedekiah:

content: 4 Thus said the LORD, the God of Israel: I am going to turn around the weapons in your hands with which you are battling outside the wall against those who are besieging you—the king of Babylon and the Chaldeans—and I will take them into the midst of this city;
content_old: 4 Thus said the LORD, the God of Israel: I am going to turn around the weapons in your hands with which you are battling outside the wall against those who are besieging you—the king of Babylon and the Chaldeans—and I will take them into the midst of this city;

content: 5 and I Myself will battle against you with an outstretched mighty arm, with anger and rage and great wrath.
content_old: 5 and I Myself will battle against you with an outstretched mighty arm, with anger and rage and great wrath.

content: 6 I will strike the inhabitants of this city, man and beast: they shall die by a terrible pestilence.
content_old: 6 I will strike the inhabitants of this city, man and beast: they shall die by a terrible pestilence.

content: 7 And then—declares the LORD—I will deliver King Zedekiah of Judah and his courtiers and the people—those in this city who survive the pestilence, the sword, and the famine—into the hands of King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon, into the hands of their enemies, into the hands of those who seek their lives. He will put them to the sword without pity, without compassion, without mercy.
content_old: 7 And then—declares the LORD—I will deliver King Zedekiah of Judah and his courtiers and the people—those in this city who survive the pestilence, the sword, and the famine—into the hands of King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon, into the hands of their enemies, into the hands of those who seek their lives. He will put them to the sword without pity, without compassion, without mercy.

content: 8 “And to this people you shall say: Thus said the LORD: I set before you the way of life and the way of death.
content_old: 8 “And to this people you shall say: Thus said the LORD: I set before you the way of life and the way of death.

content: 9 Whoever remains in this city shall die by the sword, by famine, and by pestilence; but whoever leaves and goes over to the Chaldeans who are besieging you shall live; he shall at least gain his life.
content_old: 9 Whoever remains in this city shall die by the sword, by famine, and by pestilence; but whoever leaves and goes over to the Chaldeans who are besieging you shall live; he shall at least gain his life.

content: 10 For I have set My face against this city for evil and not for good—declares the LORD. It shall be delivered into the hands of the king of Babylon, who will destroy it by fire.”
content_old: 10 For I have set My face against this city for evil and not for good—declares the LORD. It shall be delivered into the hands of the king of Babylon, who will destroy it by fire.”

content: 11 To the House of the king of Judah: Hear the word of the LORD!
content_old: 11 To the House of the king of Judah: Hear the word of the LORD!

content: 12 O House of David, thus said the LORD: Render just verdicts Morning by morning; Rescue him who is robbed From him who defrauded him. Else My wrath will break forth like fire And burn, with none to quench it, Because of your wicked acts.
content_old: 12 O House of David, thus said the LORD: Render just verdicts Morning by morning; Rescue him who is robbed From him who defrauded him. Else My wrath will break forth like fire And burn, with none to quench it, Because of your wicked acts.

content: 13 I will deal with you, O inhabitants of the valley, O rock of the plain—declares the LORD— You who say, “Who can come down against us? Who can get into our lairs?”
content_old: 13 I will deal with you, O inhabitants of the valley, O rock of the plain—declares the LORD— You who say, “Who can come down against us? Who can get into our lairs?”

content: 1 Thus said the LORD: Go down to the palace of the king of Judah, where you shall utter this word.
content_old: 1 Thus said the LORD: Go down to the palace of the king of Judah, where you shall utter this word.

content: 2 Say: “Hear the word of the LORD: O king of Judah, you who sit on the throne of David, and your courtiers and your subjects who enter these gates!
content_old: 2 Say: “Hear the word of the LORD: O king of Judah, you who sit on the throne of David, and your courtiers and your subjects who enter these gates!

content: 3 Thus said the LORD: Do what is just and right; rescue from the defrauder him who is robbed; do not wrong the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow; commit no lawless act, and do not shed the blood of the innocent in this place.
content_old: 3 Thus said the LORD: Do what is just and right; rescue from the defrauder him who is robbed; do not wrong the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow; commit no lawless act, and do not shed the blood of the innocent in this place.

content: 4 For if you fulfill this command, then through the gates of this palace shall enter kings of David’s line who sit upon his throne, riding horse-drawn chariots, with their courtiers and their subjects.
content_old: 4 For if you fulfill this command, then through the gates of this palace shall enter kings of David’s line who sit upon his throne, riding horse-drawn chariots, with their courtiers and their subjects.

content: 5 But if you do not heed these commands, I swear by Myself—declares the LORD—that this palace shall become a ruin.”
content_old: 5 But if you do not heed these commands, I swear by Myself—declares the LORD—that this palace shall become a ruin.”

content: 6 For thus said the LORD concerning the royal palace of Judah: You are as Gilead to Me, As the summit of Lebanon; But I will make you a desert, Uninhabited towns.
content_old: 6 For thus said the LORD concerning the royal palace of Judah: You are as Gilead to Me, As the summit of Lebanon; But I will make you a desert, Uninhabited towns.

content: 7 I will appoint destroyers against you, Each with his tools; They shall cut down your choicest cedars And make them fall into the fire.
content_old: 7 I will appoint destroyers against you, Each with his tools; They shall cut down your choicest cedars And make them fall into the fire.

content: 8 And when many nations pass by this city and one man asks another, “Why did the LORD do thus to that great city?”
content_old: 8 And when many nations pass by this city and one man asks another, “Why did the LORD do thus to that great city?”

content: 9 the reply will be, “Because they forsook the covenant with the LORD their God and bowed down to other gods and served them.”
content_old: 9 the reply will be, “Because they forsook the covenant with the LORD their God and bowed down to other gods and served them.”

content: 10 Do not weep for the dead And do not lament for him; Weep rather for him who is leaving, For he shall never come back To see the land of his birth!
content_old: 10 Do not weep for the dead And do not lament for him; Weep rather for him who is leaving, For he shall never come back To see the land of his birth!

content: 11 For thus said the LORD concerning Shallum son of King Josiah of Judah, who succeeded his father Josiah as king, but who has gone forth from this place: He shall never come back.
content_old: 11 For thus said the LORD concerning Shallum son of King Josiah of Judah, who succeeded his father Josiah as king, but who has gone forth from this place: He shall never come back.

content: 12 He shall die in the place to which he was exiled, and he shall not see this land again.
content_old: 12 He shall die in the place to which he was exiled, and he shall not see this land again.

content: 13 Ha! he who builds his house with unfairness And his upper chambers with injustice, Who makes his fellow man work without pay And does not give him his wages,
content_old: 13 Ha! he who builds his house with unfairness And his upper chambers with injustice, Who makes his fellow man work without pay And does not give him his wages,

content: 14 Who thinks: I will build me a vast palace With spacious upper chambers, Provided with windows, Paneled in cedar, Painted with vermilion!
content_old: 14 Who thinks: I will build me a vast palace With spacious upper chambers, Provided with windows, Paneled in cedar, Painted with vermilion!

content: 15 Do you think you are more a king Because you compete in cedar? Your father ate and drank And dispensed justice and equity— Then all went well with him.
content_old: 15 Do you think you are more a king Because you compete in cedar? Your father ate and drank And dispensed justice and equity— Then all went well with him.

content: 16 He upheld the rights of the poor and needy— Then all was well. That is truly heeding Me —declares the LORD.
content_old: 16 He upheld the rights of the poor and needy— Then all was well. That is truly heeding Me —declares the LORD.

content: 17 But your eyes and your mind are only On ill-gotten gains, On shedding the blood of the innocent, On committing fraud and violence.
content_old: 17 But your eyes and your mind are only On ill-gotten gains, On shedding the blood of the innocent, On committing fraud and violence.

content: 18 Assuredly, thus said the LORD concerning Jehoiakim son of Josiah, king of Judah: They shall not mourn for him, “Ah, brother! Ah, sister!” They shall not mourn for him, “Ah, lord! Ah, his majesty!”
