content_old: 18 Assuredly, thus said the LORD concerning Jehoiakim son of Josiah, king of Judah: They shall not mourn for him, “Ah, brother! Ah, sister!” They shall not mourn for him, “Ah, lord! Ah, his majesty!”

content: 19 He shall have the burial of an ass, Dragged out and left lying Outside the gates of Jerusalem.
content_old: 19 He shall have the burial of an ass, Dragged out and left lying Outside the gates of Jerusalem.

content: 20 Climb Lebanon and cry out, Raise your voice in Bashan, Cry out from Abarim, For all your lovers are crushed.
content_old: 20 Climb Lebanon and cry out, Raise your voice in Bashan, Cry out from Abarim, For all your lovers are crushed.

content: 21 I spoke to you when you were prosperous; You said, “I will not listen.” That was your way ever since your youth, You would not heed Me.
content_old: 21 I spoke to you when you were prosperous; You said, “I will not listen.” That was your way ever since your youth, You would not heed Me.

content: 22 All your shepherds shall be devoured by the wind, And your lovers shall go into captivity. Then you shall be shamed and humiliated Because of all your depravity.
content_old: 22 All your shepherds shall be devoured by the wind, And your lovers shall go into captivity. Then you shall be shamed and humiliated Because of all your depravity.

content: 23 You who dwell in Lebanon, Nestled among the cedars, How much grace will you have When pains come upon you, Travail as in childbirth!
content_old: 23 You who dwell in Lebanon, Nestled among the cedars, How much grace will you have When pains come upon you, Travail as in childbirth!

content: 24 As I live—declares the LORD—if you, O King Coniah, son of Jehoiakim, of Judah, were a signet on my right hand, I would tear you off even from there.
content_old: 24 As I live—declares the LORD—if you, O King Coniah, son of Jehoiakim, of Judah, were a signet on my right hand, I would tear you off even from there.

content: 25 I will deliver you into the hands of those who seek your life, into the hands of those you dread, into the hands of King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon and into the hands of the Chaldeans.
content_old: 25 I will deliver you into the hands of those who seek your life, into the hands of those you dread, into the hands of King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon and into the hands of the Chaldeans.

content: 26 I will hurl you and the mother who bore you into another land, where you were not born; there you shall both die.
content_old: 26 I will hurl you and the mother who bore you into another land, where you were not born; there you shall both die.

content: 27 They shall not return to the land that they yearn to come back to.
content_old: 27 They shall not return to the land that they yearn to come back to.

content: 28 Is this man Coniah A wretched broken pot, A vessel no one wants? Why are he and his offspring hurled out, And cast away in a land they knew not?
content_old: 28 Is this man Coniah A wretched broken pot, A vessel no one wants? Why are he and his offspring hurled out, And cast away in a land they knew not?

content: 29 O land, land, land, Hear the word of the LORD!
content_old: 29 O land, land, land, Hear the word of the LORD!

content: 1 Ah, shepherds who let the flock of My pasture stray and scatter!—declares the LORD.
content_old: 1 Ah, shepherds who let the flock of My pasture stray and scatter!—declares the LORD.

content: 2 Assuredly, thus said the LORD, the God of Israel, concerning the shepherds who should tend My people: It is you who let My flock scatter and go astray. You gave no thought to them, but I am going to give thought to you, for your wicked acts—declares the LORD.
content_old: 2 Assuredly, thus said the LORD, the God of Israel, concerning the shepherds who should tend My people: It is you who let My flock scatter and go astray. You gave no thought to them, but I am going to give thought to you, for your wicked acts—declares the LORD.

content: 3 And I Myself will gather the remnant of My flock from all the lands to which I have banished them, and I will bring them back to their pasture, where they shall be fertile and increase.
content_old: 3 And I Myself will gather the remnant of My flock from all the lands to which I have banished them, and I will bring them back to their pasture, where they shall be fertile and increase.

content: 4 And I will appoint over them shepherds who will tend them; they shall no longer fear or be dismayed, and none of them shall be missing—declares the LORD.
content_old: 4 And I will appoint over them shepherds who will tend them; they shall no longer fear or be dismayed, and none of them shall be missing—declares the LORD.

content: 5 See, a time is coming—declares the LORD—when I will raise up a true branch of David’s line. He shall reign as king and shall prosper, and he shall do what is just and right in the land.
content_old: 5 See, a time is coming—declares the LORD—when I will raise up a true branch of David’s line. He shall reign as king and shall prosper, and he shall do what is just and right in the land.

content: 6 In his days Judah shall be delivered and Israel shall dwell secure. And this is the name by which he shall be called: “The LORD is our Vindicator.”
content_old: 6 In his days Judah shall be delivered and Israel shall dwell secure. And this is the name by which he shall be called: “The LORD is our Vindicator.”

content: 7 Assuredly, a time is coming—declares the LORD—when it shall no more be said, “As the LORD lives, who brought the Israelites out of the land of Egypt,”
content_old: 7 Assuredly, a time is coming—declares the LORD—when it shall no more be said, “As the LORD lives, who brought the Israelites out of the land of Egypt,”

content: 8 but rather, “As the LORD lives, who brought out and led the offspring of the House of Israel from the northland and from all the lands to which I have banished them.” And they shall dwell upon their own soil.
content_old: 8 but rather, “As the LORD lives, who brought out and led the offspring of the House of Israel from the northland and from all the lands to which I have banished them.” And they shall dwell upon their own soil.

content: 9 Concerning the prophets. My heart is crushed within me, All my bones are trembling; I have become like a drunken man, Like one overcome by wine— Because of the LORD and His holy word.
content_old: 9 Concerning the prophets. My heart is crushed within me, All my bones are trembling; I have become like a drunken man, Like one overcome by wine— Because of the LORD and His holy word.

content: 10 For the land is full of adulterers, The land mourns because of a curse; The pastures of the wilderness are dried up. For they run to do evil, They strain to do wrong.
content_old: 10 For the land is full of adulterers, The land mourns because of a curse; The pastures of the wilderness are dried up. For they run to do evil, They strain to do wrong.

content: 11 For both prophet and priest are godless; Even in My House I find their wickedness —declares the LORD.
content_old: 11 For both prophet and priest are godless; Even in My House I find their wickedness —declares the LORD.

content: 12 Assuredly, Their path shall become Like slippery ground; They shall be thrust into darkness And there they shall fall; For I will bring disaster upon them, The year of their doom —declares the LORD.
content_old: 12 Assuredly, Their path shall become Like slippery ground; They shall be thrust into darkness And there they shall fall; For I will bring disaster upon them, The year of their doom —declares the LORD.

content: 13 In the prophets of Samaria I saw a repulsive thing: They prophesied by Baal And led My people Israel astray.
content_old: 13 In the prophets of Samaria I saw a repulsive thing: They prophesied by Baal And led My people Israel astray.

content: 14 But what I see in the prophets of Jerusalem Is something horrifying: Adultery and false dealing. They encourage evildoers, So that no one turns back from his wickedness. To Me they are all like Sodom, And [all] its inhabitants like Gomorrah.
content_old: 14 But what I see in the prophets of Jerusalem Is something horrifying: Adultery and false dealing. They encourage evildoers, So that no one turns back from his wickedness. To Me they are all like Sodom, And [all] its inhabitants like Gomorrah.

content: 15 Assuredly, thus said the LORD of Hosts concerning the prophets: I am going to make them eat wormwood And drink a bitter draft; For from the prophets of Jerusalem Godlessness has gone forth to the whole land.
content_old: 15 Assuredly, thus said the LORD of Hosts concerning the prophets: I am going to make them eat wormwood And drink a bitter draft; For from the prophets of Jerusalem Godlessness has gone forth to the whole land.

content: 16 Thus said the LORD of Hosts: Do not listen to the words of the prophets Who prophesy to you. They are deluding you, The prophecies they speak are from their own minds, Not from the mouth of the LORD.
content_old: 16 Thus said the LORD of Hosts: Do not listen to the words of the prophets Who prophesy to you. They are deluding you, The prophecies they speak are from their own minds, Not from the mouth of the LORD.

content: 17 They declare to men who despise Me: The LORD has said: “All shall be well with you”; And to all who follow their willful hearts they say: “No evil shall befall you.”
content_old: 17 They declare to men who despise Me: The LORD has said: “All shall be well with you”; And to all who follow their willful hearts they say: “No evil shall befall you.”

content: 18 But he who has stood in the council of the LORD, And seen, and heard His word— He who has listened to His word must obey.
content_old: 18 But he who has stood in the council of the LORD, And seen, and heard His word— He who has listened to His word must obey.

content: 19 Lo, the storm of the LORD goes forth in fury, A whirling storm, It shall whirl down upon the heads of the wicked.
content_old: 19 Lo, the storm of the LORD goes forth in fury, A whirling storm, It shall whirl down upon the heads of the wicked.

content: 20 The anger of the LORD shall not turn back Till it has fulfilled and completed His purposes. In the days to come You shall clearly perceive it.
content_old: 20 The anger of the LORD shall not turn back Till it has fulfilled and completed His purposes. In the days to come You shall clearly perceive it.

content: 21 I did not send those prophets, But they rushed in; I did not speak to them, Yet they prophesied.
content_old: 21 I did not send those prophets, But they rushed in; I did not speak to them, Yet they prophesied.

content: 22 If they have stood in My council, Let them announce My words to My people And make them turn back From their evil ways and wicked acts.
content_old: 22 If they have stood in My council, Let them announce My words to My people And make them turn back From their evil ways and wicked acts.

content: 23 Am I only a God near at hand —says the LORD— And not a God far away?
content_old: 23 Am I only a God near at hand —says the LORD— And not a God far away?

content: 24 If a man enters a hiding place, Do I not see him? —says the LORD. For I fill both heaven and earth —declares the LORD.
content_old: 24 If a man enters a hiding place, Do I not see him? —says the LORD. For I fill both heaven and earth —declares the LORD.

content: 25 I have heard what the prophets say, who prophesy falsely in My name: “I had a dream, I had a dream.”
content_old: 25 I have heard what the prophets say, who prophesy falsely in My name: “I had a dream, I had a dream.”

content: 26 How long will there be in the minds of the prophets who prophesy falsehood—the prophets of their own deceitful minds—
content_old: 26 How long will there be in the minds of the prophets who prophesy falsehood—the prophets of their own deceitful minds—

content: 27 the plan to make My people forget My name, by means of the dreams which they tell each other, just as their fathers forgot My name because of Baal?
content_old: 27 the plan to make My people forget My name, by means of the dreams which they tell each other, just as their fathers forgot My name because of Baal?

content: 28 Let the prophet who has a dream tell the dream; and let him who has received My word report My word faithfully! How can straw be compared to grain?—says the LORD.
content_old: 28 Let the prophet who has a dream tell the dream; and let him who has received My word report My word faithfully! How can straw be compared to grain?—says the LORD.

content: 29 Behold, My word is like fire—declares the LORD—and like a hammer that shatters rock!
content_old: 29 Behold, My word is like fire—declares the LORD—and like a hammer that shatters rock!

content: 30 Assuredly, I am going to deal with the prophets—declares the LORD—who steal My words from one another.
content_old: 30 Assuredly, I am going to deal with the prophets—declares the LORD—who steal My words from one another.

content: 31 I am going to deal with the prophets—declares the LORD—who wag their tongues and make oracular utterances.
content_old: 31 I am going to deal with the prophets—declares the LORD—who wag their tongues and make oracular utterances.

content: 32 I am going to deal with those who prophesy lying dreams—declares the LORD—who relate them to lead My people astray with their reckless lies, when I did not send them or command them. They do this people no good—declares the LORD.
content_old: 32 I am going to deal with those who prophesy lying dreams—declares the LORD—who relate them to lead My people astray with their reckless lies, when I did not send them or command them. They do this people no good—declares the LORD.

content: 33 And when this people—or a prophet or a priest—asks you, “What is the burden of the LORD?” you shall answer them, “What is the burden? I will cast you off”—declares the LORD.
content_old: 33 And when this people—or a prophet or a priest—asks you, “What is the burden of the LORD?” you shall answer them, “What is the burden? I will cast you off”—declares the LORD.

content: 34 As for the prophet or priest or layman who shall say “the burden of the LORD,” I will punish that person and his house.
content_old: 34 As for the prophet or priest or layman who shall say “the burden of the LORD,” I will punish that person and his house.

content: 35 Thus you shall speak to each other, every one to his fellow, “What has the LORD answered?” or “What has the LORD spoken?”
content_old: 35 Thus you shall speak to each other, every one to his fellow, “What has the LORD answered?” or “What has the LORD spoken?”

content: 36 But do not mention “the burden of the LORD” any more. Does a man regard his own word as a “burden,” that you pervert the words of the living God, the LORD of Hosts, our God?
content_old: 36 But do not mention “the burden of the LORD” any more. Does a man regard his own word as a “burden,” that you pervert the words of the living God, the LORD of Hosts, our God?

content: 37 Thus you shall speak to the prophet: “What did the LORD answer you?” or “What did the LORD speak?”
content_old: 37 Thus you shall speak to the prophet: “What did the LORD answer you?” or “What did the LORD speak?”

content: 38 But if you say “the burden of the LORD”—assuredly, thus said the LORD: Because you said this thing, “the burden of the LORD,” whereas I sent word to you not to say “the burden of the LORD,”
content_old: 38 But if you say “the burden of the LORD”—assuredly, thus said the LORD: Because you said this thing, “the burden of the LORD,” whereas I sent word to you not to say “the burden of the LORD,”

content: 39 I will utterly forget you and I will cast you away from My presence, together with the city that I gave to you and your fathers.
content_old: 39 I will utterly forget you and I will cast you away from My presence, together with the city that I gave to you and your fathers.

content: 1 The LORD showed me two baskets of figs, placed in front of the Temple of the LORD. This was after King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon had exiled King Jeconiah son of Jehoiakim of Judah, and the officials of Judah, and the craftsmen and smiths, from Jerusalem, and had brought them to Babylon.
content_old: 1 The LORD showed me two baskets of figs, placed in front of the Temple of the LORD. This was after King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon had exiled King Jeconiah son of Jehoiakim of Judah, and the officials of Judah, and the craftsmen and smiths, from Jerusalem, and had brought them to Babylon.

content: 2 One basket contained very good figs, like first-ripened figs, and the other basket contained very bad figs, so bad that they could not be eaten.
content_old: 2 One basket contained very good figs, like first-ripened figs, and the other basket contained very bad figs, so bad that they could not be eaten.

content: 3 And the LORD said to me, “What do you see, Jeremiah?” I answered, “Figs—the good ones are very good, and the bad ones very bad, so bad that they cannot be eaten.”
content_old: 3 And the LORD said to me, “What do you see, Jeremiah?” I answered, “Figs—the good ones are very good, and the bad ones very bad, so bad that they cannot be eaten.”

content: 4 Then the word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 4 Then the word of the LORD came to me:

content: 5 Thus said the LORD, the God of Israel: As with these good figs, so will I single out for good the Judean exiles whom I have driven out from this place to the land of the Chaldeans.
content_old: 5 Thus said the LORD, the God of Israel: As with these good figs, so will I single out for good the Judean exiles whom I have driven out from this place to the land of the Chaldeans.

content: 6 I will look upon them favorably, and I will bring them back to this land; I will build them and not overthrow them; I will plant them and not uproot them.
content_old: 6 I will look upon them favorably, and I will bring them back to this land; I will build them and not overthrow them; I will plant them and not uproot them.

content: 7 And I will give them the understanding to acknowledge Me, for I am the LORD. And they shall be My people and I will be their God, when they turn back to Me with all their heart.
content_old: 7 And I will give them the understanding to acknowledge Me, for I am the LORD. And they shall be My people and I will be their God, when they turn back to Me with all their heart.

content: 8 And like the bad figs, which are so bad that they cannot be eaten—thus said the Lord—so will I treat King Zedekiah of Judah and his officials and the remnant of Jerusalem that is left in this land, and those who are living in the land of Egypt:
content_old: 8 And like the bad figs, which are so bad that they cannot be eaten—thus said the Lord—so will I treat King Zedekiah of Judah and his officials and the remnant of Jerusalem that is left in this land, and those who are living in the land of Egypt:

content: 9 I will make them a horror—an evil—to all the kingdoms of the earth, a disgrace and a proverb, a byword and a curse in all the places to which I banish them.
content_old: 9 I will make them a horror—an evil—to all the kingdoms of the earth, a disgrace and a proverb, a byword and a curse in all the places to which I banish them.

content: 1 The word which came to Jeremiah concerning all the people of Judah, in the fourth year of King Jehoiakim son of Josiah of Judah, which was the first year of King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon.
content_old: 1 The word which came to Jeremiah concerning all the people of Judah, in the fourth year of King Jehoiakim son of Josiah of Judah, which was the first year of King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon.

content: 2 This is what the prophet Jeremiah said to all the people of Judah and to all the inhabitants of Jerusalem:
content_old: 2 This is what the prophet Jeremiah said to all the people of Judah and to all the inhabitants of Jerusalem:

content: 3 From the thirteenth year of King Josiah son of Amon of Judah, to this day—these twenty-three years—the word of the LORD has come to me. I have spoken to you persistently, but you would not listen.
content_old: 3 From the thirteenth year of King Josiah son of Amon of Judah, to this day—these twenty-three years—the word of the LORD has come to me. I have spoken to you persistently, but you would not listen.

content: 4 Moreover, the LORD constantly sent all his servants the prophets to you, but you would not listen or incline your ears to hear
content_old: 4 Moreover, the LORD constantly sent all his servants the prophets to you, but you would not listen or incline your ears to hear

content: 5 when they said, “Turn back, every one, from your evil ways and your wicked acts, that you may remain throughout the ages on the soil which the LORD gave to you and your fathers.
content_old: 5 when they said, “Turn back, every one, from your evil ways and your wicked acts, that you may remain throughout the ages on the soil which the LORD gave to you and your fathers.

content: 6 Do not follow other gods, to serve them and worship them. Do not vex Me with what your own hands have made, and I will not bring disaster upon you.”
content_old: 6 Do not follow other gods, to serve them and worship them. Do not vex Me with what your own hands have made, and I will not bring disaster upon you.”

content: 7 But you would not listen to Me—declares the LORD—but vexed Me with what your hands made, to your own hurt.
content_old: 7 But you would not listen to Me—declares the LORD—but vexed Me with what your hands made, to your own hurt.

content: 8 Assuredly, thus said the LORD of Hosts: Because you would not listen to My words,
content_old: 8 Assuredly, thus said the LORD of Hosts: Because you would not listen to My words,

content: 9 I am going to send for all the peoples of the north—declares the LORD—and for My servant, King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon, and bring them against this land and its inhabitants, and against all those nations roundabout. I will exterminate them and make them a desolation, an object of hissing—ruins for all time.
content_old: 9 I am going to send for all the peoples of the north—declares the LORD—and for My servant, King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon, and bring them against this land and its inhabitants, and against all those nations roundabout. I will exterminate them and make them a desolation, an object of hissing—ruins for all time.

content: 10 And I will banish from them the sound of mirth and gladness, the voice of bridegroom and bride, and the sound of the mill and the light of the lamp.
content_old: 10 And I will banish from them the sound of mirth and gladness, the voice of bridegroom and bride, and the sound of the mill and the light of the lamp.

content: 11 This whole land shall be a desolate ruin. And those nations shall serve the king of Babylon seventy years.
content_old: 11 This whole land shall be a desolate ruin. And those nations shall serve the king of Babylon seventy years.

content: 12 When the seventy years are over, I will punish the king of Babylon and that nation and the land of the Chaldeans for their sins—declares the LORD—and I will make it a desolation for all time.
content_old: 12 When the seventy years are over, I will punish the king of Babylon and that nation and the land of the Chaldeans for their sins—declares the LORD—and I will make it a desolation for all time.

content: 13 And I will bring upon that land all that I have decreed against it, all that is recorded in this book—that which Jeremiah prophesied against all the nations.
content_old: 13 And I will bring upon that land all that I have decreed against it, all that is recorded in this book—that which Jeremiah prophesied against all the nations.

content: 14 For they too shall be enslaved by many nations and great kings; and I will requite them according to their acts and according to their conduct.
content_old: 14 For they too shall be enslaved by many nations and great kings; and I will requite them according to their acts and according to their conduct.

content: 15 For thus said the LORD, the God of Israel, to me: “Take from My hand this cup of wine—of wrath—and make all the nations to whom I send you drink of it.
content_old: 15 For thus said the LORD, the God of Israel, to me: “Take from My hand this cup of wine—of wrath—and make all the nations to whom I send you drink of it.

content: 16 Let them drink and retch and act crazy, because of the sword that I am sending among them.”
content_old: 16 Let them drink and retch and act crazy, because of the sword that I am sending among them.”

content: 17 So I took the cup from the hand of the LORD and gave drink to all the nations to whom the LORD had sent me:
content_old: 17 So I took the cup from the hand of the LORD and gave drink to all the nations to whom the LORD had sent me:

content: 18 Jerusalem and the towns of Judah, and its kings and officials, to make them a desolate ruin, an object of hissing and a curse—as is now the case;
content_old: 18 Jerusalem and the towns of Judah, and its kings and officials, to make them a desolate ruin, an object of hissing and a curse—as is now the case;

content: 19 Pharaoh king of Egypt, his courtiers, his officials, and all his people;
content_old: 19 Pharaoh king of Egypt, his courtiers, his officials, and all his people;

content: 20 all the mixed peoples; all the kings of the land of Uz; all the kings of the land of the Philistines—Ashkelon, Gaza, Ekron, and what is left of Ashdod;
content_old: 20 all the mixed peoples; all the kings of the land of Uz; all the kings of the land of the Philistines—Ashkelon, Gaza, Ekron, and what is left of Ashdod;

content: 21 Edom, Moab, and Ammon;
content_old: 21 Edom, Moab, and Ammon;

content: 22 all the kings of Tyre and all the kings of Sidon, and all the kings of the coastland across the sea;
content_old: 22 all the kings of Tyre and all the kings of Sidon, and all the kings of the coastland across the sea;

content: 23 Dedan, Tema, and Buz, and all those who have their hair clipped;
content_old: 23 Dedan, Tema, and Buz, and all those who have their hair clipped;

content: 24 all the kings of Arabia, and all the kings of the mixed peoples who live in the desert;
content_old: 24 all the kings of Arabia, and all the kings of the mixed peoples who live in the desert;

content: 25 all the kings of Zimri and all the kings of Elam and all the kings of Media;
content_old: 25 all the kings of Zimri and all the kings of Elam and all the kings of Media;

content: 26 all the kings of the north, whether far from or close to each other—all the royal lands which are on the earth. And last of all, the king of Sheshach shall drink.
content_old: 26 all the kings of the north, whether far from or close to each other—all the royal lands which are on the earth. And last of all, the king of Sheshach shall drink.

content: 27 Say to them: “Thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: Drink and get drunk and vomit; fall and never rise again, because of the sword that I send among you.”
content_old: 27 Say to them: “Thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: Drink and get drunk and vomit; fall and never rise again, because of the sword that I send among you.”

content: 28 And if they refuse to take the cup from your hand and drink, say to them, “Thus said the LORD of Hosts: You must drink!
content_old: 28 And if they refuse to take the cup from your hand and drink, say to them, “Thus said the LORD of Hosts: You must drink!

content: 29 If I am bringing the punishment first on the city that bears My name, do you expect to go unpunished? You will not go unpunished, for I am summoning the sword against all the inhabitants of the earth—declares the LORD of Hosts.”
content_old: 29 If I am bringing the punishment first on the city that bears My name, do you expect to go unpunished? You will not go unpunished, for I am summoning the sword against all the inhabitants of the earth—declares the LORD of Hosts.”

content: 30 You are to prophesy all those things to them, and then say to them: The LORD roars from on high, He makes His voice heard from His holy dwelling; He roars aloud over His earthly abode; He utters shouts like the grape-treaders, Against all the dwellers on earth.
content_old: 30 You are to prophesy all those things to them, and then say to them: The LORD roars from on high, He makes His voice heard from His holy dwelling; He roars aloud over His earthly abode; He utters shouts like the grape-treaders, Against all the dwellers on earth.

content: 31 Tumult has reached the ends of the earth, For the LORD has a case against the nations, He contends with all flesh. He delivers the wicked to the sword —declares the LORD.
content_old: 31 Tumult has reached the ends of the earth, For the LORD has a case against the nations, He contends with all flesh. He delivers the wicked to the sword —declares the LORD.

content: 32 Thus said the LORD of Hosts: Disaster goes forth From nation to nation; A great storm is unleashed From the remotest parts of earth.
content_old: 32 Thus said the LORD of Hosts: Disaster goes forth From nation to nation; A great storm is unleashed From the remotest parts of earth.

content: 33 In that day, the earth shall be strewn with the slain of the LORD from one end to the other. They shall not be mourned, or gathered and buried; they shall become dung upon the face of the earth.
content_old: 33 In that day, the earth shall be strewn with the slain of the LORD from one end to the other. They shall not be mourned, or gathered and buried; they shall become dung upon the face of the earth.

content: 34 Howl, you shepherds, and yell, Strew on yourselves, you lords of the flock! For the day of your slaughter draws near. I will break you in pieces, And you shall fall like a precious vessel.
content_old: 34 Howl, you shepherds, and yell, Strew on yourselves, you lords of the flock! For the day of your slaughter draws near. I will break you in pieces, And you shall fall like a precious vessel.

content: 35 Flight shall fail the shepherds, And escape, the lords of the flock.
content_old: 35 Flight shall fail the shepherds, And escape, the lords of the flock.

content: 36 Hark, the outcry of the shepherds, And the howls of the lords of the flock! For the LORD is ravaging their pasture.
content_old: 36 Hark, the outcry of the shepherds, And the howls of the lords of the flock! For the LORD is ravaging their pasture.

content: 37 The peaceful meadows shall be wiped out By the fierce wrath of the LORD.
content_old: 37 The peaceful meadows shall be wiped out By the fierce wrath of the LORD.

content: 1 At the beginning of the reign of King Jehoiakim son of Josiah of Judah, this word came from the LORD:
content_old: 1 At the beginning of the reign of King Jehoiakim son of Josiah of Judah, this word came from the LORD:

content: 2 “Thus said the LORD: Stand in the court of the House of the LORD, and speak to all the towns of Judah, who are coming to worship in the House of the LORD, all the words which I command you to speak to them. Do not omit anything.
content_old: 2 “Thus said the LORD: Stand in the court of the House of the LORD, and speak to all the towns of Judah, who are coming to worship in the House of the LORD, all the words which I command you to speak to them. Do not omit anything.

content: 3 Perhaps they will listen and turn back, each from his evil way, that I may renounce the punishment I am planning to bring upon them for their wicked acts.
content_old: 3 Perhaps they will listen and turn back, each from his evil way, that I may renounce the punishment I am planning to bring upon them for their wicked acts.

content: 4 “Say to them: Thus said the LORD: If you do not obey Me, abiding by the Teaching that I have set before you,
content_old: 4 “Say to them: Thus said the LORD: If you do not obey Me, abiding by the Teaching that I have set before you,

content: 5 heeding the words of My servants the prophets whom I have been sending to you persistently—but you have not heeded—
content_old: 5 heeding the words of My servants the prophets whom I have been sending to you persistently—but you have not heeded—

content: 6 then I will make this House like Shiloh, and I will make this city a curse for all the nations of earth.”
content_old: 6 then I will make this House like Shiloh, and I will make this city a curse for all the nations of earth.”

content: 7 The priests and prophets and all the people heard Jeremiah speaking these words in the House of the LORD.
content_old: 7 The priests and prophets and all the people heard Jeremiah speaking these words in the House of the LORD.

content: 8 And when Jeremiah finished speaking all that the LORD had commanded him to speak to all the people, the priests and the prophets and all the people seized him, shouting, “You shall die!
content_old: 8 And when Jeremiah finished speaking all that the LORD had commanded him to speak to all the people, the priests and the prophets and all the people seized him, shouting, “You shall die!

content: 9 How dare you prophesy in the name of the LORD that this House shall become like Shiloh and this city be made desolate, without inhabitants?” And all the people crowded about Jeremiah in the House of the LORD.
content_old: 9 How dare you prophesy in the name of the LORD that this House shall become like Shiloh and this city be made desolate, without inhabitants?” And all the people crowded about Jeremiah in the House of the LORD.

content: 10 When the officials of Judah heard about this, they went up from the king’s palace to the House of the LORD and held a session at the entrance of the New Gate of the House of the LORD.
content_old: 10 When the officials of Judah heard about this, they went up from the king’s palace to the House of the LORD and held a session at the entrance of the New Gate of the House of the LORD.

content: 11 The priests and prophets said to the officials and to all the people, “This man deserves the death penalty, for he has prophesied against this city, as you yourselves have heard.”
content_old: 11 The priests and prophets said to the officials and to all the people, “This man deserves the death penalty, for he has prophesied against this city, as you yourselves have heard.”

content: 12 Jeremiah said to the officials and to all the people, “It was the LORD who sent me to prophesy against this House and this city all the words you heard.
content_old: 12 Jeremiah said to the officials and to all the people, “It was the LORD who sent me to prophesy against this House and this city all the words you heard.

content: 13 Therefore mend your ways and your acts, and heed the LORD your God, that the LORD may renounce the punishment He has decreed for you.
content_old: 13 Therefore mend your ways and your acts, and heed the LORD your God, that the LORD may renounce the punishment He has decreed for you.

content: 14 As for me, I am in your hands: do to me what seems good and right to you.
content_old: 14 As for me, I am in your hands: do to me what seems good and right to you.

content: 15 But know that if you put me to death, you and this city and its inhabitants will be guilty of shedding the blood of an innocent man. For in truth the LORD has sent me to you, to speak all these words to you.”
content_old: 15 But know that if you put me to death, you and this city and its inhabitants will be guilty of shedding the blood of an innocent man. For in truth the LORD has sent me to you, to speak all these words to you.”

content: 16 Then the officials and all the people said to the priests and prophets, “This man does not deserve the death penalty, for he spoke to us in the name of the LORD our God.”
content_old: 16 Then the officials and all the people said to the priests and prophets, “This man does not deserve the death penalty, for he spoke to us in the name of the LORD our God.”

content: 17 And some of the elders of the land arose and said to the entire assemblage of the people,
content_old: 17 And some of the elders of the land arose and said to the entire assemblage of the people,

content: 18 “Micah the Morashtite, who prophesied in the days of King Hezekiah of Judah, said to all the people of Judah: ‘Thus said the LORD of Hosts: Zion shall be plowed as a field, Jerusalem shall become heaps of ruins And the Temple Mount a shrine in the woods.’
content_old: 18 “Micah the Morashtite, who prophesied in the days of King Hezekiah of Judah, said to all the people of Judah: ‘Thus said the LORD of Hosts: Zion shall be plowed as a field, Jerusalem shall become heaps of ruins And the Temple Mount a shrine in the woods.’

content: 19 “Did King Hezekiah of Judah, and all Judah, put him to death? Did he not rather fear the LORD and implore the LORD, so that the LORD renounced the punishment He had decreed against them? We are about to do great injury to ourselves!”
content_old: 19 “Did King Hezekiah of Judah, and all Judah, put him to death? Did he not rather fear the LORD and implore the LORD, so that the LORD renounced the punishment He had decreed against them? We are about to do great injury to ourselves!”

content: 20 There was also a man prophesying in the name of the LORD, Uriah son of Shemaiah from Kiriath-jearim, who prophesied against this city and this land the same things as Jeremiah.
content_old: 20 There was also a man prophesying in the name of the LORD, Uriah son of Shemaiah from Kiriath-jearim, who prophesied against this city and this land the same things as Jeremiah.

content: 21 King Jehoiakim and all his warriors and all the officials heard about his address, and the king wanted to put him to death. Uriah heard of this and fled in fear, and came to Egypt.
content_old: 21 King Jehoiakim and all his warriors and all the officials heard about his address, and the king wanted to put him to death. Uriah heard of this and fled in fear, and came to Egypt.

content: 22 But King Jehoiakim sent men to Egypt, Elnathan son of Achbor and men with him to Egypt.
content_old: 22 But King Jehoiakim sent men to Egypt, Elnathan son of Achbor and men with him to Egypt.

content: 23 They took Uriah out of Egypt and brought him to King Jehoiakim, who had him put to the sword and his body thrown into the burial place of the common people.
content_old: 23 They took Uriah out of Egypt and brought him to King Jehoiakim, who had him put to the sword and his body thrown into the burial place of the common people.

content: 1 At the beginning of the reign of King Jehoiakim son of Josiah of Judah, this word came to Jeremiah from the LORD:
content_old: 1 At the beginning of the reign of King Jehoiakim son of Josiah of Judah, this word came to Jeremiah from the LORD:

content: 2 Thus said the LORD to me: Make for yourself thongs and bars of a yoke, and put them on your neck.
content_old: 2 Thus said the LORD to me: Make for yourself thongs and bars of a yoke, and put them on your neck.

content: 3 And send them to the king of Edom, the king of Moab, the king of the Ammonites, the king of Tyre, and the king of Sidon, by envoys who have come to King Zedekiah of Judah in Jerusalem;
content_old: 3 And send them to the king of Edom, the king of Moab, the king of the Ammonites, the king of Tyre, and the king of Sidon, by envoys who have come to King Zedekiah of Judah in Jerusalem;

content: 4 and give them this charge to their masters: Thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: Say this to your masters:
content_old: 4 and give them this charge to their masters: Thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: Say this to your masters:

content: 5 “It is I who made the earth, and the men and beasts who are on the earth, by My great might and My outstretched arm; and I give it to whomever I deem proper.
content_old: 5 “It is I who made the earth, and the men and beasts who are on the earth, by My great might and My outstretched arm; and I give it to whomever I deem proper.

content: 6 I herewith deliver all these lands to My servant, King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon; I even give him the wild beasts to serve him.
content_old: 6 I herewith deliver all these lands to My servant, King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon; I even give him the wild beasts to serve him.

content: 7 All nations shall serve him, his son and his grandson—until the turn of his own land comes, when many nations and great kings shall subjugate him.
content_old: 7 All nations shall serve him, his son and his grandson—until the turn of his own land comes, when many nations and great kings shall subjugate him.

content: 8 The nation or kingdom that does not serve him—King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon—and does not put its neck under the yoke of the king of Babylon, that nation I will visit—declares the LORD—with sword, famine, and pestilence, until I have destroyed it by his hands.
content_old: 8 The nation or kingdom that does not serve him—King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon—and does not put its neck under the yoke of the king of Babylon, that nation I will visit—declares the LORD—with sword, famine, and pestilence, until I have destroyed it by his hands.

content: 9 As for you, give no heed to your prophets, augurs, dreamers, diviners, and sorcerers, who say to you, ‘Do not serve the king of Babylon.’
content_old: 9 As for you, give no heed to your prophets, augurs, dreamers, diviners, and sorcerers, who say to you, ‘Do not serve the king of Babylon.’

content: 10 For they prophesy falsely to you—with the result that you shall be banished from your land; I will drive you out and you shall perish.
content_old: 10 For they prophesy falsely to you—with the result that you shall be banished from your land; I will drive you out and you shall perish.

content: 11 But the nation that puts its neck under the yoke of the king of Babylon, and serves him, will be left by Me on its own soil—declares the LORD—to till it and dwell on it.”
content_old: 11 But the nation that puts its neck under the yoke of the king of Babylon, and serves him, will be left by Me on its own soil—declares the LORD—to till it and dwell on it.”

content: 12 I also spoke to King Zedekiah of Judah in just the same way: “Put your necks under the yoke of the king of Babylon; serve him and his people, and live!
content_old: 12 I also spoke to King Zedekiah of Judah in just the same way: “Put your necks under the yoke of the king of Babylon; serve him and his people, and live!

content: 13 Otherwise you will die together with your people, by sword, famine, and pestilence, as the LORD has decreed against any nation that does not serve the king of Babylon.
content_old: 13 Otherwise you will die together with your people, by sword, famine, and pestilence, as the LORD has decreed against any nation that does not serve the king of Babylon.

content: 14 Give no heed to the words of the prophets who say to you, ‘Do not serve the king of Babylon,’ for they prophesy falsely to you.
content_old: 14 Give no heed to the words of the prophets who say to you, ‘Do not serve the king of Babylon,’ for they prophesy falsely to you.

content: 15 I have not sent them—declares the LORD—and they prophesy falsely in My name, with the result that I will drive you out and you shall perish, together with the prophets who prophesy to you.”
content_old: 15 I have not sent them—declares the LORD—and they prophesy falsely in My name, with the result that I will drive you out and you shall perish, together with the prophets who prophesy to you.”

content: 16 And to the priests and to all that people I said: “Thus said the LORD: Give no heed to the words of the prophets who prophesy to you, ‘The vessels of the House of the LORD shall shortly be brought back from Babylon,’ for they prophesy falsely to you.
content_old: 16 And to the priests and to all that people I said: “Thus said the LORD: Give no heed to the words of the prophets who prophesy to you, ‘The vessels of the House of the LORD shall shortly be brought back from Babylon,’ for they prophesy falsely to you.

content: 17 Give them no heed. Serve the king of Babylon, and live! Otherwise this city shall become a ruin.
content_old: 17 Give them no heed. Serve the king of Babylon, and live! Otherwise this city shall become a ruin.

content: 18 If they are really prophets and the word of the LORD is with them, let them intercede with the LORD of Hosts not to let the vessels remaining in the House of the LORD, in the royal palace of Judah, and in Jerusalem, go to Babylon!
content_old: 18 If they are really prophets and the word of the LORD is with them, let them intercede with the LORD of Hosts not to let the vessels remaining in the House of the LORD, in the royal palace of Judah, and in Jerusalem, go to Babylon!

content: 19 “For thus said the LORD of Hosts concerning the columns, the tank, the stands, and the rest of the vessels remaining in this city,
content_old: 19 “For thus said the LORD of Hosts concerning the columns, the tank, the stands, and the rest of the vessels remaining in this city,

content: 20 which King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon did not take when he exiled King Jeconiah son of Jehoiakim of Judah, from Jerusalem to Babylon, with all the nobles of Judah and Jerusalem;
content_old: 20 which King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon did not take when he exiled King Jeconiah son of Jehoiakim of Judah, from Jerusalem to Babylon, with all the nobles of Judah and Jerusalem;

content: 21 for thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, concerning the vessels remaining in the House of the LORD, in the royal palace of Judah, and in Jerusalem:
content_old: 21 for thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, concerning the vessels remaining in the House of the LORD, in the royal palace of Judah, and in Jerusalem:

content: 1 That year, early in the reign of King Zedekiah of Judah, in the fifth month of the fourth year, the prophet Hananiah son of Azzur, who was from Gibeon, spoke to me in the House of the LORD, in the presence of the priests and all the people. He said:
content_old: 1 That year, early in the reign of King Zedekiah of Judah, in the fifth month of the fourth year, the prophet Hananiah son of Azzur, who was from Gibeon, spoke to me in the House of the LORD, in the presence of the priests and all the people. He said:

content: 2 “Thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: I hereby break the yoke of the king of Babylon.
content_old: 2 “Thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: I hereby break the yoke of the king of Babylon.

content: 3 In two years, I will restore to this place all the vessels of the House of the LORD which King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon took from this place and brought to Babylon.
content_old: 3 In two years, I will restore to this place all the vessels of the House of the LORD which King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon took from this place and brought to Babylon.

content: 4 And I will bring back to this place King Jeconiah son of Jehoiakim of Judah, and all the Judean exiles who went to Babylon—declares the LORD. Yes, I will break the yoke of the king of Babylon.”
content_old: 4 And I will bring back to this place King Jeconiah son of Jehoiakim of Judah, and all the Judean exiles who went to Babylon—declares the LORD. Yes, I will break the yoke of the king of Babylon.”

content: 5 Then the prophet Jeremiah answered the prophet Hananiah in the presence of the priests and of all the people who were standing in the House of the LORD.
content_old: 5 Then the prophet Jeremiah answered the prophet Hananiah in the presence of the priests and of all the people who were standing in the House of the LORD.

content: 6 The prophet Jeremiah said: “Amen! May the LORD do so! May the LORD fulfill what you have prophesied and bring back from Babylon to this place the vessels of the House of the LORD and all the exiles!
content_old: 6 The prophet Jeremiah said: “Amen! May the LORD do so! May the LORD fulfill what you have prophesied and bring back from Babylon to this place the vessels of the House of the LORD and all the exiles!

content: 7 But just listen to this word which I address to you and to all the people:
content_old: 7 But just listen to this word which I address to you and to all the people:

content: 8 The prophets who lived before you and me from ancient times prophesied war, disaster, and pestilence against many lands and great kingdoms.
content_old: 8 The prophets who lived before you and me from ancient times prophesied war, disaster, and pestilence against many lands and great kingdoms.

content: 9 So if a prophet prophesies good fortune, then only when the word of the prophet comes true can it be known that the LORD really sent him.”
content_old: 9 So if a prophet prophesies good fortune, then only when the word of the prophet comes true can it be known that the LORD really sent him.”

content: 10 But the prophet Hananiah removed the bar from the neck of the prophet Jeremiah, and broke it;
content_old: 10 But the prophet Hananiah removed the bar from the neck of the prophet Jeremiah, and broke it;

content: 11 and Hananiah said in the presence of all the people, “Thus said the LORD: So will I break the yoke of King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon from off the necks of all the nations, in two years.” And the prophet Jeremiah went on his way.
content_old: 11 and Hananiah said in the presence of all the people, “Thus said the LORD: So will I break the yoke of King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon from off the necks of all the nations, in two years.” And the prophet Jeremiah went on his way.

content: 12 After the prophet Hananiah had broken the bar from off the neck of the prophet Jeremiah, the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah:
content_old: 12 After the prophet Hananiah had broken the bar from off the neck of the prophet Jeremiah, the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah:

content: 13 “Go say to Hananiah: Thus said the LORD: You broke bars of wood, but you shall make bars of iron instead.
content_old: 13 “Go say to Hananiah: Thus said the LORD: You broke bars of wood, but you shall make bars of iron instead.

content: 14 For thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: I have put an iron yoke upon the necks of all those nations, that they may serve King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon—and serve him they shall! I have even given the wild beasts to him.”
content_old: 14 For thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: I have put an iron yoke upon the necks of all those nations, that they may serve King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon—and serve him they shall! I have even given the wild beasts to him.”

content: 15 And the prophet Jeremiah said to the prophet Hananiah, “Listen, Hananiah! The LORD did not send you, and you have given this people lying assurances.
content_old: 15 And the prophet Jeremiah said to the prophet Hananiah, “Listen, Hananiah! The LORD did not send you, and you have given this people lying assurances.

content: 16 Assuredly, thus said the LORD: I am going to banish you from off the earth. This year you shall die, for you have urged disloyalty to the LORD.”
content_old: 16 Assuredly, thus said the LORD: I am going to banish you from off the earth. This year you shall die, for you have urged disloyalty to the LORD.”

content: 1 This is the text of the letter which the prophet Jeremiah sent from Jerusalem to the priests, the prophets, the rest of the elders of the exile community, and to all the people whom Nebuchadnezzar had exiled from Jerusalem to Babylon—
content_old: 1 This is the text of the letter which the prophet Jeremiah sent from Jerusalem to the priests, the prophets, the rest of the elders of the exile community, and to all the people whom Nebuchadnezzar had exiled from Jerusalem to Babylon—

content: 2 after King Jeconiah, the queen mother, the eunuchs, the officials of Judah and Jerusalem, and the craftsmen and smiths had left Jerusalem.
content_old: 2 after King Jeconiah, the queen mother, the eunuchs, the officials of Judah and Jerusalem, and the craftsmen and smiths had left Jerusalem.

content: 3 The letter was sent through Elasah son of Shaphan and Gemariah son of Hilkiah, whom King Zedekiah of Judah had dispatched to Babylon, to King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon.
content_old: 3 The letter was sent through Elasah son of Shaphan and Gemariah son of Hilkiah, whom King Zedekiah of Judah had dispatched to Babylon, to King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon.

content: 4 Thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, to the whole community which I exiled from Jerusalem to Babylon:
content_old: 4 Thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, to the whole community which I exiled from Jerusalem to Babylon:

content: 5 Build houses and live in them, plant gardens and eat their fruit.
content_old: 5 Build houses and live in them, plant gardens and eat their fruit.

content: 6 Take wives and beget sons and daughters; and take wives for your sons, and give your daughters to husbands, that they may bear sons and daughters. Multiply there, do not decrease.
content_old: 6 Take wives and beget sons and daughters; and take wives for your sons, and give your daughters to husbands, that they may bear sons and daughters. Multiply there, do not decrease.

content: 7 And seek the welfare of the city to which I have exiled you and pray to the LORD in its behalf; for in its prosperity you shall prosper.
content_old: 7 And seek the welfare of the city to which I have exiled you and pray to the LORD in its behalf; for in its prosperity you shall prosper.

content: 8 For thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: Let not the prophets and diviners in your midst deceive you, and pay no heed to the dreams they dream.
content_old: 8 For thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: Let not the prophets and diviners in your midst deceive you, and pay no heed to the dreams they dream.

content: 9 For they prophesy to you in My name falsely; I did not send them—declares the LORD.
content_old: 9 For they prophesy to you in My name falsely; I did not send them—declares the LORD.

content: 10 For thus said the LORD: When Babylon’s seventy years are over, I will take note of you, and I will fulfill to you My promise of favor—to bring you back to this place.
content_old: 10 For thus said the LORD: When Babylon’s seventy years are over, I will take note of you, and I will fulfill to you My promise of favor—to bring you back to this place.

content: 11 For I am mindful of the plans I have made concerning you—declares the LORD—plans for your welfare, not for disaster, to give you a hopeful future.
content_old: 11 For I am mindful of the plans I have made concerning you—declares the LORD—plans for your welfare, not for disaster, to give you a hopeful future.

content: 12 When you call Me, and come and pray to Me, I will give heed to you.
content_old: 12 When you call Me, and come and pray to Me, I will give heed to you.

content: 13 You will search for Me and find Me, if only you seek Me wholeheartedly.
content_old: 13 You will search for Me and find Me, if only you seek Me wholeheartedly.

content: 14 I will be at hand for you—declares the LORD—and I will restore your fortunes. And I will gather you from all the nations and from all the places to which I have banished you—declares the LORD—and I will bring you back to the place from which I have exiled you.
content_old: 14 I will be at hand for you—declares the LORD—and I will restore your fortunes. And I will gather you from all the nations and from all the places to which I have banished you—declares the LORD—and I will bring you back to the place from which I have exiled you.

content: 15 But you say, “The LORD has raised up prophets for us in Babylon.”
content_old: 15 But you say, “The LORD has raised up prophets for us in Babylon.”

content: 16 Thus said the LORD concerning the king who sits on the throne of David, and concerning all the people who dwell in this city, your brothers who did not go out with you into exile—
content_old: 16 Thus said the LORD concerning the king who sits on the throne of David, and concerning all the people who dwell in this city, your brothers who did not go out with you into exile—

content: 17 thus said the LORD of Hosts: I am going to let loose sword, famine, and pestilence against them and I will treat them as loathsome figs, so bad that they cannot be eaten.
content_old: 17 thus said the LORD of Hosts: I am going to let loose sword, famine, and pestilence against them and I will treat them as loathsome figs, so bad that they cannot be eaten.

content: 18 I will pursue them with the sword, with famine, and with pestilence; and I will make them a horror to all the kingdoms of the earth, a curse and an object of horror and hissing and scorn among all the nations to which I shall banish them,
content_old: 18 I will pursue them with the sword, with famine, and with pestilence; and I will make them a horror to all the kingdoms of the earth, a curse and an object of horror and hissing and scorn among all the nations to which I shall banish them,

content: 19 because they did not heed My words—declares the LORD—when I persistently sent to them My servants, the prophets, and they did not heed—declares the LORD.
content_old: 19 because they did not heed My words—declares the LORD—when I persistently sent to them My servants, the prophets, and they did not heed—declares the LORD.

content: 20 But you, the whole exile community which I banished from Jerusalem to Babylon, hear the word of the LORD!
content_old: 20 But you, the whole exile community which I banished from Jerusalem to Babylon, hear the word of the LORD!

content: 21 Thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, concerning Ahab son of Kolaiah and Zedekiah son of Maaseiah, who prophesy falsely to you in My name: I am going to deliver them into the hands of King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon, and he shall put them to death before your eyes.
content_old: 21 Thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, concerning Ahab son of Kolaiah and Zedekiah son of Maaseiah, who prophesy falsely to you in My name: I am going to deliver them into the hands of King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon, and he shall put them to death before your eyes.

content: 22 And the whole community of Judah in Babylonia shall use a curse derived from their fate: “May God make you like Zedekiah and Ahab, whom the king of Babylon consigned to the flames!”—
content_old: 22 And the whole community of Judah in Babylonia shall use a curse derived from their fate: “May God make you like Zedekiah and Ahab, whom the king of Babylon consigned to the flames!”—

content: 23 because they did vile things in Israel, committing adultery with the wives of their fellows and speaking in My name false words which I had not commanded them. I am He who knows and bears witness—declares the LORD.
content_old: 23 because they did vile things in Israel, committing adultery with the wives of their fellows and speaking in My name false words which I had not commanded them. I am He who knows and bears witness—declares the LORD.

content: 24 Concerning Shemaiah the Nehelamite you shall say:
content_old: 24 Concerning Shemaiah the Nehelamite you shall say:

content: 25 Thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: Because you sent letters in your own name to all the people in Jerusalem, to Zephaniah son of Maaseiah and to the rest of the priests, as follows,
content_old: 25 Thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: Because you sent letters in your own name to all the people in Jerusalem, to Zephaniah son of Maaseiah and to the rest of the priests, as follows,

content: 26 “The LORD appointed you priest in place of the priest Jehoiada, to exercise authority in the House of the LORD over every madman who wants to play the prophet, to put him into the stocks and into the pillory.
content_old: 26 “The LORD appointed you priest in place of the priest Jehoiada, to exercise authority in the House of the LORD over every madman who wants to play the prophet, to put him into the stocks and into the pillory.

content: 27 Now why have you not rebuked Jeremiah the Anathothite, who plays the prophet among you?
content_old: 27 Now why have you not rebuked Jeremiah the Anathothite, who plays the prophet among you?

content: 28 For he has actually sent a message to us in Babylon to this effect: It will be a long time. Build houses and live in them, plant gardens and enjoy their fruit.”—
content_old: 28 For he has actually sent a message to us in Babylon to this effect: It will be a long time. Build houses and live in them, plant gardens and enjoy their fruit.”—

content: 29 When the priest Zephaniah read this letter in the hearing of the prophet Jeremiah,
content_old: 29 When the priest Zephaniah read this letter in the hearing of the prophet Jeremiah,

content: 30 the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah:
content_old: 30 the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah:

content: 31 Send a message to the entire exile community: “Thus said the LORD concerning Shemaiah the Nehelamite: Because Shemaiah prophesied to you, though I did not send him, and made you false promises,
content_old: 31 Send a message to the entire exile community: “Thus said the LORD concerning Shemaiah the Nehelamite: Because Shemaiah prophesied to you, though I did not send him, and made you false promises,

content: 1 The word which came to Jeremiah from the LORD:
content_old: 1 The word which came to Jeremiah from the LORD:

content: 2 Thus said the LORD, the God of Israel: Write down in a scroll all the words that I have spoken to you.
content_old: 2 Thus said the LORD, the God of Israel: Write down in a scroll all the words that I have spoken to you.

content: 3 For days are coming—declares the LORD—when I will restore the fortunes of My people Israel and Judah, said the LORD; and I will bring them back to the land that I gave their fathers, and they shall possess it.
content_old: 3 For days are coming—declares the LORD—when I will restore the fortunes of My people Israel and Judah, said the LORD; and I will bring them back to the land that I gave their fathers, and they shall possess it.

content: 4 And these are the words that the LORD spoke concerning Israel and Judah:
content_old: 4 And these are the words that the LORD spoke concerning Israel and Judah:

content: 5 Thus said the LORD: We have heard cries of panic, Terror without relief.
content_old: 5 Thus said the LORD: We have heard cries of panic, Terror without relief.

content: 6 Ask and see: Surely males do not bear young! Why then do I see every man With his hands on his loins Like a woman in labor? Why have all faces turned pale?
content_old: 6 Ask and see: Surely males do not bear young! Why then do I see every man With his hands on his loins Like a woman in labor? Why have all faces turned pale?

content: 7 Ah, that day is awesome; There is none like it! It is a time of trouble for Jacob, But he shall be delivered from it.
content_old: 7 Ah, that day is awesome; There is none like it! It is a time of trouble for Jacob, But he shall be delivered from it.

content: 8 In that day—declares the LORD of Hosts—I will break the yoke from off your neck and I will rip off your bonds. Strangers shall no longer make slaves of them;
content_old: 8 In that day—declares the LORD of Hosts—I will break the yoke from off your neck and I will rip off your bonds. Strangers shall no longer make slaves of them;

content: 9 instead, they shall serve the LORD their God and David, the king whom I will raise up for them.
content_old: 9 instead, they shall serve the LORD their God and David, the king whom I will raise up for them.

content: 10 But you, Have no fear, My servant Jacob —declares the LORD— Be not dismayed, O Israel! I will deliver you from far away, Your folk from their land of captivity. And Jacob shall again have calm And quiet with none to trouble him;
content_old: 10 But you, Have no fear, My servant Jacob —declares the LORD— Be not dismayed, O Israel! I will deliver you from far away, Your folk from their land of captivity. And Jacob shall again have calm And quiet with none to trouble him;

content: 11 For I am with you to deliver you —declares the LORD. I will make an end of all the nations Among which I have dispersed you; But I will not make an end of you! I will not leave you unpunished, But will chastise you in measure.
content_old: 11 For I am with you to deliver you —declares the LORD. I will make an end of all the nations Among which I have dispersed you; But I will not make an end of you! I will not leave you unpunished, But will chastise you in measure.

content: 12 For thus said the LORD: Your injury is incurable, Your wound severe;
content_old: 12 For thus said the LORD: Your injury is incurable, Your wound severe;

content: 13 No one pleads for the healing of your sickness, There is no remedy, no recovery for you.
content_old: 13 No one pleads for the healing of your sickness, There is no remedy, no recovery for you.

content: 14 All your lovers have forgotten you, They do not seek you out; For I have struck you as an enemy strikes, With cruel chastisement, Because your iniquity was so great And your sins so many.
content_old: 14 All your lovers have forgotten you, They do not seek you out; For I have struck you as an enemy strikes, With cruel chastisement, Because your iniquity was so great And your sins so many.

content: 15 Why cry out over your injury, That your wound is incurable? I did these things to you Because your iniquity was so great And your sins so many.
content_old: 15 Why cry out over your injury, That your wound is incurable? I did these things to you Because your iniquity was so great And your sins so many.

content: 16 Assuredly, All who wanted to devour you shall be devoured, And every one of your foes shall go into captivity; Those who despoiled you shall be despoiled, And all who pillaged you I will give up to pillage.
content_old: 16 Assuredly, All who wanted to devour you shall be devoured, And every one of your foes shall go into captivity; Those who despoiled you shall be despoiled, And all who pillaged you I will give up to pillage.

content: 17 But I will bring healing to you And cure you of your wounds —declares the LORD. Though they called you “Outcast, That Zion whom no one seeks out,”
content_old: 17 But I will bring healing to you And cure you of your wounds —declares the LORD. Though they called you “Outcast, That Zion whom no one seeks out,”

content: 18 Thus said the LORD: I will restore the fortunes of Jacob’s tents And have compassion upon his dwellings. The city shall be rebuilt on its mound, And the fortress in its proper place.
content_old: 18 Thus said the LORD: I will restore the fortunes of Jacob’s tents And have compassion upon his dwellings. The city shall be rebuilt on its mound, And the fortress in its proper place.

content: 19 From them shall issue thanksgiving And the sound of dancers. I will multiply them, And they shall not be few; I will make them honored, And they shall not be humbled.
content_old: 19 From them shall issue thanksgiving And the sound of dancers. I will multiply them, And they shall not be few; I will make them honored, And they shall not be humbled.

content: 20 His children shall be as of old, And his community shall be established by My grace; And I will deal with all his oppressors.
content_old: 20 His children shall be as of old, And his community shall be established by My grace; And I will deal with all his oppressors.

content: 21 His chieftain shall be one of his own, His ruler shall come from his midst; I will bring him near, that he may approach Me —declares the LORD— For who would otherwise dare approach Me?
content_old: 21 His chieftain shall be one of his own, His ruler shall come from his midst; I will bring him near, that he may approach Me —declares the LORD— For who would otherwise dare approach Me?

content: 22 You shall be My people, And I will be your God.
content_old: 22 You shall be My people, And I will be your God.

content: 23 Lo, the storm of the LORD goes forth in fury, A raging tempest; It shall whirl down upon the head of the wicked.
content_old: 23 Lo, the storm of the LORD goes forth in fury, A raging tempest; It shall whirl down upon the head of the wicked.

content: 1 At that time—declares the LORD—I will be God to all the clans of Israel, and they shall be My people.
content_old: 1 At that time—declares the LORD—I will be God to all the clans of Israel, and they shall be My people.

content: 2 Thus said the LORD: The people escaped from the sword, Found favor in the wilderness; When Israel was marching homeward
content_old: 2 Thus said the LORD: The people escaped from the sword, Found favor in the wilderness; When Israel was marching homeward

content: 3 The LORD revealed Himself to me of old. Eternal love I conceived for you then; Therefore I continue My grace to you.
content_old: 3 The LORD revealed Himself to me of old. Eternal love I conceived for you then; Therefore I continue My grace to you.

content: 4 I will build you firmly again, O Maiden Israel! Again you shall take up your timbrels And go forth to the rhythm of the dancers.
content_old: 4 I will build you firmly again, O Maiden Israel! Again you shall take up your timbrels And go forth to the rhythm of the dancers.

content: 5 Again you shall plant vineyards On the hills of Samaria; Men shall plant and live to enjoy them.
content_old: 5 Again you shall plant vineyards On the hills of Samaria; Men shall plant and live to enjoy them.

content: 6 For the day is coming when watchmen Shall proclaim on the heights of Ephraim: Come, let us go up to Zion, To the LORD our God!
content_old: 6 For the day is coming when watchmen Shall proclaim on the heights of Ephraim: Come, let us go up to Zion, To the LORD our God!

content: 7 For thus said the LORD: Cry out in joy for Jacob, Shout at the crossroads of the nations! Sing aloud in praise, and say: Save, O LORD, Your people, The remnant of Israel.
content_old: 7 For thus said the LORD: Cry out in joy for Jacob, Shout at the crossroads of the nations! Sing aloud in praise, and say: Save, O LORD, Your people, The remnant of Israel.

content: 8 I will bring them in from the northland, Gather them from the ends of the earth— The blind and the lame among them, Those with child and those in labor— In a vast throng they shall return here.
content_old: 8 I will bring them in from the northland, Gather them from the ends of the earth— The blind and the lame among them, Those with child and those in labor— In a vast throng they shall return here.

content: 9 They shall come with weeping, And with compassion will I guide them. I will lead them to streams of water, By a level road where they will not stumble. For I am ever a Father to Israel, Ephraim is My first-born.
content_old: 9 They shall come with weeping, And with compassion will I guide them. I will lead them to streams of water, By a level road where they will not stumble. For I am ever a Father to Israel, Ephraim is My first-born.

content: 10 Hear the word of the LORD, O nations, And tell it in the isles afar. Say: He who scattered Israel will gather them, And will guard them as a shepherd his flock.
content_old: 10 Hear the word of the LORD, O nations, And tell it in the isles afar. Say: He who scattered Israel will gather them, And will guard them as a shepherd his flock.

content: 11 For the LORD will ransom Jacob, Redeem him from one too strong for him.
content_old: 11 For the LORD will ransom Jacob, Redeem him from one too strong for him.

content: 12 They shall come and shout on the heights of Zion, Radiant over the bounty of the LORD— Over new grain and wine and oil, And over sheep and cattle. They shall fare like a watered garden, They shall never languish again.
content_old: 12 They shall come and shout on the heights of Zion, Radiant over the bounty of the LORD— Over new grain and wine and oil, And over sheep and cattle. They shall fare like a watered garden, They shall never languish again.

content: 13 Then shall maidens dance gaily, Young men and old alike. I will turn their mourning to joy, I will comfort them and cheer them in their grief.
content_old: 13 Then shall maidens dance gaily, Young men and old alike. I will turn their mourning to joy, I will comfort them and cheer them in their grief.

content: 14 I will give the priests their fill of fatness, And My people shall enjoy My full bounty —declares the LORD.
content_old: 14 I will give the priests their fill of fatness, And My people shall enjoy My full bounty —declares the LORD.

content: 15 Thus said the LORD: A cry is heard in Ramah— Wailing, bitter weeping— Rachel weeping for her children. She refuses to be comforted For her children, who are gone.
content_old: 15 Thus said the LORD: A cry is heard in Ramah— Wailing, bitter weeping— Rachel weeping for her children. She refuses to be comforted For her children, who are gone.

content: 16 Thus said the LORD: Restrain your voice from weeping, Your eyes from shedding tears; For there is a reward for your labor —declares the LORD: They shall return from the enemy’s land.
content_old: 16 Thus said the LORD: Restrain your voice from weeping, Your eyes from shedding tears; For there is a reward for your labor —declares the LORD: They shall return from the enemy’s land.

content: 17 And there is hope for your future —declares the LORD: Your children shall return to their country.
content_old: 17 And there is hope for your future —declares the LORD: Your children shall return to their country.

content: 18 I can hear Ephraim lamenting: You have chastised me, and I am chastised Like a calf that has not been broken. Receive me back, let me return, For You, O LORD, are my God.
content_old: 18 I can hear Ephraim lamenting: You have chastised me, and I am chastised Like a calf that has not been broken. Receive me back, let me return, For You, O LORD, are my God.

content: 19 Now that I have turned back, I am filled with remorse; Now that I am made aware, I strike my thigh. I am ashamed and humiliated, For I bear the disgrace of my youth.
content_old: 19 Now that I have turned back, I am filled with remorse; Now that I am made aware, I strike my thigh. I am ashamed and humiliated, For I bear the disgrace of my youth.

content: 20 Truly, Ephraim is a dear son to Me, A child that is dandled! Whenever I have turned against him, My thoughts would dwell on him still. That is why My heart yearns for him; I will receive him back in love —declares the LORD.
content_old: 20 Truly, Ephraim is a dear son to Me, A child that is dandled! Whenever I have turned against him, My thoughts would dwell on him still. That is why My heart yearns for him; I will receive him back in love —declares the LORD.

content: 21 Erect markers, Set up signposts; Keep in mind the highway, The road that you traveled. Return, Maiden Israel! Return to these towns of yours!
content_old: 21 Erect markers, Set up signposts; Keep in mind the highway, The road that you traveled. Return, Maiden Israel! Return to these towns of yours!

content: 22 How long will you waver, O rebellious daughter? For the LORD has created something new on earth: A woman courts a man.
content_old: 22 How long will you waver, O rebellious daughter? For the LORD has created something new on earth: A woman courts a man.

content: 23 Thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: They shall again say this in the land of Judah and in its towns, when I restore their fortunes: “The LORD bless you, Abode of righteousness, O holy mountain!”
content_old: 23 Thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: They shall again say this in the land of Judah and in its towns, when I restore their fortunes: “The LORD bless you, Abode of righteousness, O holy mountain!”

content: 24 Judah and all its towns alike shall be inhabited by the farmers and such as move about with the flocks.
content_old: 24 Judah and all its towns alike shall be inhabited by the farmers and such as move about with the flocks.

content: 25 For I will give the thirsty abundant drink, and satisfy all who languish.
content_old: 25 For I will give the thirsty abundant drink, and satisfy all who languish.

content: 26 At this I awoke and looked about, and my sleep had been pleasant to me.
content_old: 26 At this I awoke and looked about, and my sleep had been pleasant to me.

content: 27 See, a time is coming—declares the LORD—when I will sow the House of Israel and the House of Judah with seed of men and seed of cattle;
content_old: 27 See, a time is coming—declares the LORD—when I will sow the House of Israel and the House of Judah with seed of men and seed of cattle;

content: 28 and just as I was watchful over them to uproot and to pull down, to overthrow and to destroy and to bring disaster, so I will be watchful over them to build and to plant—declares the LORD.
content_old: 28 and just as I was watchful over them to uproot and to pull down, to overthrow and to destroy and to bring disaster, so I will be watchful over them to build and to plant—declares the LORD.

content: 29 In those days, they shall no longer say, “Parents have eaten sour grapes and children’s teeth are blunted.”
content_old: 29 In those days, they shall no longer say, “Parents have eaten sour grapes and children’s teeth are blunted.”

content: 30 But every one shall die for his own sins: whosoever eats sour grapes, his teeth shall be blunted.
content_old: 30 But every one shall die for his own sins: whosoever eats sour grapes, his teeth shall be blunted.

content: 31 See, a time is coming—declares the LORD—when I will make a new covenant with the House of Israel and the House of Judah.
content_old: 31 See, a time is coming—declares the LORD—when I will make a new covenant with the House of Israel and the House of Judah.

content: 32 It will not be like the covenant I made with their fathers, when I took them by the hand to lead them out of the land of Egypt, a covenant which they broke, though I espoused them—declares the LORD.
content_old: 32 It will not be like the covenant I made with their fathers, when I took them by the hand to lead them out of the land of Egypt, a covenant which they broke, though I espoused them—declares the LORD.

content: 33 But such is the covenant I will make with the House of Israel after these days—declares the LORD: I will put My Teaching into their inmost being and inscribe it upon their hearts. Then I will be their God, and they shall be My people.
content_old: 33 But such is the covenant I will make with the House of Israel after these days—declares the LORD: I will put My Teaching into their inmost being and inscribe it upon their hearts. Then I will be their God, and they shall be My people.

content: 34 No longer will they need to teach one another and say to one another, “Heed the LORD”; for all of them, from the least of them to the greatest, shall heed Me—declares the LORD. For I will forgive their iniquities, And remember their sins no more.
content_old: 34 No longer will they need to teach one another and say to one another, “Heed the LORD”; for all of them, from the least of them to the greatest, shall heed Me—declares the LORD. For I will forgive their iniquities, And remember their sins no more.

content: 35 Thus said the LORD, Who established the sun for light by day, The laws of moon and stars for light by night, Who stirs up the sea into roaring waves, Whose name is LORD of Hosts:
content_old: 35 Thus said the LORD, Who established the sun for light by day, The laws of moon and stars for light by night, Who stirs up the sea into roaring waves, Whose name is LORD of Hosts:

content: 36 If these laws should ever be annulled by Me —declares the LORD— Only then would the offspring of Israel cease To be a nation before Me for all time.
