content: 9 The cistern into which Ishmael threw all the corpses of the men he had killed in the affair of Gedaliah was the one that King Asa had constructed on account of King Baasha of Israel. That was the one which Ishmael son of Nethaniah filled with corpses.—
content_old: 9 The cistern into which Ishmael threw all the corpses of the men he had killed in the affair of Gedaliah was the one that King Asa had constructed on account of King Baasha of Israel. That was the one which Ishmael son of Nethaniah filled with corpses.—

content: 10 Ishmael carried off all the rest of the people who were in Mizpah, including the daughters of the king—all the people left in Mizpah, over whom Nebuzaradan, the chief of the guards, had appointed Gedaliah son of Ahikam. Ishmael son of Nethaniah carried them off, and set out to cross over to the Ammonites.
content_old: 10 Ishmael carried off all the rest of the people who were in Mizpah, including the daughters of the king—all the people left in Mizpah, over whom Nebuzaradan, the chief of the guards, had appointed Gedaliah son of Ahikam. Ishmael son of Nethaniah carried them off, and set out to cross over to the Ammonites.

content: 11 Johanan son of Kareah, and all the army officers with him, heard of all the crimes committed by Ishmael son of Nethaniah.
content_old: 11 Johanan son of Kareah, and all the army officers with him, heard of all the crimes committed by Ishmael son of Nethaniah.

content: 12 They took all their men and went to fight against Ishmael son of Nethaniah; and they encountered him by the great pool in Gibeon.
content_old: 12 They took all their men and went to fight against Ishmael son of Nethaniah; and they encountered him by the great pool in Gibeon.

content: 13 When all the people held by Ishmael saw Johanan son of Kareah and all the army officers with him, they were glad;
content_old: 13 When all the people held by Ishmael saw Johanan son of Kareah and all the army officers with him, they were glad;

content: 14 all the people whom Ishmael had carried off from Mizpah turned back and went over to Johanan son of Kareah.
content_old: 14 all the people whom Ishmael had carried off from Mizpah turned back and went over to Johanan son of Kareah.

content: 15 But Ishmael son of Nethaniah escaped from Johanan with eight men, and went to the Ammonites.
content_old: 15 But Ishmael son of Nethaniah escaped from Johanan with eight men, and went to the Ammonites.

content: 16 Johanan son of Kareah and all the army officers with him took all the rest of the people whom he had rescued from Ishmael son of Nethaniah from Mizpah after he had murdered Gedaliah son of Ahikam—the men, soldiers, women, children, and eunuchs whom Johanan had brought back from Gibeon.
content_old: 16 Johanan son of Kareah and all the army officers with him took all the rest of the people whom he had rescued from Ishmael son of Nethaniah from Mizpah after he had murdered Gedaliah son of Ahikam—the men, soldiers, women, children, and eunuchs whom Johanan had brought back from Gibeon.

content: 17 They set out, and they stopped at Geruth Chimham, near Bethlehem, on their way to go to Egypt
content_old: 17 They set out, and they stopped at Geruth Chimham, near Bethlehem, on their way to go to Egypt

content: 1 Then all the army officers, with Johanan son of Kareah, Jezaniah son of Hoshaiah, and all the rest of the people, great and small, approached
content_old: 1 Then all the army officers, with Johanan son of Kareah, Jezaniah son of Hoshaiah, and all the rest of the people, great and small, approached

content: 2 the prophet Jeremiah and said, “Grant our plea, and pray for us to the LORD your God, for all this remnant! For we remain but a few out of many, as you can see.
content_old: 2 the prophet Jeremiah and said, “Grant our plea, and pray for us to the LORD your God, for all this remnant! For we remain but a few out of many, as you can see.

content: 3 Let the LORD your God tell us where we should go and what we should do.”
content_old: 3 Let the LORD your God tell us where we should go and what we should do.”

content: 4 The prophet Jeremiah answered them, “Agreed: I will pray to the LORD your God as you request, and I will tell you whatever response the LORD gives for you. I will withhold nothing from you.”
content_old: 4 The prophet Jeremiah answered them, “Agreed: I will pray to the LORD your God as you request, and I will tell you whatever response the LORD gives for you. I will withhold nothing from you.”

content: 5 Thereupon they said to Jeremiah, “Let the LORD be a true and faithful witness against us! We swear that we will do exactly as the LORD your God instructs us through you—
content_old: 5 Thereupon they said to Jeremiah, “Let the LORD be a true and faithful witness against us! We swear that we will do exactly as the LORD your God instructs us through you—

content: 6 Whether it is pleasant or unpleasant, we will obey the LORD our God to whom we send you, in order that it may go well with us when we obey the LORD our God.”
content_old: 6 Whether it is pleasant or unpleasant, we will obey the LORD our God to whom we send you, in order that it may go well with us when we obey the LORD our God.”

content: 7 After ten days, the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah.
content_old: 7 After ten days, the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah.

content: 8 He called Johanan son of Kareah and all the army officers, and the rest of the people, great and small,
content_old: 8 He called Johanan son of Kareah and all the army officers, and the rest of the people, great and small,

content: 9 and said to them, “Thus said the LORD, the God of Israel, to whom you sent me to present your supplication before Him:
content_old: 9 and said to them, “Thus said the LORD, the God of Israel, to whom you sent me to present your supplication before Him:

content: 10 If you remain in this land, I will build you and not overthrow, I will plant you and not uproot; for I regret the punishment I have brought upon you.
content_old: 10 If you remain in this land, I will build you and not overthrow, I will plant you and not uproot; for I regret the punishment I have brought upon you.

content: 11 Do not be afraid of the king of Babylon, whom you fear; do not be afraid of him—declares the LORD—for I am with you to save you and to rescue you from his hands.
content_old: 11 Do not be afraid of the king of Babylon, whom you fear; do not be afraid of him—declares the LORD—for I am with you to save you and to rescue you from his hands.

content: 12 I will dispose him to be merciful to you: he shall show you mercy and bring you back to your own land.
content_old: 12 I will dispose him to be merciful to you: he shall show you mercy and bring you back to your own land.

content: 13 “But if you say, ‘We will not stay in this land’—thus disobeying the LORD your God—
content_old: 13 “But if you say, ‘We will not stay in this land’—thus disobeying the LORD your God—

content: 14 if you say, ‘No! We will go to the land of Egypt, so that we may not see war or hear the sound of the horn, and so that we may not hunger for bread; there we will stay,’
content_old: 14 if you say, ‘No! We will go to the land of Egypt, so that we may not see war or hear the sound of the horn, and so that we may not hunger for bread; there we will stay,’

content: 15 then hear the word of the LORD, O remnant of Judah! Thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: If you turn your faces toward Egypt, and you go and sojourn there,
content_old: 15 then hear the word of the LORD, O remnant of Judah! Thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: If you turn your faces toward Egypt, and you go and sojourn there,

content: 16 the sword that you fear shall overtake you there, in the land of Egypt, and the famine you worry over shall follow at your heels in Egypt too; and there you shall die.
content_old: 16 the sword that you fear shall overtake you there, in the land of Egypt, and the famine you worry over shall follow at your heels in Egypt too; and there you shall die.

content: 17 All the men who turn their faces toward Egypt, in order to sojourn there, shall die by the sword, by famine, and by pestilence. They shall have no surviving remnant of the disaster that I will bring upon them.
content_old: 17 All the men who turn their faces toward Egypt, in order to sojourn there, shall die by the sword, by famine, and by pestilence. They shall have no surviving remnant of the disaster that I will bring upon them.

content: 18 For thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: As My anger and wrath were poured out upon the inhabitants of Jerusalem, so will My wrath be poured out on you if you go to Egypt. You shall become an execration of woe, a curse and a mockery; and you shall never again see this place.
content_old: 18 For thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: As My anger and wrath were poured out upon the inhabitants of Jerusalem, so will My wrath be poured out on you if you go to Egypt. You shall become an execration of woe, a curse and a mockery; and you shall never again see this place.

content: 19 The LORD has spoken against you, O remnant of Judah! Do not go to Egypt! Know well, then—for I warn you this day
content_old: 19 The LORD has spoken against you, O remnant of Judah! Do not go to Egypt! Know well, then—for I warn you this day

content: 20 that you were deceitful at heart when you sent me to the LORD your God, saying, ‘Pray for us to the LORD our God; and whatever the LORD our God may say, just tell us and we will do it.’
content_old: 20 that you were deceitful at heart when you sent me to the LORD your God, saying, ‘Pray for us to the LORD our God; and whatever the LORD our God may say, just tell us and we will do it.’

content: 21 I told you today, and you have not obeyed the LORD your God in respect to all that He sent me to tell you—
content_old: 21 I told you today, and you have not obeyed the LORD your God in respect to all that He sent me to tell you—

content: 1 When Jeremiah had finished speaking all these words to all the people—all the words of the LORD their God, with which the LORD their God had sent him to them—
content_old: 1 When Jeremiah had finished speaking all these words to all the people—all the words of the LORD their God, with which the LORD their God had sent him to them—

content: 2 Azariah son of Hoshaiah and Johanan son of Kareah and all the arrogant men said to Jeremiah, “You are lying! The LORD our God did not send you to say, ‘Don’t go to Egypt and sojourn there’!
content_old: 2 Azariah son of Hoshaiah and Johanan son of Kareah and all the arrogant men said to Jeremiah, “You are lying! The LORD our God did not send you to say, ‘Don’t go to Egypt and sojourn there’!

content: 3 It is Baruch son of Neriah who is inciting you against us, so that we will be delivered into the hands of the Chaldeans to be killed or to be exiled to Babylon!”
content_old: 3 It is Baruch son of Neriah who is inciting you against us, so that we will be delivered into the hands of the Chaldeans to be killed or to be exiled to Babylon!”

content: 4 So Johanan son of Kareah and all the army officers and the rest of the people did not obey the LORD’s command to remain in the land of Judah.
content_old: 4 So Johanan son of Kareah and all the army officers and the rest of the people did not obey the LORD’s command to remain in the land of Judah.

content: 5 Instead, Johanan son of Kareah and all the army officers took the entire remnant of Judah—those who had returned from all the countries to which they had been scattered and had sojourned in the land of Judah,
content_old: 5 Instead, Johanan son of Kareah and all the army officers took the entire remnant of Judah—those who had returned from all the countries to which they had been scattered and had sojourned in the land of Judah,

content: 6 men, women, and children; and the daughters of the king and all the people whom Nebuzaradan the chief of the guards had left with Gedaliah son of Ahikam son of Shaphan, as well as the prophet Jeremiah and Baruch son of Neriah—
content_old: 6 men, women, and children; and the daughters of the king and all the people whom Nebuzaradan the chief of the guards had left with Gedaliah son of Ahikam son of Shaphan, as well as the prophet Jeremiah and Baruch son of Neriah—

content: 7 and they went to Egypt. They did not obey the LORD. They arrived at Tahpanhes,
content_old: 7 and they went to Egypt. They did not obey the LORD. They arrived at Tahpanhes,

content: 8 and the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah in Tahpanhes:
content_old: 8 and the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah in Tahpanhes:

content: 9 Get yourself large stones, and embed them in mortar in the brick structure at the entrance to Pharaoh’s palace in Tahpanhes, with some Judeans looking on.
content_old: 9 Get yourself large stones, and embed them in mortar in the brick structure at the entrance to Pharaoh’s palace in Tahpanhes, with some Judeans looking on.

content: 10 And say to them: “Thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: I am sending for My servant King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon, and I will set his throne over these stones which I have embedded. He will spread out his pavilion over them.
content_old: 10 And say to them: “Thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: I am sending for My servant King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon, and I will set his throne over these stones which I have embedded. He will spread out his pavilion over them.

content: 11 He will come and attack the land of Egypt, delivering Those destined for the plague, to the plague, Those destined for captivity, to captivity, And those destined for the sword, to the sword.
content_old: 11 He will come and attack the land of Egypt, delivering Those destined for the plague, to the plague, Those destined for captivity, to captivity, And those destined for the sword, to the sword.

content: 12 And I will set fire to the temples of the gods of Egypt; he will burn them down and carry them off. He shall wrap himself up in the land of Egypt, as a shepherd wraps himself up in his garment. And he shall depart from there in safety.
content_old: 12 And I will set fire to the temples of the gods of Egypt; he will burn them down and carry them off. He shall wrap himself up in the land of Egypt, as a shepherd wraps himself up in his garment. And he shall depart from there in safety.

content: 1 The word which came to Jeremiah for all the Judeans living in the land of Egypt, living in Migdol, Tahpanhes, and Noph, and in the land of Pathros:
content_old: 1 The word which came to Jeremiah for all the Judeans living in the land of Egypt, living in Migdol, Tahpanhes, and Noph, and in the land of Pathros:

content: 2 Thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: You have seen all the disaster that I brought on Jerusalem and on all the towns of Judah. They are a ruin today, and no one inhabits them,
content_old: 2 Thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: You have seen all the disaster that I brought on Jerusalem and on all the towns of Judah. They are a ruin today, and no one inhabits them,

content: 3 on account of the wicked things they did to vex Me, going to make offerings in worship of other gods which they had not known—neither they nor you nor your fathers.
content_old: 3 on account of the wicked things they did to vex Me, going to make offerings in worship of other gods which they had not known—neither they nor you nor your fathers.

content: 4 Yet I persistently sent to you all My servants the prophets, to say, “I beg you not to do this abominable thing which I hate.”
content_old: 4 Yet I persistently sent to you all My servants the prophets, to say, “I beg you not to do this abominable thing which I hate.”

content: 5 But they would not listen or give ear, to turn back from their wickedness and not make offerings to other gods;
content_old: 5 But they would not listen or give ear, to turn back from their wickedness and not make offerings to other gods;

content: 6 so My fierce anger was poured out, and it blazed against the towns of Judah and the streets of Jerusalem. And they became a desolate ruin, as they still are today.
content_old: 6 so My fierce anger was poured out, and it blazed against the towns of Judah and the streets of Jerusalem. And they became a desolate ruin, as they still are today.

content: 7 And now, thus said the LORD, the God of Hosts, the God of Israel: Why are you doing such great harm to yourselves, so that every man and woman, child and infant of yours shall be cut off from the midst of Judah, and no remnant shall be left of you?
content_old: 7 And now, thus said the LORD, the God of Hosts, the God of Israel: Why are you doing such great harm to yourselves, so that every man and woman, child and infant of yours shall be cut off from the midst of Judah, and no remnant shall be left of you?

content: 8 For you vex me by your deeds, making offering to other gods in the land of Egypt where you have come to sojourn, so that you shall be cut off and become a curse and a mockery among all the nations of earth.
content_old: 8 For you vex me by your deeds, making offering to other gods in the land of Egypt where you have come to sojourn, so that you shall be cut off and become a curse and a mockery among all the nations of earth.

content: 9 Have you forgotten the wicked acts of your forefathers, of the kings of Judah and their wives, and your own wicked acts and those of your wives, which were committed in the land of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?
content_old: 9 Have you forgotten the wicked acts of your forefathers, of the kings of Judah and their wives, and your own wicked acts and those of your wives, which were committed in the land of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?

content: 10 No one has shown contrition to this day, and no one has shown reverence. You have not followed the Teaching and the laws that I set before you and before your fathers.
content_old: 10 No one has shown contrition to this day, and no one has shown reverence. You have not followed the Teaching and the laws that I set before you and before your fathers.

content: 11 Assuredly, thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: I am going to set My face against you for punishment, to cut off all of Judah.
content_old: 11 Assuredly, thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: I am going to set My face against you for punishment, to cut off all of Judah.

content: 12 I will take the remnant of Judah who turned their faces toward the land of Egypt, to go and sojourn there, and they shall be utterly consumed in the land of Egypt. They shall fall by the sword, they shall be consumed by famine; great and small alike shall die by the sword and by famine, and they shall become an execration and a desolation, a curse and a mockery.
content_old: 12 I will take the remnant of Judah who turned their faces toward the land of Egypt, to go and sojourn there, and they shall be utterly consumed in the land of Egypt. They shall fall by the sword, they shall be consumed by famine; great and small alike shall die by the sword and by famine, and they shall become an execration and a desolation, a curse and a mockery.

content: 13 I will punish those who live in the land of Egypt as I punished Jerusalem, with the sword, with famine, and with pestilence.
content_old: 13 I will punish those who live in the land of Egypt as I punished Jerusalem, with the sword, with famine, and with pestilence.

content: 14 Of the remnant of Judah who came to sojourn here in the land of Egypt, no survivor or fugitive shall be left to return to the land of Judah. Though they all long to return and dwell there, none shall return except a few survivors.
content_old: 14 Of the remnant of Judah who came to sojourn here in the land of Egypt, no survivor or fugitive shall be left to return to the land of Judah. Though they all long to return and dwell there, none shall return except a few survivors.

content: 15 Thereupon they answered Jeremiah—all the men who knew that their wives made offerings to other gods; all the women present, a large gathering; and all the people who lived in Pathros in the land of Egypt:
content_old: 15 Thereupon they answered Jeremiah—all the men who knew that their wives made offerings to other gods; all the women present, a large gathering; and all the people who lived in Pathros in the land of Egypt:

content: 16 “We will not listen to you in the matter about which you spoke to us in the name of the LORD.
content_old: 16 “We will not listen to you in the matter about which you spoke to us in the name of the LORD.

content: 17 On the contrary, we will do everything that we have vowed—to make offerings to the Queen of Heaven and to pour libations to her, as we used to do, we and our fathers, our kings and our officials, in the towns of Judah and the streets of Jerusalem. For then we had plenty to eat, we were well-off, and suffered no misfortune.
content_old: 17 On the contrary, we will do everything that we have vowed—to make offerings to the Queen of Heaven and to pour libations to her, as we used to do, we and our fathers, our kings and our officials, in the towns of Judah and the streets of Jerusalem. For then we had plenty to eat, we were well-off, and suffered no misfortune.

content: 18 But ever since we stopped making offerings to the Queen of Heaven and pouring libations to her, we have lacked everything, and we have been consumed by the sword and by famine.
content_old: 18 But ever since we stopped making offerings to the Queen of Heaven and pouring libations to her, we have lacked everything, and we have been consumed by the sword and by famine.

content: 19 And when we make offerings to the Queen of Heaven and pour libations to her, is it without our husbands’ approval that we have made cakes in her likeness and poured libations to her?”
content_old: 19 And when we make offerings to the Queen of Heaven and pour libations to her, is it without our husbands’ approval that we have made cakes in her likeness and poured libations to her?”

content: 20 Jeremiah replied to all the people, men and women—all the people who argued with him. He said,
content_old: 20 Jeremiah replied to all the people, men and women—all the people who argued with him. He said,

content: 21 “Indeed, the offerings you presented in the towns of Judah and the streets of Jerusalem—you, your fathers, your kings, your officials, and the people of the land—were remembered by the LORD and brought to mind!
content_old: 21 “Indeed, the offerings you presented in the towns of Judah and the streets of Jerusalem—you, your fathers, your kings, your officials, and the people of the land—were remembered by the LORD and brought to mind!

content: 22 When the LORD could no longer bear your evil practices and the abominations you committed, your land became a desolate ruin and a curse, without inhabitant, as is still the case.
content_old: 22 When the LORD could no longer bear your evil practices and the abominations you committed, your land became a desolate ruin and a curse, without inhabitant, as is still the case.

content: 23 Because you burned incense and sinned against the LORD and did not obey the LORD, and because you did not follow His Teaching, His laws, and His exhortations, therefore this disaster has befallen you, as is still the case.”
content_old: 23 Because you burned incense and sinned against the LORD and did not obey the LORD, and because you did not follow His Teaching, His laws, and His exhortations, therefore this disaster has befallen you, as is still the case.”

content: 24 Jeremiah further said to all the people and to all the women: “Hear the word of the LORD, all Judeans in the land of Egypt!
content_old: 24 Jeremiah further said to all the people and to all the women: “Hear the word of the LORD, all Judeans in the land of Egypt!

content: 25 Thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: You and your wives have confirmed by deed what you spoke in words: ‘We will fulfill the vows which we made, to burn incense to the Queen of Heaven and to pour libations to her.’ So fulfill your vows; perform your vows!
content_old: 25 Thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: You and your wives have confirmed by deed what you spoke in words: ‘We will fulfill the vows which we made, to burn incense to the Queen of Heaven and to pour libations to her.’ So fulfill your vows; perform your vows!

content: 26 “Yet hear the word of the LORD, all Judeans who dwell in the land of Egypt! Lo, I swear by My great name—said the LORD—that none of the men of Judah in all the land of Egypt shall ever again invoke My name, saying, ‘As the Lord GOD lives!’
content_old: 26 “Yet hear the word of the LORD, all Judeans who dwell in the land of Egypt! Lo, I swear by My great name—said the LORD—that none of the men of Judah in all the land of Egypt shall ever again invoke My name, saying, ‘As the Lord GOD lives!’

content: 27 I will be watchful over them to their hurt, not to their benefit; all the men of Judah in the land of Egypt shall be consumed by sword and by famine, until they cease to be.
content_old: 27 I will be watchful over them to their hurt, not to their benefit; all the men of Judah in the land of Egypt shall be consumed by sword and by famine, until they cease to be.

content: 28 Only the few who survive the sword shall return from the land of Egypt to the land of Judah. All the remnant of Judah who came to the land of Egypt to sojourn there shall learn whose word will be fulfilled—Mine or theirs!
content_old: 28 Only the few who survive the sword shall return from the land of Egypt to the land of Judah. All the remnant of Judah who came to the land of Egypt to sojourn there shall learn whose word will be fulfilled—Mine or theirs!

content: 29 “And this shall be the sign to you—declares the LORD—that I am going to deal with you in this place, so that you may know that My threats of punishment against you will be fulfilled:
content_old: 29 “And this shall be the sign to you—declares the LORD—that I am going to deal with you in this place, so that you may know that My threats of punishment against you will be fulfilled:

content: 1 The word which the prophet Jeremiah spoke to Baruch son of Neriah, when he was writing these words in a scroll at Jeremiah’s dictation, in the fourth year of King Jehoiakim son of Josiah of Judah:
content_old: 1 The word which the prophet Jeremiah spoke to Baruch son of Neriah, when he was writing these words in a scroll at Jeremiah’s dictation, in the fourth year of King Jehoiakim son of Josiah of Judah:

content: 2 Thus said the LORD, the God of Israel, concerning you, Baruch:
content_old: 2 Thus said the LORD, the God of Israel, concerning you, Baruch:

content: 3 You say, “Woe is me! The LORD has added grief to my pain. I am worn out with groaning, and I have found no rest.”
content_old: 3 You say, “Woe is me! The LORD has added grief to my pain. I am worn out with groaning, and I have found no rest.”

content: 4 Thus shall you speak to him: “Thus said the LORD: I am going to overthrow what I have built, and uproot what I have planted—this applies to the whole land.
content_old: 4 Thus shall you speak to him: “Thus said the LORD: I am going to overthrow what I have built, and uproot what I have planted—this applies to the whole land.

content: 1 The word of the LORD to the prophet Jeremiah concerning the nations.
content_old: 1 The word of the LORD to the prophet Jeremiah concerning the nations.

content: 2 Concerning Egypt, about the army of Pharaoh Neco, king of Egypt, which was at the river Euphrates near Carchemish, and which was defeated by King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon, in the fourth year of King Jehoiakim son of Josiah of Judah.
content_old: 2 Concerning Egypt, about the army of Pharaoh Neco, king of Egypt, which was at the river Euphrates near Carchemish, and which was defeated by King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon, in the fourth year of King Jehoiakim son of Josiah of Judah.

content: 3 Get ready buckler and shield, And move forward to battle!
content_old: 3 Get ready buckler and shield, And move forward to battle!

content: 4 Harness the horses; Mount, you horsemen! Fall in line, helmets on! Burnish the lances, Don your armor!
content_old: 4 Harness the horses; Mount, you horsemen! Fall in line, helmets on! Burnish the lances, Don your armor!

content: 5 Why do I see them dismayed, Yielding ground? Their fighters are crushed, They flee in haste And do not turn back— Terror all around! —declares the LORD.
content_old: 5 Why do I see them dismayed, Yielding ground? Their fighters are crushed, They flee in haste And do not turn back— Terror all around! —declares the LORD.

content: 6 The swift cannot get away, The warrior cannot escape. In the north, by the river Euphrates, They stagger and fall.
content_old: 6 The swift cannot get away, The warrior cannot escape. In the north, by the river Euphrates, They stagger and fall.

content: 7 Who is this that rises like the Nile, Like streams whose waters surge?
content_old: 7 Who is this that rises like the Nile, Like streams whose waters surge?

content: 8 It is Egypt that rises like the Nile, Like streams whose waters surge, That said, “I will rise, I will cover the earth, I will wipe out towns And those who dwell in them.
content_old: 8 It is Egypt that rises like the Nile, Like streams whose waters surge, That said, “I will rise, I will cover the earth, I will wipe out towns And those who dwell in them.

content: 9 Advance, O horses, Dash madly, O chariots! Let the warriors go forth, Cush and Put, that grasp the shield, And the Ludim who grasp and draw the bow!”
content_old: 9 Advance, O horses, Dash madly, O chariots! Let the warriors go forth, Cush and Put, that grasp the shield, And the Ludim who grasp and draw the bow!”

content: 10 But that day shall be for the Lord GOD of Hosts a day when He exacts retribution from His foes. The sword shall devour; it shall be sated and drunk with their blood. For the Lord GOD of Hosts is preparing a sacrifice in the northland, by the river Euphrates.
content_old: 10 But that day shall be for the Lord GOD of Hosts a day when He exacts retribution from His foes. The sword shall devour; it shall be sated and drunk with their blood. For the Lord GOD of Hosts is preparing a sacrifice in the northland, by the river Euphrates.

content: 11 Go up to Gilead and get balm, Fair Maiden Egypt. In vain do you seek many remedies, There is no healing for you.
content_old: 11 Go up to Gilead and get balm, Fair Maiden Egypt. In vain do you seek many remedies, There is no healing for you.

content: 12 Nations have heard your shame; The earth resounds with your screams. For warrior stumbles against warrior; The two fall down together.
content_old: 12 Nations have heard your shame; The earth resounds with your screams. For warrior stumbles against warrior; The two fall down together.

content: 13 The word which the LORD spoke to the prophet Jeremiah about the coming of King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon to attack the land of Egypt:
content_old: 13 The word which the LORD spoke to the prophet Jeremiah about the coming of King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon to attack the land of Egypt:

content: 14 Declare in Egypt, proclaim in Migdol, Proclaim in Noph and Tahpanhes! Say: Take your posts and stand ready, For the sword has devoured all around you!
content_old: 14 Declare in Egypt, proclaim in Migdol, Proclaim in Noph and Tahpanhes! Say: Take your posts and stand ready, For the sword has devoured all around you!

content: 15 Why are your stalwarts swept away? They did not stand firm, For the LORD thrust them down;
content_old: 15 Why are your stalwarts swept away? They did not stand firm, For the LORD thrust them down;

content: 16 He made many stumble, They fell over one another. They said: “Up! let us return to our people, To the land of our birth, Because of the deadly sword.”
content_old: 16 He made many stumble, They fell over one another. They said: “Up! let us return to our people, To the land of our birth, Because of the deadly sword.”

content: 17 There they called Pharaoh king of Egypt: “Braggart who let the hour go by.”
content_old: 17 There they called Pharaoh king of Egypt: “Braggart who let the hour go by.”

content: 18 As I live—declares the King, Whose name is LORD of Hosts— As surely as Tabor is among the mountains And Carmel is by the sea, So shall this come to pass.
content_old: 18 As I live—declares the King, Whose name is LORD of Hosts— As surely as Tabor is among the mountains And Carmel is by the sea, So shall this come to pass.

content: 19 Equip yourself for exile, Fair Egypt, you who dwell secure! For Noph shall become a waste, Desolate, without inhabitants.
content_old: 19 Equip yourself for exile, Fair Egypt, you who dwell secure! For Noph shall become a waste, Desolate, without inhabitants.

content: 20 Egypt is a handsome heifer— A gadfly from the north is coming, coming!
content_old: 20 Egypt is a handsome heifer— A gadfly from the north is coming, coming!

content: 21 The mercenaries, too, in her midst Are like stall-fed calves; They too shall turn tail, Flee as one, and make no stand. Their day of disaster is upon them, The hour of their doom.
content_old: 21 The mercenaries, too, in her midst Are like stall-fed calves; They too shall turn tail, Flee as one, and make no stand. Their day of disaster is upon them, The hour of their doom.

content: 22 She shall rustle away like a snake As they come marching in force; They shall come against her with axes, Like hewers of wood.
content_old: 22 She shall rustle away like a snake As they come marching in force; They shall come against her with axes, Like hewers of wood.

content: 23 They shall cut down her forest —declares the LORD— Though it cannot be measured; For they are more numerous than locusts, And cannot be counted.
content_old: 23 They shall cut down her forest —declares the LORD— Though it cannot be measured; For they are more numerous than locusts, And cannot be counted.

content: 24 Fair Egypt shall be shamed, Handed over to the people of the north.
content_old: 24 Fair Egypt shall be shamed, Handed over to the people of the north.

content: 25 The LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, has said: I will inflict punishment on Amon of No and on Pharaoh—on Egypt, her gods, and her kings—on Pharaoh and all who rely on him.
content_old: 25 The LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, has said: I will inflict punishment on Amon of No and on Pharaoh—on Egypt, her gods, and her kings—on Pharaoh and all who rely on him.

content: 26 I will deliver them into the hands of those who seek to kill them, into the hands of King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon and into the hands of his subjects. But afterward she shall be inhabited again as in former days, declares the LORD.
content_old: 26 I will deliver them into the hands of those who seek to kill them, into the hands of King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon and into the hands of his subjects. But afterward she shall be inhabited again as in former days, declares the LORD.

content: 27 But you, Have no fear, My servant Jacob, Be not dismayed, O Israel! I will deliver you from far away, Your folk from their land of captivity; And Jacob again shall have calm And quiet, with none to trouble him.
content_old: 27 But you, Have no fear, My servant Jacob, Be not dismayed, O Israel! I will deliver you from far away, Your folk from their land of captivity; And Jacob again shall have calm And quiet, with none to trouble him.

content: 1 The word of the LORD that came to the prophet Jeremiah concerning the Philistines, before Pharaoh conquered Gaza.
content_old: 1 The word of the LORD that came to the prophet Jeremiah concerning the Philistines, before Pharaoh conquered Gaza.

content: 2 Thus said the LORD: See, waters are rising from the north, They shall become a raging torrent, They shall flood the land and its creatures, The towns and their inhabitants. Men shall cry out, All the inhabitants of the land shall howl,
content_old: 2 Thus said the LORD: See, waters are rising from the north, They shall become a raging torrent, They shall flood the land and its creatures, The towns and their inhabitants. Men shall cry out, All the inhabitants of the land shall howl,

content: 3 At the clatter of the stamping hoofs of his stallions, At the noise of his chariots, The rumbling of their wheels, Fathers shall not look to their children Out of sheer helplessness
content_old: 3 At the clatter of the stamping hoofs of his stallions, At the noise of his chariots, The rumbling of their wheels, Fathers shall not look to their children Out of sheer helplessness

content: 4 Because of the day that is coming For ravaging all the Philistines, For cutting off every last ally Of Tyre and Sidon. For the LORD will ravage the Philistines, The remnant from the island of Caphtor.
content_old: 4 Because of the day that is coming For ravaging all the Philistines, For cutting off every last ally Of Tyre and Sidon. For the LORD will ravage the Philistines, The remnant from the island of Caphtor.

content: 5 Baldness has come upon Gaza, Ashkelon is destroyed. O remnant of their valley, How long will you gash yourself?
content_old: 5 Baldness has come upon Gaza, Ashkelon is destroyed. O remnant of their valley, How long will you gash yourself?

content: 6 “O sword of the LORD, When will you be quiet at last? Withdraw into your sheath, Rest and be still!”
content_old: 6 “O sword of the LORD, When will you be quiet at last? Withdraw into your sheath, Rest and be still!”

content: 1 Concerning Moab. Thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: Alas, that Nebo should be ravaged, Kiriathaim captured and shamed, The stronghold shamed and dismayed!
content_old: 1 Concerning Moab. Thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: Alas, that Nebo should be ravaged, Kiriathaim captured and shamed, The stronghold shamed and dismayed!

content: 2 Moab’s glory is no more; In Heshbon they have planned evil against her: “Come, let us make an end of her as a nation!” You too, O Madmen, shall be silenced; The sword is following you.
content_old: 2 Moab’s glory is no more; In Heshbon they have planned evil against her: “Come, let us make an end of her as a nation!” You too, O Madmen, shall be silenced; The sword is following you.

content: 3 Hark! an outcry from Horonaim, Destruction and utter ruin!
content_old: 3 Hark! an outcry from Horonaim, Destruction and utter ruin!

content: 4 Moab is broken; Her young ones cry aloud;
content_old: 4 Moab is broken; Her young ones cry aloud;

content: 5 They climb to Luhith Weeping continually; On the descent to Horonaim A distressing cry of anguish is heard:
content_old: 5 They climb to Luhith Weeping continually; On the descent to Horonaim A distressing cry of anguish is heard:

content: 6 Flee, save your lives! And be like Aroer in the desert.
content_old: 6 Flee, save your lives! And be like Aroer in the desert.

content: 7 Surely, because of your trust In your wealth and in your treasures, You too shall be captured. And Chemosh shall go forth to exile, Together with his priests and attendants.
content_old: 7 Surely, because of your trust In your wealth and in your treasures, You too shall be captured. And Chemosh shall go forth to exile, Together with his priests and attendants.

content: 8 The ravager shall come to every town; No town shall escape. The valley shall be devastated And the tableland laid waste —because the LORD has spoken.
content_old: 8 The ravager shall come to every town; No town shall escape. The valley shall be devastated And the tableland laid waste —because the LORD has spoken.

content: 9 Give wings to Moab, For she must go hence. Her towns shall become desolate, With no one living in them.
content_old: 9 Give wings to Moab, For she must go hence. Her towns shall become desolate, With no one living in them.

content: 10 Cursed be he who is slack in doing the LORD’s work! Cursed be he who withholds his sword from blood!
content_old: 10 Cursed be he who is slack in doing the LORD’s work! Cursed be he who withholds his sword from blood!

content: 11 Moab has been secure from his youth on— He is settled on his lees And has not been poured from vessel to vessel— He has never gone into exile. Therefore his fine flavor has remained And his bouquet is unspoiled.
content_old: 11 Moab has been secure from his youth on— He is settled on his lees And has not been poured from vessel to vessel— He has never gone into exile. Therefore his fine flavor has remained And his bouquet is unspoiled.

content: 12 But days are coming—declares the LORD—when I will send men against him to tip him over; they shall empty his vessels and smash his jars.
content_old: 12 But days are coming—declares the LORD—when I will send men against him to tip him over; they shall empty his vessels and smash his jars.

content: 13 And Moab shall be shamed because of Chemosh, as the House of Israel were shamed because of Bethel, on whom they relied.
content_old: 13 And Moab shall be shamed because of Chemosh, as the House of Israel were shamed because of Bethel, on whom they relied.

content: 14 How can you say: We are warriors, Valiant men for war?
content_old: 14 How can you say: We are warriors, Valiant men for war?

content: 15 Moab is ravaged, His towns have been entered, His choice young men Have gone down to the slaughter —declares the King whose name is LORD of Hosts.
content_old: 15 Moab is ravaged, His towns have been entered, His choice young men Have gone down to the slaughter —declares the King whose name is LORD of Hosts.

content: 16 The doom of Moab is coming close, His downfall is approaching swiftly.
content_old: 16 The doom of Moab is coming close, His downfall is approaching swiftly.

content: 17 Condole with him, all who live near him, All you who know him by name! Say: “Alas, the strong rod is broken, The lordly staff!”
content_old: 17 Condole with him, all who live near him, All you who know him by name! Say: “Alas, the strong rod is broken, The lordly staff!”

content: 18 Descend from glory And sit in thirst, O inhabitant of Fair Dibon; For the ravager of Moab has entered your town, He has destroyed your fortresses.
content_old: 18 Descend from glory And sit in thirst, O inhabitant of Fair Dibon; For the ravager of Moab has entered your town, He has destroyed your fortresses.

content: 19 Stand by the road and look out, O inhabitant of Aroer. Ask of him who is fleeing And of her who is escaping: Say, “What has happened?”
content_old: 19 Stand by the road and look out, O inhabitant of Aroer. Ask of him who is fleeing And of her who is escaping: Say, “What has happened?”

content: 20 Moab is shamed and dismayed; Howl and cry aloud! Tell at the Arnon That Moab is ravaged!
content_old: 20 Moab is shamed and dismayed; Howl and cry aloud! Tell at the Arnon That Moab is ravaged!

content: 21 Judgment has come upon the tableland—upon Holon, Jahzah, and Mephaath;
content_old: 21 Judgment has come upon the tableland—upon Holon, Jahzah, and Mephaath;

content: 22 upon Dibon, Nebo, and Beth-diblathaim;
content_old: 22 upon Dibon, Nebo, and Beth-diblathaim;

content: 23 upon Kiriathaim, Beth-gamul, and Beth-meon;
content_old: 23 upon Kiriathaim, Beth-gamul, and Beth-meon;

content: 24 upon Kerioth and Bozrah—upon all the towns of the land of Moab, far and near.
content_old: 24 upon Kerioth and Bozrah—upon all the towns of the land of Moab, far and near.

content: 25 The might of Moab has been cut down, His strength is broken —declares the LORD.
content_old: 25 The might of Moab has been cut down, His strength is broken —declares the LORD.

content: 26 Get him drunk For he vaunted himself against the LORD. Moab shall vomit till he is drained, And he too shall be a laughingstock.
content_old: 26 Get him drunk For he vaunted himself against the LORD. Moab shall vomit till he is drained, And he too shall be a laughingstock.

content: 27 Wasn’t Israel a laughingstock to you? Was he ever caught among thieves, That you should shake your head Whenever you speak of him?
content_old: 27 Wasn’t Israel a laughingstock to you? Was he ever caught among thieves, That you should shake your head Whenever you speak of him?

content: 28 Desert the cities And dwell in the crags, O inhabitants of Moab! Be like a dove that nests In the sides of a pit.
content_old: 28 Desert the cities And dwell in the crags, O inhabitants of Moab! Be like a dove that nests In the sides of a pit.

content: 29 We have heard of Moab’s pride— Most haughty is he— Of his arrogance and pride, His haughtiness and self-exaltation.
content_old: 29 We have heard of Moab’s pride— Most haughty is he— Of his arrogance and pride, His haughtiness and self-exaltation.

content: 30 I know his insolence—declares the LORD—the wickedness that is in him, the wickedness he has committed.
content_old: 30 I know his insolence—declares the LORD—the wickedness that is in him, the wickedness he has committed.

content: 31 Therefore I will howl for Moab, I will cry out for all Moab, I will moan for the men of Kir-heres.
content_old: 31 Therefore I will howl for Moab, I will cry out for all Moab, I will moan for the men of Kir-heres.

content: 32 With greater weeping than for Jazer I weep for you, O vine of Sibmah, Whose tendrils crossed the sea, Reached to the sea, to Jazer. A ravager has come down Upon your fig and grape harvests.
content_old: 32 With greater weeping than for Jazer I weep for you, O vine of Sibmah, Whose tendrils crossed the sea, Reached to the sea, to Jazer. A ravager has come down Upon your fig and grape harvests.

content: 33 Rejoicing and gladness Are gone from the farm land, From the country of Moab; I have put an end to wine in the presses, No one treads with shouting— The shout is a shout no more.
content_old: 33 Rejoicing and gladness Are gone from the farm land, From the country of Moab; I have put an end to wine in the presses, No one treads with shouting— The shout is a shout no more.

content: 34 There is an outcry from Heshbon to Elealeh, They raise their voices as far as Jahaz, From Zoar to Horonaim and Eglath-shelishiah. The waters of Nimrim Shall also become desolation.
content_old: 34 There is an outcry from Heshbon to Elealeh, They raise their voices as far as Jahaz, From Zoar to Horonaim and Eglath-shelishiah. The waters of Nimrim Shall also become desolation.

content: 35 And I will make an end in Moab —declares the LORD— Of those who offer at a shrine And burn incense to their god.
content_old: 35 And I will make an end in Moab —declares the LORD— Of those who offer at a shrine And burn incense to their god.

content: 36 Therefore, My heart moans for Moab like a flute; Like a flute my heart moans For the men of Kir-heres— Therefore, The gains they have made shall vanish—
content_old: 36 Therefore, My heart moans for Moab like a flute; Like a flute my heart moans For the men of Kir-heres— Therefore, The gains they have made shall vanish—

content: 37 For every head is bald And every beard is shorn; On all hands there are gashes, And on the loins sackcloth.
content_old: 37 For every head is bald And every beard is shorn; On all hands there are gashes, And on the loins sackcloth.

content: 38 On all the roofs of Moab, And in its squares There is naught but lamentation; For I have broken Moab Like a vessel no one wants —declares the LORD.
content_old: 38 On all the roofs of Moab, And in its squares There is naught but lamentation; For I have broken Moab Like a vessel no one wants —declares the LORD.

content: 39 How he is dismayed! Wail! How Moab has turned his back in shame! Moab shall be a laughingstock And a shock to all those near him.
content_old: 39 How he is dismayed! Wail! How Moab has turned his back in shame! Moab shall be a laughingstock And a shock to all those near him.

content: 40 For thus said the LORD: See, he soars like an eagle And spreads out his wings against Moab!
content_old: 40 For thus said the LORD: See, he soars like an eagle And spreads out his wings against Moab!

content: 41 Kerioth shall be captured And the strongholds shall be seized. In that day, the heart of Moab’s warriors Shall be like the heart of a woman in travail.
content_old: 41 Kerioth shall be captured And the strongholds shall be seized. In that day, the heart of Moab’s warriors Shall be like the heart of a woman in travail.

content: 42 And Moab shall be destroyed as a people, For he vaunted himself against the LORD.
content_old: 42 And Moab shall be destroyed as a people, For he vaunted himself against the LORD.

content: 43 Terror, and pit, and trap Upon you who dwell in Moab! —declares the LORD.
content_old: 43 Terror, and pit, and trap Upon you who dwell in Moab! —declares the LORD.

content: 44 He who flees from the terror Shall fall into the pit; And he who climbs out of the pit Shall be caught in the trap. For I will bring upon Moab The year of their doom —declares the LORD.
content_old: 44 He who flees from the terror Shall fall into the pit; And he who climbs out of the pit Shall be caught in the trap. For I will bring upon Moab The year of their doom —declares the LORD.

content: 45 In the shelter of Heshbon Fugitives halt exhausted; For fire went forth from Heshbon, Flame from the midst of Sihon, Consuming the brow of Moab, The pate of the people of Shaon.
content_old: 45 In the shelter of Heshbon Fugitives halt exhausted; For fire went forth from Heshbon, Flame from the midst of Sihon, Consuming the brow of Moab, The pate of the people of Shaon.

content: 46 Woe to you, O Moab! The people of Chemosh are undone, For your sons are carried off into captivity, Your daughters into exile.
content_old: 46 Woe to you, O Moab! The people of Chemosh are undone, For your sons are carried off into captivity, Your daughters into exile.

content: 1 Concerning the Ammonites. Thus said the LORD: Has Israel no sons, Has he no heir? Then why has Milcom dispossessed Gad, And why have his people settled in Gad’s towns?
content_old: 1 Concerning the Ammonites. Thus said the LORD: Has Israel no sons, Has he no heir? Then why has Milcom dispossessed Gad, And why have his people settled in Gad’s towns?

content: 2 Assuredly, days are coming —declares the LORD— When I will sound the alarm of war Against Rabbah of the Ammonites; It shall become a desolate mound, And its villages shall be set on fire. And Israel shall dispossess Those who dispossessed him —said the LORD.
content_old: 2 Assuredly, days are coming —declares the LORD— When I will sound the alarm of war Against Rabbah of the Ammonites; It shall become a desolate mound, And its villages shall be set on fire. And Israel shall dispossess Those who dispossessed him —said the LORD.

content: 3 Howl, O Heshbon, for Ai is ravaged! Cry out, O daughters of Rabbah! Gird on sackcloth, lament, And run to and fro in the sheepfolds. For Milcom shall go into exile, Together with his priests and attendants.
content_old: 3 Howl, O Heshbon, for Ai is ravaged! Cry out, O daughters of Rabbah! Gird on sackcloth, lament, And run to and fro in the sheepfolds. For Milcom shall go into exile, Together with his priests and attendants.

content: 4 Why do you glory in strength, Your strength is drained, O rebellious daughter, You who relied on your treasures, Who dares attack me?
content_old: 4 Why do you glory in strength, Your strength is drained, O rebellious daughter, You who relied on your treasures, Who dares attack me?

content: 5 I am bringing terror upon you —declares the Lord GOD of Hosts— From all those around you. Every one of you shall be driven in every direction, And none shall gather in the fugitives.
content_old: 5 I am bringing terror upon you —declares the Lord GOD of Hosts— From all those around you. Every one of you shall be driven in every direction, And none shall gather in the fugitives.

content: 6 But afterward I will restore the fortunes of the Ammonites—declares the LORD.
content_old: 6 But afterward I will restore the fortunes of the Ammonites—declares the LORD.

content: 7 Concerning Edom. Thus said the LORD of Hosts: Is there no more wisdom in Teman? Has counsel vanished from the prudent? Has their wisdom gone stale?
content_old: 7 Concerning Edom. Thus said the LORD of Hosts: Is there no more wisdom in Teman? Has counsel vanished from the prudent? Has their wisdom gone stale?

content: 8 Flee, turn away, sit down low, O inhabitants of Dedan, For I am bringing Esau’s doom upon him, The time when I deal with him.
content_old: 8 Flee, turn away, sit down low, O inhabitants of Dedan, For I am bringing Esau’s doom upon him, The time when I deal with him.

content: 9 If vintagers were to come upon you, Would they leave no gleanings? Even thieves in the night Would destroy only for their needs!
content_old: 9 If vintagers were to come upon you, Would they leave no gleanings? Even thieves in the night Would destroy only for their needs!

content: 10 But it is I who have bared Esau, Have exposed his place of concealment; He cannot hide. His offspring is ravaged, His kin and his neighbors— He is no more.
content_old: 10 But it is I who have bared Esau, Have exposed his place of concealment; He cannot hide. His offspring is ravaged, His kin and his neighbors— He is no more.

content: 11 “Leave your orphans with me, I will rear them; Let your widows rely on me!”
content_old: 11 “Leave your orphans with me, I will rear them; Let your widows rely on me!”

content: 12 For thus said the LORD: If they who rightly should not drink of the cup must drink it, are you the one to go unpunished? You shall not go unpunished: you will have to drink!
content_old: 12 For thus said the LORD: If they who rightly should not drink of the cup must drink it, are you the one to go unpunished? You shall not go unpunished: you will have to drink!

content: 13 For by Myself I swear—declares the LORD—Bozrah shall become a desolation, a mockery, a ruin, and a curse; and all its towns shall be ruins for all time.
content_old: 13 For by Myself I swear—declares the LORD—Bozrah shall become a desolation, a mockery, a ruin, and a curse; and all its towns shall be ruins for all time.

content: 14 I have received tidings from the LORD, And an envoy is sent out among the nations: Assemble, and move against her, And rise up for war!
content_old: 14 I have received tidings from the LORD, And an envoy is sent out among the nations: Assemble, and move against her, And rise up for war!

content: 15 For I will make you least among nations, Most despised among men.
content_old: 15 For I will make you least among nations, Most despised among men.

content: 16 Your horrible nature, Your arrogant heart has seduced you, You who dwell in clefts of the rock, Who occupy the height of the hill! Should you nest as high as the eagle, From there I will pull you down —declares the LORD.
content_old: 16 Your horrible nature, Your arrogant heart has seduced you, You who dwell in clefts of the rock, Who occupy the height of the hill! Should you nest as high as the eagle, From there I will pull you down —declares the LORD.

content: 17 And Edom shall be a cause of appallment; whoever passes by will be appalled and will hiss at all its wounds.
content_old: 17 And Edom shall be a cause of appallment; whoever passes by will be appalled and will hiss at all its wounds.

content: 18 It shall be like the overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah and their neighbors—said the LORD: no man shall live there, no human shall sojourn there.
content_old: 18 It shall be like the overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah and their neighbors—said the LORD: no man shall live there, no human shall sojourn there.

content: 19 It shall be as when a lion comes up out of the jungle of the Jordan against a secure pasture: in a moment I can harry him out of it and appoint over it anyone I choose. Then who is like Me? Who can summon Me? Who is the shepherd that can stand up against Me?
content_old: 19 It shall be as when a lion comes up out of the jungle of the Jordan against a secure pasture: in a moment I can harry him out of it and appoint over it anyone I choose. Then who is like Me? Who can summon Me? Who is the shepherd that can stand up against Me?

content: 20 Hear, then, the plan which the LORD has devised against Edom, and what He has purposed against the inhabitants of Teman: Surely the shepherd boys Shall drag them away; Surely the pasture shall be Aghast because of them.
content_old: 20 Hear, then, the plan which the LORD has devised against Edom, and what He has purposed against the inhabitants of Teman: Surely the shepherd boys Shall drag them away; Surely the pasture shall be Aghast because of them.

content: 21 At the sound of their downfall The earth shall shake; The sound of screaming Shall be heard at the Sea of Reeds.
content_old: 21 At the sound of their downfall The earth shall shake; The sound of screaming Shall be heard at the Sea of Reeds.

content: 22 See, like an eagle he flies up, He soars and spreads his wings against Bozrah; And the heart of Edom’s warriors in that day Shall be like the heart of a woman in travail.
content_old: 22 See, like an eagle he flies up, He soars and spreads his wings against Bozrah; And the heart of Edom’s warriors in that day Shall be like the heart of a woman in travail.

content: 23 Concerning Damascus. Hamath and Arpad are shamed, For they have heard bad news. They shake with anxiety, Like the sea which cannot rest.
content_old: 23 Concerning Damascus. Hamath and Arpad are shamed, For they have heard bad news. They shake with anxiety, Like the sea which cannot rest.

content: 24 Damascus has grown weak, She has turned around to flee; Trembling has seized her, Pain and anguish have taken hold of her, Like a woman in childbirth.
content_old: 24 Damascus has grown weak, She has turned around to flee; Trembling has seized her, Pain and anguish have taken hold of her, Like a woman in childbirth.

content: 25 How has the glorious city not been deserted, The citadel of my joy!
content_old: 25 How has the glorious city not been deserted, The citadel of my joy!

content: 26 Assuredly, her young men shall lie fallen in her squares. And all her warriors shall be stilled in that day —declares the LORD of Hosts.
content_old: 26 Assuredly, her young men shall lie fallen in her squares. And all her warriors shall be stilled in that day —declares the LORD of Hosts.

content: 27 I will set fire to the wall of Damascus, And it shall consume the fortresses of Ben-hadad.
content_old: 27 I will set fire to the wall of Damascus, And it shall consume the fortresses of Ben-hadad.

content: 28 Concerning Kedar and the kingdoms of Hazor, which King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon conquered. Thus said the LORD: Arise, march against Kedar, And ravage the Kedemites!
content_old: 28 Concerning Kedar and the kingdoms of Hazor, which King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon conquered. Thus said the LORD: Arise, march against Kedar, And ravage the Kedemites!

content: 29 They will take away their tents and their flocks, Their tent cloths and all their gear; They shall carry off their camels, And shall proclaim against them: Terror all around!
content_old: 29 They will take away their tents and their flocks, Their tent cloths and all their gear; They shall carry off their camels, And shall proclaim against them: Terror all around!

content: 30 Flee, wander far, Sit down low, O inhabitants of Hazor —says the LORD. For King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon Has devised a plan against you And formed a purpose against you:
content_old: 30 Flee, wander far, Sit down low, O inhabitants of Hazor —says the LORD. For King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon Has devised a plan against you And formed a purpose against you:

content: 31 Rise up, attack a tranquil nation That dwells secure —says the LORD— That has no barred gates, That dwells alone.
content_old: 31 Rise up, attack a tranquil nation That dwells secure —says the LORD— That has no barred gates, That dwells alone.

content: 32 Their camels shall become booty, And their abundant flocks a spoil; And I will scatter to every quarter Those who have their hair clipped; And from every direction I will bring Disaster upon them —says the LORD.
content_old: 32 Their camels shall become booty, And their abundant flocks a spoil; And I will scatter to every quarter Those who have their hair clipped; And from every direction I will bring Disaster upon them —says the LORD.

content: 33 Hazor shall become a lair of jackals, A desolation for all time. No man shall live there, No human shall sojourn there.
content_old: 33 Hazor shall become a lair of jackals, A desolation for all time. No man shall live there, No human shall sojourn there.

content: 34 The word of the LORD that came to the prophet Jeremiah concerning Elam, at the beginning of the reign of King Zedekiah of Judah:
content_old: 34 The word of the LORD that came to the prophet Jeremiah concerning Elam, at the beginning of the reign of King Zedekiah of Judah:

content: 35 Thus said the LORD of Hosts: I am going to break the bow of Elam, the mainstay of their strength.
content_old: 35 Thus said the LORD of Hosts: I am going to break the bow of Elam, the mainstay of their strength.

content: 36 And I shall bring four winds against Elam from the four quarters of heaven, and scatter them to all those winds. There shall not be a nation to which the fugitives from Elam do not come.
content_old: 36 And I shall bring four winds against Elam from the four quarters of heaven, and scatter them to all those winds. There shall not be a nation to which the fugitives from Elam do not come.

content: 37 And I will break Elam before their enemies, before those who seek their lives; and I will bring disaster upon them, My flaming wrath—declares the LORD. And I will dispatch the sword after them until I have consumed them.
content_old: 37 And I will break Elam before their enemies, before those who seek their lives; and I will bring disaster upon them, My flaming wrath—declares the LORD. And I will dispatch the sword after them until I have consumed them.

content: 38 And I will set My throne in Elam, And wipe out from there king and officials —says the LORD.
content_old: 38 And I will set My throne in Elam, And wipe out from there king and officials —says the LORD.

content: 1 The word which the LORD spoke concerning Babylon, the land of the Chaldeans, through the prophet Jeremiah:
content_old: 1 The word which the LORD spoke concerning Babylon, the land of the Chaldeans, through the prophet Jeremiah:

content: 2 Declare among the nations, and proclaim; Raise a standard, proclaim; Hide nothing! Say: Babylon is captured, Bel is shamed, Merodach is dismayed. Her idols are shamed, Her fetishes dismayed.
content_old: 2 Declare among the nations, and proclaim; Raise a standard, proclaim; Hide nothing! Say: Babylon is captured, Bel is shamed, Merodach is dismayed. Her idols are shamed, Her fetishes dismayed.

content: 3 For a nation from the north has attacked her, It will make her land a desolation. No one shall dwell in it, Both man and beast shall wander away.
content_old: 3 For a nation from the north has attacked her, It will make her land a desolation. No one shall dwell in it, Both man and beast shall wander away.

content: 4 In those days and at that time—declares the LORD—the people of Israel together with the people of Judah shall come, and they shall weep as they go to seek the LORD their God.
content_old: 4 In those days and at that time—declares the LORD—the people of Israel together with the people of Judah shall come, and they shall weep as they go to seek the LORD their God.

content: 5 They shall inquire for Zion; in that direction their faces shall turn; they shall come and attach themselves to the LORD by a covenant for all time, which shall never be forgotten.
content_old: 5 They shall inquire for Zion; in that direction their faces shall turn; they shall come and attach themselves to the LORD by a covenant for all time, which shall never be forgotten.

content: 6 My people were lost sheep: their shepherds led them astray, they drove them out to the mountains, they roamed from mount to hill, they forgot their own resting place.
content_old: 6 My people were lost sheep: their shepherds led them astray, they drove them out to the mountains, they roamed from mount to hill, they forgot their own resting place.

content: 7 All who encountered them devoured them; and their foes said, “We shall not be held guilty, because they have sinned against the LORD, the true Pasture, the Hope of their fathers—the LORD.”
content_old: 7 All who encountered them devoured them; and their foes said, “We shall not be held guilty, because they have sinned against the LORD, the true Pasture, the Hope of their fathers—the LORD.”

content: 8 Flee from Babylon, Leave the land of the Chaldeans, And be like he-goats that lead the flock!
content_old: 8 Flee from Babylon, Leave the land of the Chaldeans, And be like he-goats that lead the flock!

content: 9 For see, I am rousing and leading An assemblage of great nations against Babylon From the lands of the north. They shall draw up their lines against her, There she shall be captured. Their arrows are like those of a skilled warrior Who does not turn back without hitting the mark.
content_old: 9 For see, I am rousing and leading An assemblage of great nations against Babylon From the lands of the north. They shall draw up their lines against her, There she shall be captured. Their arrows are like those of a skilled warrior Who does not turn back without hitting the mark.

content: 10 Chaldea shall be despoiled, All her spoilers shall be sated —declares the LORD.
content_old: 10 Chaldea shall be despoiled, All her spoilers shall be sated —declares the LORD.

content: 11 For you rejoiced, you exulted, You who plundered My possession; You stamped like a heifer treading grain, You neighed like steeds.
content_old: 11 For you rejoiced, you exulted, You who plundered My possession; You stamped like a heifer treading grain, You neighed like steeds.

content: 12 So your mother will be utterly shamed, She who bore you will be disgraced. Behold the end of the nations— Wilderness, desert, and steppe!
content_old: 12 So your mother will be utterly shamed, She who bore you will be disgraced. Behold the end of the nations— Wilderness, desert, and steppe!

content: 13 Because of the LORD’s wrath she shall not be inhabited; She shall be utterly desolate. Whoever passes by Babylon will be appalled And will hiss at all her wounds.
content_old: 13 Because of the LORD’s wrath she shall not be inhabited; She shall be utterly desolate. Whoever passes by Babylon will be appalled And will hiss at all her wounds.

content: 14 Range yourselves roundabout Babylon, All you who draw the bow; Shoot at her, don’t spare arrows, For she has sinned against the LORD.
content_old: 14 Range yourselves roundabout Babylon, All you who draw the bow; Shoot at her, don’t spare arrows, For she has sinned against the LORD.

content: 15 Raise a shout against her all about! She has surrendered; Her bastions have fallen, Her walls are thrown down— This is the LORD’s vengeance. Take vengeance on her, Do to her as she has done!
content_old: 15 Raise a shout against her all about! She has surrendered; Her bastions have fallen, Her walls are thrown down— This is the LORD’s vengeance. Take vengeance on her, Do to her as she has done!

content: 16 Make an end in Babylon of sowers, And of wielders of the sickle at harvest time. Because of the deadly sword, Each man shall turn back to his people, They shall flee every one to his land.
content_old: 16 Make an end in Babylon of sowers, And of wielders of the sickle at harvest time. Because of the deadly sword, Each man shall turn back to his people, They shall flee every one to his land.

content: 17 Israel are scattered sheep, harried by lions. First the king of Assyria devoured them, and in the end King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon crunched their bones.
content_old: 17 Israel are scattered sheep, harried by lions. First the king of Assyria devoured them, and in the end King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon crunched their bones.

content: 18 Assuredly, thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: I will deal with the king of Babylon and his land as I dealt with the king of Assyria.
content_old: 18 Assuredly, thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: I will deal with the king of Babylon and his land as I dealt with the king of Assyria.

content: 19 And I will lead Israel back to his pasture, and he shall graze in Carmel and Bashan, and eat his fill in the hill country of Ephraim and in Gilead.
content_old: 19 And I will lead Israel back to his pasture, and he shall graze in Carmel and Bashan, and eat his fill in the hill country of Ephraim and in Gilead.

content: 20 In those days and at that time —declares the LORD— The iniquity of Israel shall be sought, And there shall be none; The sins of Judah, And none shall be found; For I will pardon those I allow to survive.
content_old: 20 In those days and at that time —declares the LORD— The iniquity of Israel shall be sought, And there shall be none; The sins of Judah, And none shall be found; For I will pardon those I allow to survive.

content: 21 Advance against her— the land of Merathaim— And against the inhabitants of Pekod; Ruin and destroy after them to the last —says the LORD— Do just as I have commanded you.
content_old: 21 Advance against her— the land of Merathaim— And against the inhabitants of Pekod; Ruin and destroy after them to the last —says the LORD— Do just as I have commanded you.

content: 22 Hark! War in the land And vast destruction!
content_old: 22 Hark! War in the land And vast destruction!

content: 23 How the hammer of the whole earth Has been hacked and shattered! How Babylon has become An appallment among the nations!
content_old: 23 How the hammer of the whole earth Has been hacked and shattered! How Babylon has become An appallment among the nations!

content: 24 I set a snare for you, O Babylon, And you were trapped unawares; You were found and caught, Because you challenged the LORD.
content_old: 24 I set a snare for you, O Babylon, And you were trapped unawares; You were found and caught, Because you challenged the LORD.

content: 25 The LORD has opened His armory And brought out the weapons of His wrath; For that is the task Of my Lord GOD of Hosts In the land of the Chaldeans.
content_old: 25 The LORD has opened His armory And brought out the weapons of His wrath; For that is the task Of my Lord GOD of Hosts In the land of the Chaldeans.

content: 26 Come against her from every quarter; Break open her granaries, Pile her up like heaps of grain, And destroy her, let her have no remnant!
content_old: 26 Come against her from every quarter; Break open her granaries, Pile her up like heaps of grain, And destroy her, let her have no remnant!

content: 27 Destroy all her bulls, Let them go down to slaughter. Alas for them, their day is come, The hour of their doom!
content_old: 27 Destroy all her bulls, Let them go down to slaughter. Alas for them, their day is come, The hour of their doom!

content: 28 Hark! fugitives are escaping From the land of Babylon, To tell in Zion of the vengeance of the LORD our God, Vengeance for His Temple.
content_old: 28 Hark! fugitives are escaping From the land of Babylon, To tell in Zion of the vengeance of the LORD our God, Vengeance for His Temple.

content: 29 Summon archers against Babylon, All who draw the bow! Encamp against her roundabout, Let none of her people escape. Pay her back for her actions, Do to her just what she has done; For she has acted insolently against the LORD, The Holy One of Israel.
content_old: 29 Summon archers against Babylon, All who draw the bow! Encamp against her roundabout, Let none of her people escape. Pay her back for her actions, Do to her just what she has done; For she has acted insolently against the LORD, The Holy One of Israel.

content: 30 Assuredly, her young men shall fall in her squares, And all her warriors shall perish in that day —declares the LORD.
content_old: 30 Assuredly, her young men shall fall in her squares, And all her warriors shall perish in that day —declares the LORD.

content: 31 I am going to deal with you, O Insolence —declares the Lord GOD of Hosts— For your day is come, the time when I doom you:
content_old: 31 I am going to deal with you, O Insolence —declares the Lord GOD of Hosts— For your day is come, the time when I doom you:

content: 32 Insolence shall stumble and fall, With none to raise her up. I will set her cities on fire, And it shall consume everything around her.
content_old: 32 Insolence shall stumble and fall, With none to raise her up. I will set her cities on fire, And it shall consume everything around her.

content: 33 Thus said the LORD of Hosts: The people of Israel are oppressed, And so too the people of Judah; All their captors held them, They refused to let them go.
content_old: 33 Thus said the LORD of Hosts: The people of Israel are oppressed, And so too the people of Judah; All their captors held them, They refused to let them go.

content: 34 Their Redeemer is mighty, His name is LORD of Hosts. He will champion their cause— So as to give rest to the earth, And unrest to the inhabitants of Babylon.
content_old: 34 Their Redeemer is mighty, His name is LORD of Hosts. He will champion their cause— So as to give rest to the earth, And unrest to the inhabitants of Babylon.

content: 35 A sword against the Chaldeans —declares the LORD— And against the inhabitants of Babylon, Against its officials and its wise men!
content_old: 35 A sword against the Chaldeans —declares the LORD— And against the inhabitants of Babylon, Against its officials and its wise men!

content: 36 A sword against the diviners, that they be made fools of! A sword against the warriors, that they be dismayed!
content_old: 36 A sword against the diviners, that they be made fools of! A sword against the warriors, that they be dismayed!

content: 37 A sword against its horses and chariots, And against all the motley crowd in its midst, That they become like women! A sword against its treasuries, that they be pillaged!
content_old: 37 A sword against its horses and chariots, And against all the motley crowd in its midst, That they become like women! A sword against its treasuries, that they be pillaged!

content: 38 A drought against its waters, that they be dried up! For it is a land of idols; They are besotted by their dread images.
content_old: 38 A drought against its waters, that they be dried up! For it is a land of idols; They are besotted by their dread images.

content: 39 Assuredly, Wildcats and hyenas shall dwell there, And ostriches shall dwell there; It shall never be settled again, Nor inhabited throughout the ages.
content_old: 39 Assuredly, Wildcats and hyenas shall dwell there, And ostriches shall dwell there; It shall never be settled again, Nor inhabited throughout the ages.

content: 40 It shall be as when God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah and their neighbors—declares the LORD; no man shall live there, no human shall sojourn there.
content_old: 40 It shall be as when God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah and their neighbors—declares the LORD; no man shall live there, no human shall sojourn there.

content: 41 Lo, a people comes from the northland; A great nation and many kings are roused From the remotest parts of the earth.
content_old: 41 Lo, a people comes from the northland; A great nation and many kings are roused From the remotest parts of the earth.

content: 42 They grasp the bow and javelin, They are cruel, they show no mercy; The sound of them is like the roaring sea. They ride upon horses, Accoutered like a man for battle, Against you, O Fair Babylon!
content_old: 42 They grasp the bow and javelin, They are cruel, they show no mercy; The sound of them is like the roaring sea. They ride upon horses, Accoutered like a man for battle, Against you, O Fair Babylon!

content: 43 The king of Babylon has heard the report of them, And his hands are weakened; Anguish seizes him, Pangs like a woman in childbirth.
content_old: 43 The king of Babylon has heard the report of them, And his hands are weakened; Anguish seizes him, Pangs like a woman in childbirth.

content: 44 It shall be as when a lion comes out of the jungle of the Jordan against a secure pasture: in a moment I can harry them out of it and appoint over it anyone I choose. Then who is like Me? Who can summon Me? Who is the shepherd that can stand up against Me?
content_old: 44 It shall be as when a lion comes out of the jungle of the Jordan against a secure pasture: in a moment I can harry them out of it and appoint over it anyone I choose. Then who is like Me? Who can summon Me? Who is the shepherd that can stand up against Me?

content: 45 Hear, then, the plan that the LORD has devised against Babylon, and has purposed against the land of Chaldea: Surely the shepherd boys Shall drag them away; Surely the pasture shall be Aghast because of them.
content_old: 45 Hear, then, the plan that the LORD has devised against Babylon, and has purposed against the land of Chaldea: Surely the shepherd boys Shall drag them away; Surely the pasture shall be Aghast because of them.

content: 1 Thus said the LORD: See, I am rousing a destructive wind Against Babylon and the inhabitants of Leb-kamai.
content_old: 1 Thus said the LORD: See, I am rousing a destructive wind Against Babylon and the inhabitants of Leb-kamai.

content: 2 I will send strangers against Babylon, and they shall winnow her. And they shall strip her land bare; They shall beset her on all sides On the day of disaster.
content_old: 2 I will send strangers against Babylon, and they shall winnow her. And they shall strip her land bare; They shall beset her on all sides On the day of disaster.

content: 3 Let the archer draw his bow, And let him stand ready in his coat of mail! Show no pity to her young men, Wipe out all her host!
content_old: 3 Let the archer draw his bow, And let him stand ready in his coat of mail! Show no pity to her young men, Wipe out all her host!

content: 4 Let them fall slain in the land of Chaldea, Pierced through in her streets.
content_old: 4 Let them fall slain in the land of Chaldea, Pierced through in her streets.

content: 5 For Israel and Judah were not bereft Of their God the LORD of Hosts, But their land was filled with guilt Before the Holy One of Israel.
content_old: 5 For Israel and Judah were not bereft Of their God the LORD of Hosts, But their land was filled with guilt Before the Holy One of Israel.

content: 6 Flee from the midst of Babylon And save your lives, each of you! Do not perish for her iniquity; For this is a time of vengeance for the LORD, He will deal retribution to her.
content_old: 6 Flee from the midst of Babylon And save your lives, each of you! Do not perish for her iniquity; For this is a time of vengeance for the LORD, He will deal retribution to her.

content: 7 Babylon was a golden cup in the LORD’s hand, It made the whole earth drunk; The nations drank of her wine— That is why the nations are mad.
content_old: 7 Babylon was a golden cup in the LORD’s hand, It made the whole earth drunk; The nations drank of her wine— That is why the nations are mad.

content: 8 Suddenly Babylon has fallen and is shattered; Howl over her! Get balm for her wounds: Perhaps she can be healed.
content_old: 8 Suddenly Babylon has fallen and is shattered; Howl over her! Get balm for her wounds: Perhaps she can be healed.
