content: 9 We tried to cure Babylon But she was incurable. Let us leave her and go, Each to his own land; For her punishment reaches to heaven, It is as high as the sky.
content_old: 9 We tried to cure Babylon But she was incurable. Let us leave her and go, Each to his own land; For her punishment reaches to heaven, It is as high as the sky.

content: 10 The LORD has proclaimed our vindication; Come, let us recount in Zion The deeds of the LORD our God.
content_old: 10 The LORD has proclaimed our vindication; Come, let us recount in Zion The deeds of the LORD our God.

content: 11 Polish the arrows, Fill the quivers! The LORD has roused the spirit of the kings of Media, For His plan against Babylon is to destroy her. This is the vengeance of the LORD, Vengeance for His Temple.
content_old: 11 Polish the arrows, Fill the quivers! The LORD has roused the spirit of the kings of Media, For His plan against Babylon is to destroy her. This is the vengeance of the LORD, Vengeance for His Temple.

content: 12 Raise a standard against the walls of Babylon! Set up a blockade; station watchmen; Prepare those in ambush. For the LORD has both planned and performed What He decreed against the inhabitants of Babylon.
content_old: 12 Raise a standard against the walls of Babylon! Set up a blockade; station watchmen; Prepare those in ambush. For the LORD has both planned and performed What He decreed against the inhabitants of Babylon.

content: 13 O you who dwell by great waters, With vast storehouses, Your time is come, the hour of your end.
content_old: 13 O you who dwell by great waters, With vast storehouses, Your time is come, the hour of your end.

content: 14 The LORD of Hosts has sworn by Himself: I will fill you with men like a locust swarm, They will raise a shout against you.
content_old: 14 The LORD of Hosts has sworn by Himself: I will fill you with men like a locust swarm, They will raise a shout against you.

content: 15 He made the earth by His might, Established the world by His wisdom, And by His understanding stretched out the skies.
content_old: 15 He made the earth by His might, Established the world by His wisdom, And by His understanding stretched out the skies.

content: 16 When He makes His voice heard, There is a rumbling of waters in the skies; He makes vapors rise from the end of the earth, He makes lightning for the rain, And brings forth wind from His treasuries.
content_old: 16 When He makes His voice heard, There is a rumbling of waters in the skies; He makes vapors rise from the end of the earth, He makes lightning for the rain, And brings forth wind from His treasuries.

content: 17 Every man is proved dull, without knowledge; Every goldsmith is put to shame because of the idol, For his molten image is a deceit— There is no breath in them.
content_old: 17 Every man is proved dull, without knowledge; Every goldsmith is put to shame because of the idol, For his molten image is a deceit— There is no breath in them.

content: 18 They are delusion, a work of mockery; In their hour of doom, they shall perish.
content_old: 18 They are delusion, a work of mockery; In their hour of doom, they shall perish.

content: 19 Not like these in the Portion of Jacob, For it is He who formed all things; And Israel isHis very own tribe. LORD of Hosts is His name.
content_old: 19 Not like these in the Portion of Jacob, For it is He who formed all things; And Israel isHis very own tribe. LORD of Hosts is His name.

content: 20 You are My war club, My weapons of battle; With you I clubbed nations, With you I destroyed kingdoms;
content_old: 20 You are My war club, My weapons of battle; With you I clubbed nations, With you I destroyed kingdoms;

content: 21 With you I clubbed horse and rider, With you I clubbed chariot and driver,
content_old: 21 With you I clubbed horse and rider, With you I clubbed chariot and driver,

content: 22 With you I clubbed man and woman, With you I clubbed graybeard and boy, With you I clubbed youth and maiden;
content_old: 22 With you I clubbed man and woman, With you I clubbed graybeard and boy, With you I clubbed youth and maiden;

content: 23 With you I clubbed shepherd and flock, With you I clubbed plowman and team, With you I clubbed governors and prefects.
content_old: 23 With you I clubbed shepherd and flock, With you I clubbed plowman and team, With you I clubbed governors and prefects.

content: 24 But I will requite Babylon and all the inhabitants of Chaldea For all the wicked things they did to Zion before your eyes —declares the LORD.
content_old: 24 But I will requite Babylon and all the inhabitants of Chaldea For all the wicked things they did to Zion before your eyes —declares the LORD.

content: 25 See, I will deal with you, O mountain of the destroyer —declares the LORD— Destroyer of the whole earth! I will stretch out My hand against you And roll you down from the crags, And make you a burnt-out mountain.
content_old: 25 See, I will deal with you, O mountain of the destroyer —declares the LORD— Destroyer of the whole earth! I will stretch out My hand against you And roll you down from the crags, And make you a burnt-out mountain.

content: 26 They shall never take from you A cornerstone or foundation stone; You shall be a desolation for all time —declares the LORD.
content_old: 26 They shall never take from you A cornerstone or foundation stone; You shall be a desolation for all time —declares the LORD.

content: 27 Raise a standard on earth, Sound a horn among the nations, Appoint nations against her, Assemble kingdoms against her— Ararat, Minni, and Ashkenaz— Designate a marshal against her, Bring up horses like swarming locusts!
content_old: 27 Raise a standard on earth, Sound a horn among the nations, Appoint nations against her, Assemble kingdoms against her— Ararat, Minni, and Ashkenaz— Designate a marshal against her, Bring up horses like swarming locusts!

content: 28 Appoint nations for war against her— The kings of Media, Her governors and all her prefects, And all the lands they rule!
content_old: 28 Appoint nations for war against her— The kings of Media, Her governors and all her prefects, And all the lands they rule!

content: 29 Then the earth quakes and writhes, For the LORD’s purpose is fulfilled against Babylon, To make the land of Babylon A waste without inhabitant.
content_old: 29 Then the earth quakes and writhes, For the LORD’s purpose is fulfilled against Babylon, To make the land of Babylon A waste without inhabitant.

content: 30 The warriors of Babylon stop fighting, They sit in the strongholds, Their might is dried up, They become women. Her dwellings are set afire, Her bars are broken.
content_old: 30 The warriors of Babylon stop fighting, They sit in the strongholds, Their might is dried up, They become women. Her dwellings are set afire, Her bars are broken.

content: 31 Runner dashes to meet runner, Messenger to meet messenger, To report to the king of Babylon That his city is captured, from end to end.
content_old: 31 Runner dashes to meet runner, Messenger to meet messenger, To report to the king of Babylon That his city is captured, from end to end.

content: 32 The fords are captured, And the swamp thickets are consumed in fire; And the fighting men are in panic.
content_old: 32 The fords are captured, And the swamp thickets are consumed in fire; And the fighting men are in panic.

content: 33 For thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: Fair Babylon is like a threshing floor Ready to be trodden; In a little while her harvesttime will come.
content_old: 33 For thus said the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel: Fair Babylon is like a threshing floor Ready to be trodden; In a little while her harvesttime will come.

content: 34 “Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon Devoured me and discomfited me; He swallowed me like a dragon, He filled his belly with my dainties, And set me down like an empty dish; Then he rinsed me out.
content_old: 34 “Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon Devoured me and discomfited me; He swallowed me like a dragon, He filled his belly with my dainties, And set me down like an empty dish; Then he rinsed me out.

content: 35 Let the violence done me and my kindred Be upon Babylon,” Says the inhabitant of Zion; “And let my blood be upon the inhabitants of Chaldea,” Says Jerusalem.
content_old: 35 Let the violence done me and my kindred Be upon Babylon,” Says the inhabitant of Zion; “And let my blood be upon the inhabitants of Chaldea,” Says Jerusalem.

content: 36 Assuredly, thus said the LORD: I am going to uphold your cause And take vengeance for you; I will dry up her sea And make her fountain run dry.
content_old: 36 Assuredly, thus said the LORD: I am going to uphold your cause And take vengeance for you; I will dry up her sea And make her fountain run dry.

content: 37 Babylon shall become rubble, A den for jackals, An object of horror and hissing, Without inhabitant.
content_old: 37 Babylon shall become rubble, A den for jackals, An object of horror and hissing, Without inhabitant.

content: 38 Like lions, they roar together, They growl like lion cubs.
content_old: 38 Like lions, they roar together, They growl like lion cubs.

content: 39 When they are heated, I will set out their drink And get them drunk, that they may become hilarious And then sleep an endless sleep, Never to awake —declares the LORD.
content_old: 39 When they are heated, I will set out their drink And get them drunk, that they may become hilarious And then sleep an endless sleep, Never to awake —declares the LORD.

content: 40 I will bring them down like lambs for slaughter, Like rams and he-goats.
content_old: 40 I will bring them down like lambs for slaughter, Like rams and he-goats.

content: 41 How has Sheshach been captured, The praise of the whole earth been taken! How has Babylon become A horror to the nations!
content_old: 41 How has Sheshach been captured, The praise of the whole earth been taken! How has Babylon become A horror to the nations!

content: 42 The sea has risen over Babylon, She is covered by its roaring waves.
content_old: 42 The sea has risen over Babylon, She is covered by its roaring waves.

content: 43 Her towns are a desolation, A land of desert and steppe, A land no man lives in And no human passes through.
content_old: 43 Her towns are a desolation, A land of desert and steppe, A land no man lives in And no human passes through.

content: 44 And I will deal with Bel in Babylon, And make him disgorge what he has swallowed, And nations shall no more gaze on him with joy. Even the wall of Babylon shall fall.
content_old: 44 And I will deal with Bel in Babylon, And make him disgorge what he has swallowed, And nations shall no more gaze on him with joy. Even the wall of Babylon shall fall.

content: 45 Depart from there, O My people, Save your lives, each of you, From the furious anger of the LORD.
content_old: 45 Depart from there, O My people, Save your lives, each of you, From the furious anger of the LORD.

content: 46 Do not be downhearted or afraid At the rumors heard in the land: A rumor will come one year, And another rumor the next year Of violence in the land, And of ruler against ruler.
content_old: 46 Do not be downhearted or afraid At the rumors heard in the land: A rumor will come one year, And another rumor the next year Of violence in the land, And of ruler against ruler.

content: 47 Assuredly, days are coming, When I will deal with Babylon’s images; Her whole land shall be shamed, And all her slain shall fall in her midst.
content_old: 47 Assuredly, days are coming, When I will deal with Babylon’s images; Her whole land shall be shamed, And all her slain shall fall in her midst.

content: 48 Heavens and earth and all that is in them Shall shout over Babylon; For the ravagers shall come upon her from the north —declares the LORD.
content_old: 48 Heavens and earth and all that is in them Shall shout over Babylon; For the ravagers shall come upon her from the north —declares the LORD.

content: 49 Yes, Babylon is to fall For the slain of Israel, As the slain of all the earth Have fallen through Babylon.
content_old: 49 Yes, Babylon is to fall For the slain of Israel, As the slain of all the earth Have fallen through Babylon.

content: 50 You fugitives from the sword, Go, don’t delay! Remember the LORD from afar, And call Jerusalem to mind.
content_old: 50 You fugitives from the sword, Go, don’t delay! Remember the LORD from afar, And call Jerusalem to mind.

content: 51 “We were shamed, we heard taunts; Humiliation covered our faces, When aliens entered The sacred areas of the LORD’s House.”
content_old: 51 “We were shamed, we heard taunts; Humiliation covered our faces, When aliens entered The sacred areas of the LORD’s House.”

content: 52 Assuredly, days are coming —declares the LORD— When I will deal with her images, And throughout her land the dying shall groan.
content_old: 52 Assuredly, days are coming —declares the LORD— When I will deal with her images, And throughout her land the dying shall groan.

content: 53 Though Babylon should climb to the skies, Though she fortify her strongholds up to heaven, The ravagers would come against her from Me —declares the LORD.
content_old: 53 Though Babylon should climb to the skies, Though she fortify her strongholds up to heaven, The ravagers would come against her from Me —declares the LORD.

content: 54 Hark! an outcry from Babylon, Great destruction from the land of the Chaldeans.
content_old: 54 Hark! an outcry from Babylon, Great destruction from the land of the Chaldeans.

content: 55 For the LORD is ravaging Babylon; He will put an end to her great din, Whose roar is like waves of mighty waters, Whose tumultuous noise resounds.
content_old: 55 For the LORD is ravaging Babylon; He will put an end to her great din, Whose roar is like waves of mighty waters, Whose tumultuous noise resounds.

content: 56 For a ravager is coming upon Babylon, Her warriors shall be captured, their bows shall be snapped. For the LORD is a God of requital, He deals retribution.
content_old: 56 For a ravager is coming upon Babylon, Her warriors shall be captured, their bows shall be snapped. For the LORD is a God of requital, He deals retribution.

content: 57 I will make her officials and wise men drunk, Her governors and prefects and warriors; And they shall sleep an endless sleep, Never to awaken —declares the King whose name is LORD of Hosts.
content_old: 57 I will make her officials and wise men drunk, Her governors and prefects and warriors; And they shall sleep an endless sleep, Never to awaken —declares the King whose name is LORD of Hosts.

content: 58 Thus said the LORD of Hosts: Babylon’s broad wall shall be knocked down, And her high gates set afire. Peoples shall labor for naught, And nations have wearied themselves for fire.
content_old: 58 Thus said the LORD of Hosts: Babylon’s broad wall shall be knocked down, And her high gates set afire. Peoples shall labor for naught, And nations have wearied themselves for fire.

content: 59 The instructions that the prophet Jeremiah gave to Seraiah son of Neriah son of Mahseiah, when the latter went with King Zedekiah of Judah to Babylonia, in the fourth year of Zedekiah’sreign. Seraiah was quartermaster.
content_old: 59 The instructions that the prophet Jeremiah gave to Seraiah son of Neriah son of Mahseiah, when the latter went with King Zedekiah of Judah to Babylonia, in the fourth year of Zedekiah’sreign. Seraiah was quartermaster.

content: 60 Jeremiah wrote down in one scroll all the disaster that would come upon Babylon, all these things that are written concerning Babylon.
content_old: 60 Jeremiah wrote down in one scroll all the disaster that would come upon Babylon, all these things that are written concerning Babylon.

content: 61 And Jeremiah said to Seraiah, “When you get to Babylon, see that you read out all these words.
content_old: 61 And Jeremiah said to Seraiah, “When you get to Babylon, see that you read out all these words.

content: 62 And say, ‘O LORD, You Yourself have declared concerning this place that it shall be cut off, without inhabitant, man or beast; that it shall be a desolation for all time.’
content_old: 62 And say, ‘O LORD, You Yourself have declared concerning this place that it shall be cut off, without inhabitant, man or beast; that it shall be a desolation for all time.’

content: 63 And when you finish reading this scroll, tie a stone to it and hurl it into the Euphrates.
content_old: 63 And when you finish reading this scroll, tie a stone to it and hurl it into the Euphrates.

content: 1 Zedekiah was twenty-one years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem for eleven years. His mother’s name was Hamutal, daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah.
content_old: 1 Zedekiah was twenty-one years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem for eleven years. His mother’s name was Hamutal, daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah.

content: 2 He did what was displeasing to the LORD, just as Jehoiakim had done.
content_old: 2 He did what was displeasing to the LORD, just as Jehoiakim had done.

content: 3 Indeed, Jerusalem and Judah were a cause of anger for the LORD, so that He cast them out of His presence. Zedekiah rebelled against the king of Babylon.
content_old: 3 Indeed, Jerusalem and Judah were a cause of anger for the LORD, so that He cast them out of His presence. Zedekiah rebelled against the king of Babylon.

content: 4 And in the ninth year of his reign, on the tenth day of the tenth month, King Nebuchadrezzar moved against Jerusalem with his whole army. They besieged it and built towers against it all around.
content_old: 4 And in the ninth year of his reign, on the tenth day of the tenth month, King Nebuchadrezzar moved against Jerusalem with his whole army. They besieged it and built towers against it all around.

content: 5 The city continued in a state of siege until the eleventh year of King Zedekiah.
content_old: 5 The city continued in a state of siege until the eleventh year of King Zedekiah.

content: 6 By the ninth day of the fourth month, the famine had become acute in the city; there was no food left for the common people.
content_old: 6 By the ninth day of the fourth month, the famine had become acute in the city; there was no food left for the common people.

content: 7 Then the wall of the city was breached. All the soldiers fled; they left the city by night through the gate between the double walls, which is near the king’s garden—the Chaldeans were all around the city—and they set out for the Arabah.
content_old: 7 Then the wall of the city was breached. All the soldiers fled; they left the city by night through the gate between the double walls, which is near the king’s garden—the Chaldeans were all around the city—and they set out for the Arabah.

content: 8 But the Chaldean troops pursued the king, and they overtook Zedekiah in the steppes of Jericho, as his entire force left him and scattered.
content_old: 8 But the Chaldean troops pursued the king, and they overtook Zedekiah in the steppes of Jericho, as his entire force left him and scattered.

content: 9 They captured the king and brought him before the king of Babylon at Riblah, in the region of Hamath; and he put him on trial.
content_old: 9 They captured the king and brought him before the king of Babylon at Riblah, in the region of Hamath; and he put him on trial.

content: 10 The king of Babylon had Zedekiah’s sons slaughtered before his eyes; he also had all the officials of Judah slaughtered at Riblah.
content_old: 10 The king of Babylon had Zedekiah’s sons slaughtered before his eyes; he also had all the officials of Judah slaughtered at Riblah.

content: 11 Then the eyes of Zedekiah were put out, and he was chained in bronze fetters. The king of Babylon brought him to Babylon and put him in prison, where he remained to the day of his death.
content_old: 11 Then the eyes of Zedekiah were put out, and he was chained in bronze fetters. The king of Babylon brought him to Babylon and put him in prison, where he remained to the day of his death.

content: 12 On the tenth day of the fifth month—that was the nineteenth year of King Nebuchadrezzar, the king of Babylon—Nebuzaradan, the chief of the guards, came to represent the king of Babylon in Jerusalem.
content_old: 12 On the tenth day of the fifth month—that was the nineteenth year of King Nebuchadrezzar, the king of Babylon—Nebuzaradan, the chief of the guards, came to represent the king of Babylon in Jerusalem.

content: 13 He burned the House of the LORD, the king’s palace, and all the houses of Jerusalem; he burned down the house of every notable person.
content_old: 13 He burned the House of the LORD, the king’s palace, and all the houses of Jerusalem; he burned down the house of every notable person.

content: 14 The entire Chaldean force that was with the chief of the guards tore down all the walls of Jerusalem on every side.
content_old: 14 The entire Chaldean force that was with the chief of the guards tore down all the walls of Jerusalem on every side.

content: 15 The remnant of the people left in the city, the defectors who had gone over to the king of Babylon, and what remained of the craftsmen were taken into exile by Nebuzaradan, the chief of the guards. But some of the poorest elements of the population—
content_old: 15 The remnant of the people left in the city, the defectors who had gone over to the king of Babylon, and what remained of the craftsmen were taken into exile by Nebuzaradan, the chief of the guards. But some of the poorest elements of the population—

content: 16 some of the poorest in the land—were left by Nebuzaradan, the chief of the guards, to be vine-dressers and field hands.
content_old: 16 some of the poorest in the land—were left by Nebuzaradan, the chief of the guards, to be vine-dressers and field hands.

content: 17 The Chaldeans broke up the bronze columns of the House of the LORD, the stands, and the bronze tank that was in the House of the LORD; and they carried all the bronze away to Babylon.
content_old: 17 The Chaldeans broke up the bronze columns of the House of the LORD, the stands, and the bronze tank that was in the House of the LORD; and they carried all the bronze away to Babylon.

content: 18 They also took the pails, scrapers, snuffers, sprinkling bowls, ladles, and all the other bronze vessels used in the service.
content_old: 18 They also took the pails, scrapers, snuffers, sprinkling bowls, ladles, and all the other bronze vessels used in the service.

content: 19 The chief of the guards took whatever was of gold and whatever was of silver: basins, fire pans, sprinkling bowls, pails, lampstands, ladles, and jars.
content_old: 19 The chief of the guards took whatever was of gold and whatever was of silver: basins, fire pans, sprinkling bowls, pails, lampstands, ladles, and jars.

content: 20 The two columns, the one tank and the twelve bronze oxen which supported it, and the stands, which King Solomon had provided for the House of the LORD—all these objects contained bronze beyond weighing.
content_old: 20 The two columns, the one tank and the twelve bronze oxen which supported it, and the stands, which King Solomon had provided for the House of the LORD—all these objects contained bronze beyond weighing.

content: 21 As for the columns, each was eighteen cubits high and twelve cubits in circumference; it was hollow, and was four fingers thick.
content_old: 21 As for the columns, each was eighteen cubits high and twelve cubits in circumference; it was hollow, and was four fingers thick.

content: 22 It had a bronze capital above it; the height of each capital was five cubits, and there was a meshwork decorated with pomegranates about the capital, all made of bronze; and so for the second column, also with pomegranates.
content_old: 22 It had a bronze capital above it; the height of each capital was five cubits, and there was a meshwork decorated with pomegranates about the capital, all made of bronze; and so for the second column, also with pomegranates.

content: 23 There were ninety-six pomegranates facing outward; all the pomegranates around the meshwork amounted to one hundred.
content_old: 23 There were ninety-six pomegranates facing outward; all the pomegranates around the meshwork amounted to one hundred.

content: 24 The chief of the guards also took Seraiah the chief priest and Zephaniah, the deputy priest, and the three guardians of the threshold.
content_old: 24 The chief of the guards also took Seraiah the chief priest and Zephaniah, the deputy priest, and the three guardians of the threshold.

content: 25 And from the city he took a eunuch who was in command of the soldiers; seven royal privy councilors, who were present in the city; the scribe of the army commander, who was in charge of mustering the people of the land; and sixty of the common people who were inside the city.
content_old: 25 And from the city he took a eunuch who was in command of the soldiers; seven royal privy councilors, who were present in the city; the scribe of the army commander, who was in charge of mustering the people of the land; and sixty of the common people who were inside the city.

content: 26 Nebuzaradan, the chief of the guards, took them and brought them to the king of Babylon at Riblah.
content_old: 26 Nebuzaradan, the chief of the guards, took them and brought them to the king of Babylon at Riblah.

content: 27 The king of Babylon had them struck down and put to death at Riblah, in the region of Hamath. Thus Judah was exiled from its land.
content_old: 27 The king of Babylon had them struck down and put to death at Riblah, in the region of Hamath. Thus Judah was exiled from its land.

content: 28 This is the number of those whom Nebuchadrezzar exiled in the seventh year: 3,023 Judeans.
content_old: 28 This is the number of those whom Nebuchadrezzar exiled in the seventh year: 3,023 Judeans.

content: 29 In the eighteenth year of Nebuchadrezzar, 832 persons were exiled from Jerusalem.
content_old: 29 In the eighteenth year of Nebuchadrezzar, 832 persons were exiled from Jerusalem.

content: 30 And in the twenty-third year of Nebuchadrezzar, Nebuzaradan, the chief of the guards, exiled 745 Judeans. The total amounted to 4,600 persons.
content_old: 30 And in the twenty-third year of Nebuchadrezzar, Nebuzaradan, the chief of the guards, exiled 745 Judeans. The total amounted to 4,600 persons.

content: 31 In the thirty-seventh year of the exile of King Jehoiachin of Judah, on the twenty-fifth day of the twelfth month, King Evil-merodach of Babylon, in the year he became king, took note of King Jehoiachin of Judah and released him from prison.
content_old: 31 In the thirty-seventh year of the exile of King Jehoiachin of Judah, on the twenty-fifth day of the twelfth month, King Evil-merodach of Babylon, in the year he became king, took note of King Jehoiachin of Judah and released him from prison.

content: 32 He spoke kindly to him, and gave him a throne above those of other kings who were with him in Babylon.
content_old: 32 He spoke kindly to him, and gave him a throne above those of other kings who were with him in Babylon.

content: 33 He removed his prison garments and Jehoiachin ate regularly in his presence the rest of his life.
content_old: 33 He removed his prison garments and Jehoiachin ate regularly in his presence the rest of his life.
